loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the loan of 60,000 KES to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat's son has been running a business of shoe-making for many years. Her son is also shown in the photo with her. He makes a good amount of income to bear his family expenses. Zeenat is very concerned about her son's business. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles for her son. In this way, he can handle the growing demand for his shoes in the market and therefore better support his family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles for her son's business.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz  is 46 years old, a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband(also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Aygabats village in the Shirak region, where he lives with his wife and 31-year-old son. He keeps four cows, 7 calves and hens and also cultivates wheat, barley and potato.  Hovhannes and his family work hard to sustain their living with income from agriculture. 

Because the farm is in the developing stage, Hovhannes needs some funds to invest in it. He asks lenders to support him to purchase fertilizer and natural pesticides for the land cultivation. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hovhanne's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.  Hovhannes hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge his agribusiness, so the family will have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and natural pesticides for the land cultivation

loans.name: Waillat

texts.en:
Waillat is shown in the photo with her husband.  She is 42 years old, married and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Waillat  makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 50000 PKR which she will use  to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Waillat  wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Markus Mai'unguwa

texts.en: Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Markus joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Markus  will have access to high quality farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Markus has set high goals of harvesting 15 bags of maize. With increased yields and income, Markus has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double the yield and income

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 25 years old and with his big family he lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. He is married and with his wife, his parents and his brother and sister they live and run farming. Ara works as a policeman but he has enough time for farming. In his farm he has cows, calves heifers, pigs, sheep and chickens.  With his brother Ara sells a lot of farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and also vegetables such as potato, cucumber, peppers and greens. He also has orchard full of apple, apricot and cherry trees. As he likes to say for his big lovely family he has big and nice farm, which is the main source of income for all of them. 

This loan Ara asks as he wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for his land cultivation works and also he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle and to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children’s school fee

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a single man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own several motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, vaccum flasks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, flasks. His business goal is to be a great supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, flasks

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is 24 years old, and he is recently married. With his nice wife, mother and sister, Nver lives in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. Nver is the only breadwinner in his family, and quite frankly he overcomes this hardship perfectly and with great honor he copes every day. 

Nver has a small farm where he has cows, heifers and sheep, and he sells milk and meat from his farm. Nver also has a tractor on which he provides agricultural services all over his village and even all over his region. He is happy and proud that his family, thanks to his occupation, has neither great needs nor lack of finances for their primary needs. So, Nver is asking for this loan as he wants to enlarge the list of his tractor services for farmers. He will buy a hay mowing machine with this loan, which will surely be in great demand amongst the villagers and enlarge the total number of his orders.

loans.use: to buy a hay mowing machine, which will surely have great demand amongst the villagers and enlarge the total number of his orders

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 24 year old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and one child, still studying. Her husband owns a fishing shop and he is the main income source in the family, to be able to enhance their way of living. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her child's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her child's educational fees

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a married man, with 2 children. He describes himself to be enterprising. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, cooking fat, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are busy. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar,washing soap and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar,washing soap and other items

loans.name: Kweboni Ehi Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Kweboni Ehi, which is comprised of six hardworking women. They are engaged in the sale of napkins, materials, cooked rice and stew, ornaments and fresh fish. 

Priscila is 34 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the town of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past 6 years, she has been working hard selling assorted napkins. This loan will help her to generate greater profits so that she can pay the school fees for her children and also take care of her home. 

The members of the group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan. 

Priscilla hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more assorted napkins and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. She has now requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Ezekiel Danjuma

texts.en: Ezekiel Danjuma  is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ezekiel Danjuma  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel Danjuma  now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus is 44 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 3 and 21 years, they all go to school. He sells clothes and has been in a business for the past 5 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shirts and short trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and short trousers for sale and pay school fees

loans.name: Ibrahim Mati

texts.en:
Ibrahim Mati is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Ibrahim Mati joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ibrahim Mati suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to provide healthcare for his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ibrahim Mati has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Ibrahim Mati can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Abdellatif

texts.en: Abdellatif is 35 years old from Minia. He is single and lives with his parents and 4 siblings. Abdellatif has a clothing sales project and he requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing for men, women and kids to increase his sales especially in Ramadan and the feast season.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Eznah

texts.en:
Eznah is 27 years old and she supports 1 child.
 
She has been selling clothes in the market for 1 year, and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market so as to meet her client's needs.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market so as to meet her client's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 39 years old, married to Felisters and supports a family of 4 children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 7 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Cornelius has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs and certified seeds for high production and supply to increase his income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and certified seeds for high production and supply

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 27 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband.  In order to help him financially, she started her own business and opened a clothing shop in 2012. She sells different clothing designs for women and she is well known in her town by her talent. 

To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a new clothing collection for her business with the aim to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a new clothing collection

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline is a Kiva borrower. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, sugar, flour, bread, salt, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. She will use the anticipated profits to open other business outlets.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Inter-Net Group

texts.en:
Marie is a member of Inter-net solidarity group. She sells slippers. Marie has been selling since 1995. She uses the proceeds of her business to pay for her children's education and to provide a livelihood for her family.

Marie and the other group members of the Inter-net solidarity are requesting their first loan. Marie and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Marie is in the far left of the picture. Of this amount, Marie will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase dozens of different types of slippers for her business. 

Marie has been married for fifty-five years and has six children ages thirty-four, twenty-nine, twenty-six, twenty-four, twenty-one and seventeen. Marie hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Marie hopes that this loan will provide her with more profit to support her family. 

Marie and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase different types of slippers for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, and onions. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions and cabbages. 

Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other business branches.

loans.use: buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, and cabbages

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates an auto repair business where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 1 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are both private and commercial. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a tool box and other repair equipment. 

His business goal is to have a furnished auto garage within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. He will use the anticipated profits to pay bills and manage expenses.

loans.use: buy a tool box and other repair equipment

loans.name: Emzari

texts.en:
Emzar is 51 years old. He lives in the Senaki district with his wife, 2 children and pensioner mother. Emzar works at local hotel as an administrator and gets 400 GEL monthly salary. This is the only source of income for his family.  

Emzar is very motivated to have a more stable income and decided to start a family business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a special equipment and will produce lemonade to sell. His wife will also help him to increase family income and Emzar hopes that the business will be successful and he will be able to expand the business in future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and to start producing lemonade to sell as a family business

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Yakubu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yakubu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 45 bags of maize this year, Yakubu can now ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Chi Stephen

texts.en:
He is married with five children and lives in an eight bedroom house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, including the death of his only brother who was very supportive of him and the family at large, his inability to pay the children’s school fees and inadequate capital to start up a business.

He has taken and successfully repaid his loan five times, and he says with this new loan requested, he will buy piglets, chicks and feed, repair the pig fence, and buy seedlings and fertilizers. He has a positive view of the business succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time; he has a steady market and steady customers. With this business activity, the community members will benefit from available food and manure for farming. 

With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three square meals per day, pay for his family's medication, pay for his children’s education, and provide them with other basic necessities. He will also plough back part of the profits and do repairs on his house. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chicks, feed, and seedlings and to build a fence.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIOMBOUGOU, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec CHATA la personne au milieu sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, who average 35 years of age with five children each; they all live in polygamous families in Diombougou, in the Kadiana municipality, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter. They are on their fifth loan from the institution and their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Chata, who is the person standing in the middle of the photo, grows rice and groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain 3.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 200,000FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband out with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old, married and blessed with five children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell. 

She will use the loan to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm in the hope this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. 

Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm in the hope this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell to support her family.

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en:
Nafiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Majidadi Village. 

Nafiu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Nafiu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nafiu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 29 years old. He is married with two children aged between 2 and 4 years; one of them goes to school. He owns a shop and has been doing this for the past eight years. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 41-year-old married mother of six children who started her current Tupperware and clothes selling business in January 2014. She runs the business from her house to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. She helps in particular with the increasing school tuition fees since all of the children are enrolled in private schools.

Since Khadija is new in her business she needs external financial support to increase her business capital and diversify her products. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with Tupperware and the special summer release clothes collection.

She hopes that in the future she can move her business outside her house and attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with Tupperware and the special summer release clothes collection.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIOMBOUGOU, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide, le fonio et le mais avec ALIMA la personne au milieu sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 175 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 31 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Diombougou, in the Kadiana municipality, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter. They are on their fifth loan from the institution and their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Alima, who is the person standing in the middle of the photo, grows rice, groundnut, fonio and corn. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain three hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 175,000FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband out with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Diantoyerela  1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DIANTOYERELA  1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: riz, l’arachide, l’haricot et le mais avec MINATA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 4,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 270 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Diantoyerela 1 group are married women, who average 28 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter. They are on their third loan from the institution and their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Minata, who is the person standing on the far left of the photo, grows rice, groundnut, beans and corn. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain 4.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 270,000FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband out with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Diantoyerela 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DIANTOYERELA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et le mais avec FANTA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Diantoyerela 2 group are married women, who average 30 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter. They are on their third loan from the institution and their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Fanta, who is the person standing on the left of the photo, grows rice and corn. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 120,000FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband out with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Amistad está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo donde todas ellas están muy contentas por poder trabajar de manera unida para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y también a sus familias.
La Sra. María solicita  este préstamo para invertir y fortalecer más su negocio de peluquería ya que necesita comprar shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, y otros insumos. Comenta que con su negocio se ha abierto camino y que ya es muy conocida, pero al principio le fue muy difícil.
Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día y por medio de eso poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The "La Amistad" (Friendship) group is in its first loan cycle in the committee program. It is a new group and all of them are very happy to be able to work in a way that helps each other and their families.

Maria requests this loan to invest in and strengthen her hair salon. She needs to purchase shampoo, rinses, hair dye, creams, and other supplies. She tells us that her business has opened a path for her and she is now very well known, but it was difficult at the beginning. She is putting forth her best effort to be able to grow and improve each day so that she can give her family everything that she did not have.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, rinses, hair dye, creams, and other supplies.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Waziri Village. Aliyu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Aliyu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Aliyu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

Aliyu can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To access high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably

loans.name: Tuyukua Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tuyukua está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas las integrantes se pusieron como meta poder crecer cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y sacrificadas.
Se destaca la Sra. Blanca, quien se dedica a la elaboración de trabajos en ñanduti, el cual es un tejido típico paraguayo. Ella comenta que le gustaría poder hacer conocer a muchas personas este hermoso trabajo que viene haciendo. También comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, agujas, tintes y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus trabajos en ñanduti. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Tuyukua group is receiving its fifth loan as a women's group. They are from the city of Caacupé. All of the members have set the goal for each person to grow, not just financially, but also personally. They are very determined and selfless.

Blanca makes a living by creating products in ñanduti, which is a typical Paraguayan weaving style. She comments that she would like many people to know about the beautiful work that she does. She also tells us that, through her job, she is able to help her family and her loved ones.

She requests this loan to purchase thread, needles, dyes, and other products so that she can continue to make products in ñanduti. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve every day.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SOCOURANI, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz,  l’arachide et le mil avec MASSITAN la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 125 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women, who average 41 years of age with five children each; they all live in polygamous families in Socourani, in the Kadiana municipality, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Massitan, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows rice, groundnut and millet. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 125,000FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband out with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas las integrantes se comprometieron a poner lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y mejorar. Además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luz quien se destaca por ser una señora humilde y trabajadora.
Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, que vende de manera ambulante, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar pese a sus escasos recursos.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia group is in its third cycle as a women's program. All of the members promise to put forth their best effort in order to grow and improve. They are also completing the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Luz, who is known for being a humble, hardworking woman. She makes a living by selling natural medicines door to door. Her job provides her with the means to help her family and loved ones.

She requests this loan in order to purchase natural medicines to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve despite her lack of resources.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina Mae is 18 years old and is the seventh of the eight children in the family. Her mother Gina, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Gina Mae is studying for a bachelor of science in information technology and is currently in the second of this 2-year course.

Gina is borrowing PHP 4,670 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Gina Mae for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Gina Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 24-year-old lady from Falakata. She is married and a mother of an infant son. She was deprived of education in her childhood due to her family's financial issues. Minati resides in a small village named Mukuldanga in the Falakata, CoochBehar district of West Bengal. 

Her husband, being a mason, has a very inconsistent income and is unable to cover all the household expenses of the family. Minati, being a housewife, runs an animal husbandry. She owns milking cows, and the milk is sold to her local villagers. 

Currently, she wants to invest in her milk-selling business to cope with the growing demand of her customers. So Minati applied for a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase another dairy cow. 

She hopes she will increase her income and thereby increase her savings, which is very much essential for future emergencies. It will also help to expand her business for her family’s well-being.   

Minati extends her deep gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 24-year-old independent woman from Falakata, in the state of West Bengal. She stays with her husband and one son in their own small house. Her husband is a driver by profession. He has no regular income and it is not always possible for him to raise all the household costs. That's why it is crucial for Sandhya to earn a living for herself and her family. Her son is an infant and has not started going to school.

Apart from managing household chores and looking after her kid, Sandhya also runs a cattle rearing business. Due to the irregular nature of her husband's occupation, she started this small-scale micro-enterprise by purchasing one milking cow a few years ago. She earns close to half of her family's total income, and she has become an important earner for the family.  

Since there is a consistent demand for cow milk in her village, she sees this as an opportunity to flourish and wants to scale up her business by buying a new cow. This venture will require her to shell out a lump sum. Sandhya, who lacks funds, seeks a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to fulfill her purpose. 

This loan will help her increase her savings and secure her future. She desires to construct a concrete house for the family.

Sandhya is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Harani

texts.en:
Harani is a 41-year-old woman entrepreneur who has a strong determination to contribute to her family and to educate her sons enough. That spirit gives Harani a new inspiration to exist in a better manner in her daily life. 

Harani lives in a small village, Chuakhola in Falakata, with her husband, Amal, and three sons in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw). Two of her sons are going to school, and the other one is involved with a small job.

Her family tried hard to survive in the fittest way, and her husband works in agricultural activities, growing seasonal vegetables. So, there has always been a chance of uncertainty present in every day.

Harani somehow tries to supplement her husband's meager income by supplying milk and cattle byproducts (cow dung) to her neighbors. She wants to expand her dairy business by purchasing another cow. This gives her an opportunity to produce more milk and earn sufficient money, which may secure not only her future, but her family’s future as well.

Harani is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS for expanding her existing business. With the loan amount, she will be able to increase the quantity of milk, which may enhance her capacity for earning money.

Harani gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for considering her capability and courage.

loans.use: to purchase one cow to enhance her dairy business.

loans.name: Sanasar

texts.en:
Sanasar is a farmer from Ashotsq village, of the Shirak region. He is a father of three grown up children and the beloved husband of his wife. For many years already , Sanasar's only occupation has been in the farming business. He currently runs livestock consiting of five cows, twenty sheep and some calves. His wife helps him with getting different types of dairy products (cheese, sour cream, butter) which Sanasar sells locally.

He asks for this loan to purchase 13 sheep, 2 calves and seeds for land cultivation. AFter this investment in the farm, the family's income will significantly increase. They will live in better conditions as a result,

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Sanasar's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for 13 sheep, 2 calves and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Murshida

texts.en:
Murshida is a 29-year-old married woman from Falakata, in Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She lives with her husband in their semi-concrete house. Both of them were deprived of education in their young ages. They can only sign their names. 

Murshida's husband runs a grocery store in the neighboring area. Murshida also helps her husband in this business after finishing her household jobs. They sell the things of daily necessity that are widely consumed by the local people. Since the income they get from the shop is used also for supporting the family, sometimes they do not have enough capital for getting new goods for their shop. Now, Murshida wants to put more stock of items for selling in her shop so that the earnings become more sufficient for their household. Due to lack of finances, she is unable to broaden her business, which is the only lifeline for the family. She came across friends in the village who told her about Kiva loans. 

So, Murshida has applied for a business loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. With the assistance of the loan she will be able to get more edible oil, biscuits, bread, cereals, snacks, etc., for their grocery shop to sell and generate more income. She has a dream to expand her grocery business in the future.

Murshida is very happy and thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock of inventory for the grocery store.

loans.name: Saradini

texts.en:
Saradini is a 25-year-old woman living with her husband and their three children (a son and two daughters). Two of them are students and one is a preschooler. Her husband, Sanjay, is 30 years old and a farmer. They live at Dalimpur, a remote village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. Saradini studied till fifth standard. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Saradini's husband cultivates vegetables. He harvests and sells the produce in the local markets with the help of Saradini. Now they want to grow paddy (rice). It is the staple food for the people of their locality and has a good demand in the market. 

They have a very good relationship with their customers, as they supply quality products at cheaper rates and on time.  But due to shortage of funds they are unable to fulfill their new idea of cultivating paddy on a large scale to provide better economic conditions to their family. As such, Saradini is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

She hopes she will earn more income from this business to improve their living conditions. In the future, she dreams to construct a concrete house with the profit generated from paddy cultivation.

She is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SOCOURANI, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mil avec YAMA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1 hectare. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Socourani, in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 4th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Yama, standing on the left in the picture, grows rice, groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 60 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SOCOURANI, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women with an average age of 26 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Socourani, in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 4th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Tata, standing in the middle in the picture, grows rice, groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 2 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 120 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras  se formó en la ciudad de Itá, son 18 mujeres emprendedoras que se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder dar lo mejor a sus familias. Además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por superarse cada día.
Delma, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la costura, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que le va muy bien y ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le llevan muchos pedidos. Delma está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante y poco a poco ir mejorando por medio de su lucha y esfuerzo. Quiere poder ir superándose cada día y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus confecciones, para poder cumplir con sus clientes y con los pedidos que tiene. Está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer cada día.
texts.en:
The group called "Las Emprendedoras" (the female entrepreneurs) was formed in the city of Ita. It consists of 18 female entrepreneurs who help each other be able to provide the best for their families. They are also part of a poverty-elimination program, working hard to become better each day. 
Delma, one of the members, is a seamstress, she is good at what she does and this is why she is doing well for herself and has a good customer base that is always bringing her many orders. Delma is giving her all to be able to grow and get ahead and slowly improve through her hard work and effort. She wants to become better each day and this is why she works so hard.
She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons and other materials to continue with her production in order to be able to satisfy her customers and fulfill the orders she currently has. She is happy for the opportunity she receives to grow each day.

loans.use: purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials for production

loans.name: Danagnogona 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DANAGNOGONA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MORON, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et l’haricot avec DJENEBOU ISSA la 2ème personne de la gauche à la droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danagnogona 3 group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 2 children, who all live in polygamous families in Moron, in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 9th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Djenebou Issa, standing second from the left in the picture, grows rice, groundnuts, and beans. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 3 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 180 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 47-year-old resident of a remote village called Ramthenga in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a housewife and blessed with two sons. Her husband Shyamchand is engaged in vegetable cultivation. Her sons are also engaged with some income-generating work to support the family financially.

Sabita's husband grows seasonal vegetables. Sabita also helps her husband with farming activities. The income generated from the farming is the main source of income for the family. They grow different varieties of seasonal crops in different seasons and sell the harvest product in the nearby village market. 

Now Sabita has decided to cultivate bottle gourds on their small piece of land, as this vegetable has much demand in summer in West Bengal. So, she asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase bottle gourd seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies to cultivate bottle gourds. She hopes to earn a good profit from this cultivation.

Her goal is to increase and improve production, which would help her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Sabita expressed her gratitude to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for bottle gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Danagnogona   1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DANAGNOGONA 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MORON, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. They are on their 9th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Mamou, sitting in the middle in the picture, grows rice, groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 4 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 240 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Danagnogona 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DANAGNOGONA 2sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MORON, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec KADIA la 2ère personne de la droite à la gauche sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 6 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 360 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danagnogona 2 group are married women with an average age of 42 and, on average, 2 children, who all live in polygamous families in Moron, in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 9th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Kadia, sitting second from the right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 6 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 360 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Paravati

texts.en:
Paravati is 26 years old. She is a housewife and received primary education till grade 5. Her husband, Krishna, is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live in their own kaccha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar with their only son. 

Her husband is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables. He usually sells his crops at the market in his area. His produce has good demand in the market. Raising crops takes a lot of strength. This needs very hard work, and that's why Paravati helps him in agricultural work after managing her household work.  

Now they have decided to start teasel gourd cultivation on their land. Paravati needs some capital to grow teasel gourd. They chose the crop because it is a profitable one, and there is great demand in their rural market. So Paravati applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of teasel gourd.

This business will give Paravati an opportunity to earn more profits to fulfill her dreams, such as the financial development of their family, providing education to her son and improving the business to secure their future.

In the future she dreams to purchase a tractor with the profit from this business.

Her thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of teasel gourd.

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
Tapasi is a 30-year-old rural housewife. She lives in a remote region of Falakata in West Bengal, India with her husband, Shyamal, and two children (one son and one daughter). One of them attends school and the other one is a toddler. Tapasi studied up to grade 10 but the poor economic resources of her parents did not provide her with further education. 

Tapasi's husband runs a small grocery shop which is the only source of income for their family. He sells daily necessities like sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. Tapasi also takes care of the shop. At first, their business was not going well, but now they are able to turn the tide in their favor and are making good sales these days. They want to take advantage of their good fortune. Now they would like to stock their shop with more variety to extend a better service to their customers as well as to strengthen the family economy.

Very recently, Tapasi applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to restock the store with more grocery items to fulfill the customers' demand so that she will retain and encourage more customers. She hopes the loan will generate more income and expand their business to make their dreams come true.

She is very happy after getting the loan and gives thanks to her generous lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of grocery items for their modest grocery store

loans.name: Menaka

texts.en:
Menaka is a 43-year-old woman. She studied till grade 6. She is married and the mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Both are students in a local school. They live in their own house in a village called Kalipur in Falakata.

Menaka is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. At a very young age, he started working in agriculture because his family has been involved in this profession for generations. Menaka and her husband work together to give their family better well-being. This business is the only source of income for their family, but it is hardly sufficient to cover the household expenses of a family of four members.

Menaka dreams to give her children a quality life. She wants to provide them with the opportunity to study so that they can develop and become successful in the future, so she needs to expand their business. Now they decided to cultivate maize on a large scale, so she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate more quantities of maize.

She hopes that the loan will be helpful to grow their business, which will ensure good revenue to overcome their financial hurdles. She has a long cherished dream to construct a decent concrete house to live in, which she hopes to fulfill with the additional profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow maize

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati hails from Falakata. She is 26 years old, married, and a housewife. She and her husband, Tapash, together are raising two children (one son and one daughter). One is a student in village primary school and the other is a small child. They live in a small village, Singijani, in Falakata, Cooch Behar district, West Bengal. 

Minati's husband is running a business of growing seasonal vegetables. Being a housewife, Minati helps her husband in harvesting and selling their produce at the local markets. It is their sole source of income but is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household. With the addition of paddy cultivation, they will be able to increase their monthly income because paddy is an all-season crop and has a high demand in the market. Due to lack of capital, they are unable to start this cultivation. In order to help her husband, Minati has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start cultivation. 

The loan will help Minati to keep her family afloat and financially stable. She dreams of providing good education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en: Yucabeth is a 54-year-old married woman with 4 children. She sells fruit and vegetables, the business has been profitable. She will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell and hopes  to serve more customers and make more profit. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Danagnogona 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DANAGNOGONA 4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MORON, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide, le fonio et le sésame avec FANTA ZOUMANA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 4 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 240 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danagnogona 4 group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 2 children, who all live in polygamous families in Moron, in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 7th group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Fanta Zoumana, standing on the left in the picture, grows rice, groundnuts, fonio and sesame. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 4 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Kadiana to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 240 000 francs which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay wages.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Waziri Village. Hassan joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Hassan suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Hassan has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Hassan can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary-school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food for animals for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Zawaridi

texts.en: Zawadi is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dalhatu

texts.en:
Dalhatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta Village. Dalhatu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dalhatu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dalhatu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 56 years old, married to Beliah, and supports a family of 5 children. 

He has farmed for 24 years and earns 17,000 KES per month. 

Philip has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his supply of milk and earn  more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Victoria es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, están trabajando para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y también ayudar a sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde trabajan y se esfuerzan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, una de las integrantes, se gana la vida por medio de la venta de prendas variadas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comenta que está luchando para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, que quiere revender y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece la señora por esta oportunidad de crecer y mejorar cada día, y se compromete a poner todo de si para poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called "La Victoria" is a new group in their first loan cycle. They are working to be able to help each other and also help their families. They are in the Poverty Elimination program where they work and make an effort to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Maria who makes her living through selling a variety of clothing. She is a very hard-working woman and she commented that she is striving to be able to help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of clothing that she wants to resell and doing this continue with her work. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow and improve each day and promises to put all her efforts into growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Elianne

texts.es:
Elianne es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, y comenta que su anhelo es trabajar en lo que ella está estudiando para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
Elianne es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder para las cuotas de su carrera y con lo cual poder seguir por sus metas.
texts.en: Elianne is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is studying Law and comments that her desire is to work in what she is studying to improve her conditions in life and that of her family. Elianne is a person who is putting everything into trying to improve and grow. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition for her studies so that she can continue on with her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Mutras

texts.en:
Mutras is a 27-year-old single man who has owned a shop  for 4 years. 

He will use the loan to buy more salt, biscuits, and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits, and sugar.

loans.name: Alhaji Shauibu  .a.

texts.en:
Alhaji Shauibu  .A. is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Gwari Village. Alhaji Shauibu  .A. joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  

In the past, Alhaji Shauibu  .A. farm provided poor yields which inpacted his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Alhaji Shauibu  .A. has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

The loan will provide access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

His goal is to  harvests 500 bags of maize this year and to  ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en: Sale is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsaunin Maiki Village. Sale joined Babban Gona, Kiva's partner, to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sale will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sale now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Celui  qui  tient le coq en main est Dramane.
Dramane est âgé de 54(cinquante-quatre ans). Il a 10 enfants en charge dont leur âge varie entre 2 à 22 ans.
Il fait l’aviculture (élevage de poussins)  depuis quelques années. Cette activité permet à Dramane de prendre sa famille en charge. Il contracte au près du RMCR de l’argent pour améliorer son élevage de volaille.
Il est très respectueux et solidaire. Dramane s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Après quelques mois d’entretien en  nourriture  et  soins  vétérinaires de ses poules, il les revend dans ses mêmes marchés.
Dramane souhaite construire une maison en dure dans une ville.
texts.en: Dramane is the man holding the cockerel. He is 54 years old and has 10 dependent children aged between 2 and 22 years old. Dramane has been a poultry farmer for several years. This business allows Dramane to take care of his family. He is requesting money from the RMCR in order to improve his poultry raising business. He is very respectful and supportive. He gets his supplies at the neighbouring markets. After spending several months nurturing and feeding his chickens and making sure they are given necessary veterinary care, he resells them at the same markets. Dramane would like to build a house in a town someday.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and resell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité LAS EMPRENDEDORAS, inician el primer ciclo del programa COMITÉ DE MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, con todo el entusiasmo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Lucia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a las ventas varias de todo tipo de productos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por mejorar cada día. Ella está trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The Las Emprendedora's committee begins its first cycle of the 'Committee of Entrepreneurial Women' program full of enthusiasm about being able to improve their family's and their own life conditions. Lucia is one of the members, she makes a living selling various products of all types. She is a very hard working person and is putting forth a great effort to improve each day. She is working in order to help her family and her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of drinks, food and other products allowing her to continue her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: purchase drinks, food and other products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy assorted types of medicines for resale.

loans.name: Janette

texts.es:
Janette a la par que estudia también trabaja, y se esfuerza por ser alguien en la vida.
Es aun soltera y vive con sus padres, pero quiere tener la oportunidad de formar su familia. Su aspiración es ir mejorando más tarde una vez recibido.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de la cuota de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios.
texts.en: Janette is working at the same time she is studying and is making an effort to be somebody in life. She is still single and lives with her parents but she wants to have the opportunity to have a family. Her goal is to keep on improving after she graduates. She is requesting this loan to pay tuition for her courses and doing this she can continue with her studies. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her life through her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Ghaitha

texts.en:
