Ghaitha is a 53-year-old married woman with three children, one attends school. Her husband provides the main income source in the family and has worked in construction for many years.  She does not work  outside of the home and cares for her home and family. 

She requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees. She states that she is very thankful to Kiva that allowed her to ensure that her child's  education continues.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Nènè est la femme assise avec la tasse en plastique sur ses pieds contenant de la pomme de terre épluchée avec de la banane Plantin.
Elle est âgée de 46 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles) qui sont scolarisés. Ces enfants sont âgés de 10 à 20 ans. Elle vit dans le milieu rural avec son mari et ses enfants. 
Elle a abandonné l’école classique à partir de la 8ème année. Son mari fait l’agriculture et l’élevage  pour gagner sa vie. Nènè fait le petit commerce depuis 20 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les marchés urbains  et revend dans les marchés locaux. Elle fait recourt aux services financiers de l’IMF (RMCR) pour soutenir son activité de commerce à travers l’achat des sacs de pommes de terre, de patates, de bananes Plantin, des cartons de macaroni, du riz, du petit mil et haricot qu’elle revend au fur et a mesure.
texts.en:
Nènè is the woman who is seated with the plastic basin containing peeled potatoes and plantains on her knees. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of three children (one son and two daughters) who are enrolled in school. These children are between 10 and 20 years of age. Nènè lives in a rural area with her husband and children. 

Nènè left conventional school in the eighth grade. Her husband works in agriculture and livestock raising to earn a living. She has been doing small-scale commerce for 20 years. She buys her stock in urban markets and resells it in local markets. 

Nènè turned to the financial services of the micro-finance institution (RMCR) to support her commercial activity by buying sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, and plantains, rice, local millet, and dried beans, as well as cartons of macaroni, that she will sell little by little.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, and plantains for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a welder and a foster mother. She is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children and 8 orphans.  They live together in the same house.  Her husband works as a meter reader at Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi(ESCOM).  

Currently, the household financial situation is unstable. Combined monthly household income is less than 400 USD. Her husband receives low pay and  her business does poorly (due to price fluctuations).  Martha faces high competition and the couple is having difficulties generating enough income to support the large household.  

Martha has always been interested in raising pigs but lacks capital and knowledge. She sees this loan as an opportunity to start a business, construct and own her own pigsty, and venture into a business which is more profitable than other types of livestock enterprises.  

She looks forward to increasing her capital for her welding business using profits from pig sales.  She will use the manure to grown crops.

Martha’s’ goal is to educate her children to attain a better living of standard and be independent.  In the long-run, she plans to buy farm land, raise pigs, provide a family business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, cement, and receive training.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Dramane B. est un homme, client de la  caisse  de R.M.C.R  depuis 2011. Il est  âgé de 36 ans, père de 5 enfants dont  1 scolarisé. Dramane B. est un emboucheur de bœuf. Il  exerce  ce métier il  y  a  5 ans de cela. Il  s’approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire locale et revend  a la même foire et chez lui . Il achète des bœufs maigres, les  traite, les   nourrit et  les revend.
C’est Dramane qui a la corde du bœuf en main. Dramane B.  réalise   des bénéfices qui lui permettraient d’avoir  plus de moutons. Ces  bénéfices aussi  aident dans  les  charges  familiales et aussi  dans  la  scolarisation et  la santé  de  l’enfant  qui est à l’école.
texts.en: Dramane B. is a man and has been a customer of the RMCR fund since 2011. He is 36 years old and the father of 5 children, one of whom attends school. Dramane B. has been fattening cattle for 5 years. He gets his livestock at the local weekly market and resells it at the same market. He buys lean cattle, treats them, fattens them and resells them. It's Dramane B. who is holding the rope of the cow in the picture. Dramane B. earns profits which will allow him to get more sheep. These profits also help him take care of the family's daily expenses and to cover the educational and health expenses of his school-going child.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 46, is an entrepreneur who sells second hand clothes for a living. A self-starter, Jane is married with 3 children. She also takes care of 7 children who stay in her home. Her husband is a retired civil servant. 

Currently, Jane is facing challenges in her business. She used to sell clothes at an informal market. Recently, there has been a "sweeping" project which involved closing down unauthorized informal markets from operation. This forced Jane to run her business from home which has resulted into loss of customers and less profits. 

To sustain her large household, Jane is thinking big and plans to have another alternative source of generating income.  This loan is an answer to her plan. Jane says that she wants to receive training in pig production plus buy quality high breed pigs that can easily attract the market. Her goal is to mainly supply breeding stock.  The returns from the pig sales should provide school fees for the 10 children. 

Once the enterprise grows, Jane wants to fulfill her dream of buying and owning a car. Jane says that every time she sees a woman driving it moves her heart. She hopes to save part of the returns towards fulfilment of her dream.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and receive training in pig production.

loans.name: Mbuh Eunice

texts.en:
Mbuh Eunice is married with seven children and lives in an eight-bedroom house in Bamenda, Mezam Division, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, death of her only brother who was very supportive to her and the family at large, her inability to pay the children’s fees, and inadequate capital to start up a business.

She has taken and successfully repaid a loan five times and says with this new loan requested, she will  buy   piglets, chicks and  feed, repair pig fence,  buy seedlings and fertilizers. She has a positive view of the business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time; she has a steady market and steady customers. With this business activity, community members will benefit from available   food and manure for farming. 

With the profit from this loan, she will improve her family's standard of living by providing them with three square  meals per day, pay for her family's medications, pay for her children’s' education, and provide them with other basic necessities. She will also plough back part of the profits and do repairs on her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chicks and feed, build a fence, and buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, la carrera que sigue es la de enfermería, ella se considera una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Villarrica.  She is studying and working at the same time.  Her program is nursing.  She considers herself a very sacrificing person who works hard.  

She is asking for a loan in order to pay tuition for her program of study and thereby continue with her degree.  She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve herself.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her program of study in nursing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase meat, vegetables, condiments and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 children. She is a farmer and grows vegetables. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes to produce more farm produce to sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, earn more income, and support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for  four years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.
She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Onds Group

texts.fr: Voyant l'exemple de ses parents, Pierre est devenu riziculteur depuis son jeune âge en 1965. Cela lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille. Souvent, il se heurte à des difficultés d'ordre financier mais estime que ce crédit lui permettra de cultiver des espaces plus grands pouvant accroitre sa production et par ailleurs ses conditions de vie (scolarisation de ses enfants,..). Président du groupe SONGA MBELE, il tient dans sa main gauche un carnet rose.
texts.en: Inspired by the example of his parents, Pierre started growing rice at a young age in 1965. This enables him to take care of his family. He often has financial problems but thinks that this loan will enable him to cultivate larger areas so that he can increase his production and his living conditions as well (including making sure his children get an education). The leader of the Songa Mbele group, he is holding a pink booklet in his left hand.

loans.use: to pay for the work needed to maintain his rice fields.

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en:
Mansir is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Tsaunin Maiki Village. Mansir  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mansir will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mansir now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Eva is from the city of Concepción.  She is a very self-sacrificing person.  She wants to get ahead in order to help her family and her loved ones.  She is studying in the field of Commercial Engineering, and through her education she hopes to open up a career path for herself.  

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in tuition and thereby cover her expenses.

loans.use: to invest in tuition for a program in commercial engineering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional fabric, caustic soda and dyes.

loans.name: Karembo

texts.en:
Karembo is a married woman, and she has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, mangoes, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular people. 

Karembo describes her biggest business challenge to be having a low stock. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
Batool is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She, along with her husband, has had a business of animal selling and purchasing for many years. Through their combined efforts, they are able to manage their household expenses efficiently. 

Now, Batool has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that doesn't have electricity, but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Joanina operates a vegetable stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality at her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES, Joanina wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Bienvenidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BIENVENIDAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Milan la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de coca, venta de faldas, venta de dulces, venta de chamarras.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Milan es integrante, ella indica que es parte de Pro Mujer hace cuatro años, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace diez años, ya que tuvo la necesidad de iniciar algún tipo de negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela y lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Bienvenidas communal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamerican regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Milan is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include selling blankets, selling coca, selling skirts, selling sweets, and selling sweaters.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Milan is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years, and she joined by invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling blankets.  She says that she learned this business from her aunt ten years ago because she needed to start some type of business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy fabric and wool wholesale) that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  After making the goods she will sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially.  She is married, and she has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and wool wholesale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a young, energetic and hardworking business lady who earns a living by selling broiler chickens. At 23, Joyce is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a driver involved in transporting goods and services. Therefore, most times he is on the road running up and down while Joyce spends time at home taking care of their little girl. 

Most of Joyce's customers purchase the chickens on a loan and don’t pay on time. This causes her business to perform dismally, forcing Joyce to look up to her husband for household income support. She feels that to effectively run her household she must minimize her dependency on her husband and have multiple sources of generating income. Hence, she wants to embark in having a piggery. 

Joyce believes that this loan will enable her to receive training in pig production, management and marketing, help her construct a pigsty, and buy a quality breed of pigs as capital. Joyce wants to use part of the returns from pig sales to boost capital for her broiler chicken business, so that when customers delay payment, her business will not be affected and will continue to run. 

As the enterprise grows, Joyce believes that profits realized will help her go back to school and further her education. She wants to major in Business Management in order to become an investor. Her long term goals are first to own a shop in town where she will sell her stock, and secondly, open a grocery near her house where people in her neighborhood can come and buy necessities. She wants to contribute towards development initiatives that target economic growth and wealth creation in Malawi.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, cement for constructing a pigsty, and to receive training in running a piggery

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is married with three children, aged between 9 and 12 years, all of whom go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this in a business for five years. 

With the requested loan, Valentine would like to buy more food for the domestic animals for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more food for the domestic animals for sale.

loans.name: Tamufor Grace

texts.en:
Tamufor Grace is married with seven children, and lives in an eight bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life: death of her only brother who was very supportive of her and the family; her inability to pay her children’s fees; and inadequate capital to start up a business.

Tamufor Grace has taken and successfully repaid loans five times, and says with this new loan requested, she will buy piglets, chicks, feed, seedlings and fertilizers. She will also repair the pig fence. She has a positive view of the business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time. She has a steady market and steady customers. With this business, her community members will benefit from available food and manure for farming.
 
With the profit from this loan, Tamufor Grace will improve her family's standard of living by providing them with three square meals per day, paying for her family's medication, paying for her children’s' education, and providing them with other basic necessities. She will also save part of the profits and do repairs on her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks, feed, seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Imara Onds Group

texts.fr: Jadis agent conducteur à la Sucrerie de Kiliba, Faustin a abandonné ce travail lorsqu'il a constaté que cette société courait les risques de faillite. Il s'est lancé désormais dans la riziculture et il en a actuellement une expérience de 20 ans. Malgré les difficultés d'ordre financier, cette activité lui a permis de mettre sur pied quelques réalisations d'autoprise en charge de sa famille. Il a une visée de cultiver un espace beaucoup plus grand afin d'accroitre sa récolte. Président du groupe IMARA ONDS, il tient sur la photo un carnet rose.
texts.en: Formerly a supervisor at the Kiliba sugar refinery, Faustin gave up this job when he realised this company was close to bankruptcy. He then threw himself into growing rice and he currently has 20 years of experience in this field. Despite the financial difficulties, this activity has allowed him to start to independently support his family. His ambition is to cultivate a larger area of land in order to increase his yield. Faustin is the president of the Imara Onds Group. He is the man holding the pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hoes, fertiliser and phytosanitary products

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбара, 52 года, замужем, 4 детей. Гулбара работает учителем в школе, также они с супругом вместе занимаются животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулбары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 3 овцы, 4 лошади, также есть арендованный земельный надел мерою 2,00 ГА, где Гулбара со своей семьей выращивают ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Гулбара вложит в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, постройку сарая и времянки с кухней.
texts.en: Gulbara is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Gulbara works as a school teacher, and she and her husband also rear animals and grow crops, having started with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulbara's hard work today she has four cows, three sheep, and four horses, and she also has a rented 2.0 hectare plot of land where Gulbara and her family grow barley. In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay for her livestock. Gulbara will invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and building a barn and shelter with a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy feed and hay for her livestock.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto ya se recibió como profesional, gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido, es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder mejorar cada día, hoy esta estudiando nuevamente la carrera de didáctica para poder enseñar en las universidades, y con ello poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is already an established professional thanks to the help that he has received.  He is a person who, through his daily efforts to improve, is studying for another degree in teaching so that he can teach in a university. With this further education he can continue to grow.

Rigoberto is requesting this loan to cover the tuition payments for his degree. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving that is enabling him to improve himself each day.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Sukama Jembe Group

texts.fr: La culture du paddy s'est avérée rentable dans la plaine de la Ruzizi,Muzungu l'a appris de ses parents et cela lui permet de scolariser ses enfants. Quoique les maladies des plantes et les moyens financiers posent problème, il souhaite à la longue élargir son champ afin d'accroitre sa production qui permettra de sa part de répondre favorable aux besoins sociaux. Il est le seul homme du groupe SUKUMA JEMBE qu'il préside.
texts.en: Cultivating rice paddies has proven to be a profitable venture in the Ruzizi Plain. Muzungu learnt this from his parents and this knowledge has allowed him to give his children an education. Though crop diseases and financial matters cause him problems, he hopes to be able to increase the size of his land in order to increase his yield, which will allow him to respond favourably to his social needs. He is the only man in the Sukama Jembe Group, of which he is its president.

loans.use: to purchase phytosanitary products and fertiliser, as well as pay the labour costs to maintain and harvest their land

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Vilage. Samson joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samson will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help Samson earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, which double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Samson would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona farmer from Mai Yamma Talata Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Shehu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan Shehu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his income considerably.

This season, Shehu has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old. She is married with three children, between the ages of 17 and 20 years. All of her children go to school. 

Agnes sells food items and has been doing so for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Stephen

texts.en:
Daniel Stephen is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Daniel Stephen suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to improve his farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria. This allows him to earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Daniel Stephen will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With an ambitious goals of harvesting 100 bags of maize this year, Daniel Stephen can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona farmer from Mai Yamma Talata Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Shehu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his income considerably.  

This season, Shehu has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Bahizi Group

texts.fr: Important pour la survie de sa famille, Murondere a hérité la culture du riz de ses parents. Malgré le manque de moyen pour l'exercice de cette activité et les aléas climatiques, il est optimiste quant à un avenir promettant dans la riziculture par la prise en charge de besoins familiaux et le lancement de construction dans sa parcelle.Président du groupe BAHIZI, il tient dans sa main un carnet rose.
texts.en: The art of growing rice was passed down to Murondere from his parents and this knowledge ensures his own family's survival. Despite a lack of means for carrying out this activity and climatic risks, he remains optimistic about his future rice crops, seeing them as a means of meeting his family's needs and being able to begin construction on his plot of land. He is the president of the Bahizi Group. He is the man holding the pink notebook in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the labour costs to maintain and transplant their crops, as well as to purchase phytosanitary products and fertiliser

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, comenta que sus aspiraciones son la de realizarse a través de sus estudios.
Él está estudiando la carrera de kinesiología y fisioterapia, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en: Cristhian is from the city of Caaguazú. He comments that his goal is to find fulfillment through his studies. He is studying kinesiology and physiotherapy. Through his career he wants to open a path to becoming someone in life. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition and doing this be able to continue his studies, striving to improve each day.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hauwa Daniel

texts.en:
Hauwa Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Hauwa Daniel joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  

In the past, Hauwa Daniel suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to purchase better inputs to improve her yield. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Hauwa Daniel has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Hauwa Daniel can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Adrie

texts.en:
Adrie is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is four years old and who doesn't go to school yet. 

She owns a shop and has been doing this for the past 3 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Iliya Lado

texts.en:
Iliya Lado is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Iliya Lado joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Iliya Lado suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Iliya Lado has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 45 bags of maize this year, Iliya Lado can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRISTALINA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maruja es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de frutas, ventas de chamarras, venta de juegos didácticos, venta de ropa deportivo.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maruja es integrante, ella indica ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de su cuñada que forma parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas  da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su suegra hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro  hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.

En la foto también aparece la esposa del señor Rodolfo Panuñi, es la señora de chaleco anaranjado.
texts.en:
The Cristalina Community Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Santiago II main office. There are nine members in the group which is led by a Board of Directors with Sra. Maruja as president. The members have a range of businesses through which they earn their living: selling blankets, selling fruit, selling jackets, selling educational games, and selling sportswear.

The loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Maruja. She became a member of Pro Mujer at the invitation of her sister-in-law who was already a member. Currently she runs a business selling blankets. Her mother-in-law taught her how to do this several years ago. Maruja plans to use the money to buy wool in bulk which she will get from wholesalers in the town of El Alto. Then after making the blankets she will sell them from her stall. This work enables her to support her family; she has a husband and four children.

When Maruja is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the training they provide.

The extra person in the photo is the wife of Sr. Rodolfo Panuñi. She is wearing an orange vest.

loans.use: buy wool

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, venta de pipocas de maíz, venta de comida y tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace más de  tres años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor)  que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de la Ciudad de El Alto y posterior, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su puesto de venta.
Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
En la foto también aparece el esposo de la señora Nieves.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE HABA” communal bank has started their sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors with Sandra as the Secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Amongst them are: selling blankets, selling fruit, selling vegetables, selling popcorn, selling meals and a neighborhood store.

This loan which they are taking out will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Sandra being one. She indicted that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a promoter for the Institution. She currently has a business selling meals. She said that she learned the business on her own more than three years ago.

The loan that she is now taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying rice and noodles wholesale) which she will acquire at the vendors in the city of El Alto and later after making them, sell in her sales space. This form of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training offered by the institution. Nieves' husband also is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodle wholesale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 18 and 20 years; both of them are married. 

She owns a shop and has been doing this business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more juice, biscuits and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more juice, biscuits and soap to sell.

loans.name: Government Whart Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a member of Government Whart solidarity group.  She sells drinks. Fatmata has been selling drinks for the past two years. Fatmata belongs to a solidarity group of 4 women and one man, who have come together to support each other to achieve their individual dreams. She uses the proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. Fatmata is sitting in the middle of the group picture.

Fatmata and other group members of Government whart solidarity are requesting their first loan. Fatmata and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Fatmata will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase more crates of drinks for her business. 
Fatmata is thirty years old, is married and has a cheerful family of two children. Her children are going to school and are aged five and two. 

Fatmata hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Fatmata hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family. Fatmata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks for her business.

loans.name: Aya Aya N'zinkd Sougri Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est responsable du groupe  AYA AYA N’ZINKD SOUGRI. Mariée elle est mère de 09 enfants. Le plus âgé à 44 ans et le moins âgé a 23 ans. Elle à 08 personnes en charge.
Madame fait la restauration depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz et 05 bidons d’huile.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une  maison qu’elle mettra en location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam is the leader of the Aya Aya N'zinkd Sougri group. She is married with nine children. Her oldest child is 44 years old and the youngest 23. Eight people are dependent on her.
This lady has been working in catering for 15 years. She buys her supplies at the local markets.
With the loan, she wants to buy two sacks of rice and five cans of oil.
She would like to use the profits from the loan to expand her business. Her goal is to build a house that she will rent out.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and five cans of oil.

loans.name: Ereneste

texts.en:
Ereneste is aged 36. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 14 years, 2 of them go to school. 

He owns a bar and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en:
Leontine is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 4 and 6 years, both of them go to school. 

She owns a shop and has been doing this business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a man with an entrepreneurial spirit. When he was only 14, he would already sell fruit and nuts earning what he could in his teenage years. After finishing school, Alexander had a few jobs: he worked at a local factory, then moved to Russia and worked there as a butcher. 

Upon his return to Ukraine he decided to go back to selling fruit and nuts which he is good at. Alexander believes he has a chance in this sphere because he knows where to buy merchandise wholesale and where to sell it retail later. Alexander is originally from Nikopol. He buys his produce in this region and then transports it to big cities like Dnepropetrovsk, Kharkov and Kiev where he sells it to wholesalers at a good price. Alexander is 34. He is married with a teenage daughter. 

Alexander buys strawberries, sweet cherries, grapes, peaches, apricots and walnuts in Nikopol region for further resale in bigger cities in Ukraine. At this moment he is seeking a loan of 70,000 Grivnyas to purchase early sweet cherries and strawberries for further resale. One of Alexander's dreams is to buy land and plant different nut trees there to ensure independent retirement for himself and a better living for his family. However, this dream requires big investments and his business needs to be upgraded to a different level. 

Alexander is working towards that big dream and is planning to re-invest profit generated this season into purchase of land where he would plant lots of strawberries and raspberries for next season's sales.

loans.use: to purchase early sweet cherries and strawberries for further resale.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es casado tiene 62 años de edad tiene 2 hijos, vive con ellos en Guaranda Provinci de Bolivar en la Comunidad Santa Martha. Pertenece a la Ventanilla Rural Nuevos Horizontes conformada por 11 socios.
El se decica a la agricultura a la siembra de maranjilla y maiz, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sus sembrios ya que por falta de dinero no podia comprar los insumos para que sus sembrios salgas mejores, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas y mejorar la economía de su familia. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
62-year old José is married and has two children. They live in Guaranda, Bolivar Province, in the Santa Martha community. José is a member of Nuevos Horizontes, a rural community bank, which has 11 members.

José earns his living growing naranjilla fruit and maize. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his crops. Beforehand he couldn’t afford them so now he hopes for better production. His dream is to buy more land so he can grow more and improve the financial situation of his family.

In his free time José enjoys relaxing and spending time with his children.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Yakubu Aikau

texts.en:
Yakubu Aikau is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Yakubu Aikau joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Yakubu Aikau suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for my children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yakubu Aikau has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie is 65 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 21 and 23 years; both of them go to school. 

She sells soft drinks and has been doing this for 5 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more bananas in order to make soft drinks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to make soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Thergella Joseph

texts.fr: Thergella, 47 ans, est mère de trois enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et les enfants dans la petite ville de Bon Repos. Il y a huit ans de cela, elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires et produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Grace à cette activité, elle arrive à prendre soin de sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Thergella is 47. She has three children. She lives with her husband and her children in the little town of Bon Repos. Eight years ago, she opened a shop selling food products and cosmetic products at her home. This business enables her to provide for her family and to save a little money. She requests a micro-credit to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Bernadett

texts.en:
Bernadett is from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She is a single mom with a 5-year-old daughter. 

Bernadett works at a local factory manufacturing cables. Bernadett is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase some furniture for her house.

Bernadett shares a two-room apartment with her mother and a sister. She and her little daughter live in one of the rooms. Bernadett works hard trying to provide better living standards for her small family of two. She wants to create more comfort for her daughter which is why she wants to buy new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase some furniture for her house.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene 7 hijos vive con su esposo e hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santa Martha, pertenece a la ventanilla Rural Nuevos Horizontes, ella se dedica a la siembra de naranjilla para lo que solicita el credito para poder comprar insumos y fertilizantes, gracias al crédito podra mejorar sus cultivos, las compras realiza en Guaranda y Echeandia, su sueño es tener una finca y en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
37-year old María is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Guaranda, Bolivar Province, in the community of Santa Martha. María is a member of Nuevos Horizontes, a rural community bank.

She earns her living growing naranjilla fruit and is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer so she can improve production. She will buy the supplies in Guaranda and Echeandia.

María’s dream is to have a farm. In her free time she enjoys knitting.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Michelet

texts.fr: Michelet est âgé de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il vit à bon repos et habite chez ses parents. Son activité consiste à vendre de l’huile d’olive par gallon. Cette activité se révèle très rentable, il compte trouver des moyens pour profiter au maximum de cette opportunité.
texts.en: Michelet is 34. He is unmarried and does not have any children. He lives in Bon Repos with his parents. His business consists of  selling olive oil by the gallon. This activity has proved to be very profitable. He intends to find the necessary means to take as much advantage as possible from this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy olive oil.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish and crabs to the locals in her area. She is a 43-year-old married woman with seven children from  Getafe, Bohol. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 3. Her husband is a fisherman. They work together for the welfare of their children. She is the one who helps her husband sell his daily catch. 

She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing net and plastic screen for crab cage. These will improve her yield and enable her to sell a variety of fish and crabs. Thus, her income will augmented and sufficient to provide the needs of her children. She will be able to finance her children's education as well.

With these, Bernardita could start to expand her fishing livelihood. She hopes to be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net and plastic screen for crab cage

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 56 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Susie has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susie has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Susie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jenit

texts.en:
Jenit is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenit is 51 years old and one of her children is in school.

Jenit has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Jenit requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Jenit has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jenit would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.fr: Marcel, 42 ans, est marié et a un fils. Pour faire vivre sa famille, il revend des boissons gazeuses au détail.  Souhaitant attirer plus de client, il compte ajouter d’autres types de boissons à son stock. Il demande un prêt pour acheter des boissons énergisantes et d’autres boissons rafraîchissantes non alcoolisées.
texts.en: Marcel is 42. He is married with one son. To provide for his family, he sells carbonated drinks retail. As he wants to attract more customers, he would like to add other types of drinks to his stock. He requests a loan to buy energising drinks and other refreshing but non-alcoholic drinks.

loans.use: to buy energising drinks and other refreshing but non-alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Jean Francklin

texts.fr: Francklin, 53 ans, vit en union libre. Il est père de quatre enfants. Comme activité, il vend du clairin en gros dans des barils. Le clairin est  une boisson fermentée, spécialité haïtienne préparée à base de canne à sucre. Il s’approvisionne dans la ville de Léogane et revend ses produits à Port-au-Prince.
texts.en: Francklin is 53. He lives with his partner and they have four children. His business is selling clairin wholesale in barrels. Clairin is a fermented drink, a Haitian speciality made from sugar cane. He buys his supplies in Leogane and sells his products Port-au-Prince.

loans.use: to buy barrels of clairin.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jasmine is 32 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Jasmine has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, cereals, and milk to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store. Jasmine has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, cereals, and milk to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Je-ann is 19 years old and is the second of six children in her family. Her mother, Judith, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

Je-ann is studying for a bachelor of science in computer technology and is currently in the second year of this four-year course. Judith is borrowing 6,750 PHP to pay the tuition fees of her daughter Je-ann for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Je-ann plans to look for a stable job so she can help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 29 years old and her child is in school.

Joan has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Joan has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Adelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Adelina has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Buusayra

texts.ru: Буусайра успешно погасила свой кредит, использовала она его по назначению и успешно погасила. Буусайра благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Буусайры на сегодняшний день есть 9 коров, 30 овец и 3 лошади. Ежегодно обрабатывает 2,0 Га земли, выращивает кукурузу, картофель, клевер. Буусайра обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Буусайра направит на дальнейшее ее развитие и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Buusayra successfully repaid her loan, and she used it for its intended purpose. Buusayra is grateful to Kiev Fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Today Buusayra has nine cows, thirty sheep and three horses. Each year she cultivates 2.0 hectares of land, and grows corn, potatoes, and clover. Buusayra has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some calves and lambs to increase her herd. Buusayra will direct the proceeds of the loan towards further development and improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and lambs in order to increase her herd and help bolster her income.

loans.name: Isma

texts.fr: Isma, 32 ans, est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle est dans la revente de produits alimentaires. Elle a aménagé un coin de sa maison pour monter une petite épicerie où elle arrange ses marchandises. Elle est à la recherche de financement pour augmenter son stock de riz et de sucre.
texts.en: Isma is 32. She is married, but does not yet have any children. She sells food products. She has converted a small area in her house to set up a little grocery store where she presents her merchandise. She requests a loan to increase her stock of rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Dewa Ayu, as the head of the Sinar Rejeki group, has successfully managed the group, both when they kept the pigs and also when the payment came. During the term, the group members took care of the pigs with good quality feed, vitamins and medicine. Their top concern was to make sure the growth of the pigs was maximal. They sold their pigs together to the same buyer for a high price.

The Sinar Rejeki Group has submitted a proposal for a new loan to MUK. They plan to increase the number of their pigs. 

Dewa Ayu has two children, one of whom is still in school, and her husband works as motorcycle salesman. To provide the needs of her family, Dewa Ayu raise pigs at home. Currently, she has a sow and two fattening piglets. She has a plan to purchase more superior piglets with the loan. 

The main goal of the group is to have enough savings at the end of the loan period so they can become independent in terms of business capital.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Anarbu

texts.ru: Анарбу успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 8 коров, 8 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Анарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки телят и ягнят. Доходы от кредита Анарбу будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Anarbu has successfully repaid her loan having utilized it as intended. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who has responded to her and helped her with financing. At present she has eight cows and eight sheep on her farm. She also grows potatoes and corn for sale on a field of 2.0 ha [5 acres]. Anarbu has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to increase her livestock headcount by buying calves and lambs. Anarbu will invest the revenues from her loan in a further business growth.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and lambs in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds for drying to sell.

loans.name: Adelène

texts.fr: Adelène, 35 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants. Ses enfants sont régulièrement scolarisés.  Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle vend des produits alimentaires. Elle installe son stand au bord de la route tout près de son domicile. Cela fait déjà deux qu’elle mène cette activité. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de spaghetti.
texts.en: Adelene is 35 and she lives with her partner. They have two children. Her children both attend school. To provide for her family, she sells food products. She sets up her stall on the roadside very close to her home. She has been in this business for two years now. She needs a micro-credit to increase her stock of spaghetti.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalyn is 28 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rosalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Rosalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nera

texts.en:
Nera is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nera is 43 years old, and has four children who are in school.

Nera has a school supplies retail business in the Philippines. Nera requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more school supplies to sell.

Nera has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nera would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Minerva is 44 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Minerva has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Minerva has been in this business for two years. In the future, Minerva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr: Roseline, 48 ans, est mariée. Elle habite à Bon Repos avec son mari et leurs cinq enfants. Comme activité, elle achète des chèvres, les abattre pour revendre leur viande au marché. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne les revenus nécessaires pour apporter son aide aux besoins de la famille. Elle demande un crédit pour acheter une chèvre de plus que d’habitude.
texts.en: Roseline is 48. She is married. She lives  in Bon Repos with her husband and their five children. Her business is buying goats, slaughtering them and selling their meat at the market. This is how she earns the income that is necessary to help in providing for the family. She requests a loan to buy one more goat than she usually buys.

loans.use: to buy a goat.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beatriz is 52 years old and has children who are in school.

Beatriz has a fishing business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Beatriz has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 34 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are in school.

Ruvelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruvelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed the times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ruvelyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es: Luis tiene 21 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santa Martha pertenece a la ventanilla Rural Nuevos Horizontes solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la siembra de naranjilla las compras realiza en Guaranda y en Echeandia su sueño es comprarse mas terrenos para producir mas y obtener una mejor economia para la familia ya que recien esta empezando, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Luis is 21 years old and is married, but has no children.  He lives in Guaranda in Bolivar province in the community of Santa Martha.  He is a member of the rural communal bank "Nuevos Horizontes."  He is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his naranjilla crops.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and in Echeandia.  His dream is to buy himself more land so that he can produce more and generate more income for his family, because he is just getting started in life.  In his spare time, he enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is married with five children and two dependents, all living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport, locally known as bodaboda, and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He started the businesses way back in 2013. But, with little progress due to inadequate capital and competition, this limits his profits. However, he dreams of expanding the business and to be able to start a cocoa store.

He used part of the profits from cocoa growing to buy the first two motorcycles. Abel has asked for a loan to buy a third motorcycle for his transport business. The photo is of his cocoa garden as part of his business activities.

loans.use: to purchase a third motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Fania

texts.fr: Fania a 40 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a cinq enfants à sa charge. Son activité est un petit commerce de chaussures. Petite certes, mais cette activité lui procure des revenus qui aident à nourrir la famille au quotidien.  Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Fania is 40. She lives with her partner and has five dependent children. Her activity is a small business selling shoes. It is small, but this business makes her an income  that helps in providing for the daily alimentary needs of the family. She needs a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
Marylen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, butter, sugar, etc. for her bakery business.

Marylen has been in this business for 18 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marylen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, butter, sugar, etc. for her bakery business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and married with four children, two in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for her family

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 26 years old with one child. Cherryl works very hard to provide for her family.

Cherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Cherryl has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Cherryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Engeline

texts.en:
Engeline is 28 years old, married and has three children, two in school.

Engeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Engeline requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Engeline would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a 30-year old mother of two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cleofe has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Cleofe has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cleofe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a 29-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emelie has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Emelie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts and pants.

Emelie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts and pants.

loans.name: Glaiza Mae

texts.en:
Glaiza Mae is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Glaiza Mae is 24 years old. She has a business, buying and selling fruits, in the Philippines. Glaiza Mae requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Glaiza Mae has been in this business for three years. In the future, Glaiza Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José  tiene 50 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos vive con ellos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santa Martha, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Nuevos Horizontes el se dedica a la siembra de naranjilla y guineo, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, abonos y fertilizantes, las compras realiza en Guayaquil su sueño es mejorar su finca y comprar mas terreno, los desafios a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos y el miedo de perder los cultivos, en su tiempo libre le gusta salair a pasear.
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old. He is married, with 3 children, who live with them in the Guaranda province in Bolivar in the community of Santa Martha. He belongs to the “Nuevos Horizontes” (“New Horizons”) solidarity group. He is dedicated to growing lulos and bananas. 

He requests the loan to buy supplies, manure, and fertilizers. He will make the purchases in Guayaqui. His dream is to improve his farm and to buy more land. The challenges he faces are the crop plagues and the fear of losing his crops. In his free time, he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to buy manure and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Su nombre es Rodolfo es un hombre de 34 años muy alegre y emprendedor que se dedica a la agricultura, ocasionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en su localidad rural de Omate, que esta ubicada en el departamento de Moquegua. Rodolfo pide ayuda a Kiva para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de Lima, es una fruta cítrica dulce, él desea abonar sus arboles frutales con abono orgánico que venden en su localidad que es elaborada con excremento de cuyes. Rodolfo espera que dentro de un periodo de tiempo corto pueda cosechar una fruta deliciosa y sobre todo saludable. En el futuro Rodolfo espera poder mejorar su casa para vivir cómodamente y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
His name is Rodolfo. He is a happy and enterprising 34 year old who works in agriculture. Sometimes he works as agricultural labor in his rural part of Omate which is located in the department of Moquegua.

Rodolfo is requesting support from Kiva to be able to provide maintenance on his lime crops, which is a sweet citric fruit. He wants to apply organic manure that is sold in his area to his fruit trees. It is composed of guinea pig droppings. Rodolfo hopes that in a short period of time he can harvest delicious and moreover healthy fruit. in the future Rodolfo wants to make improvements on his house so he can live comfortably and have economic stability.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for his fruit crop with organic manure.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: don Narciso de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hijo y su nuera, el trabaja como albañil desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes que lo buscan por su buen trabajo, el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso ya que es de tierra, pero como no posee de suficiente capital, esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros materiales y así poder tener una mejor vivienda digna.
texts.en: Don Narciso is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. Narciso has worked as a bricklayer for several years and he has many clients who go to him because of his good workmanship.  He wants to improve his own house, laying a cement floor since the current floor is packed earth but because he doesn't have sufficient capital, he is asking for a loan to buy sand, cement reinforcing bar and other materials so that he can have better, decent housing.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, rebar and other materials

loans.name: Oscar Jeovanny

texts.es: Oscar tiene 22 años de edad tiene un hijo vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santa Martha, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Nuevos Horizontes, el se dedica a la siembra de naranjilla y cria pollos, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes agricolas para los sembrios para tener una buena producción, realiza las compras en Guayaquil y su sueño es comprarse una finca mas grande en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old and has a son. He lives with his parents in Guaranda province in Bolivar in the community of Santa Martha. He belongs to the “Nuevos Horizontes” (“New Horizons”) solidarity group. He is dedicated to growing lulos and to raising chickens. 

He requests the loan to buy supplies and agricultural fertilizers for the crops so that he has a good production. He makes the purchases in Guayaquil. His dream is to buy himself a bigger farm. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his lulo crop.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La Saturnina se dedica al negocio de venta de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la carne. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Saturnina makes a living as a butcher. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm and she hopes to get ahead by means of this business.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the meat. She is requesting the loan to purchase meat.

She is grateful for the loan and she promises to follow through with her repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Exila

texts.fr: Exila, âgée de 38 ans, est mariée. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. Depuis très jeune, soit à l’âge de 19 ans, elle a commencé à faire de petit commerce. Elle vend des produits alimentaires. Souhaitant développer son activité pour augmenter ses revenus, elle cherche un prête. Avec cet argent, elle va acheter des caisses d’huile d’olive.
texts.en: Exila is 38 years old and married. She has no children. From the very young age of 19, Exila began running a small business. She sells foodstuffs. Hoping to expand her business in order to increase revenue, Exila is seeking a loan. With this money, she will purchase containers of olive oil.

loans.use: To purchase containers of olive oil.

loans.name: Edgardo Giovani

texts.es: Edgardo de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de pollos y venta de ropa desde hace 13 años, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para asistir sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edgardo is 33 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been growing basic grains, rearing chickens and selling clothing for 13 years. Thanks to his job, he has been able to pay off his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy fertiliser, manure, pest control, etc. in order to help him with his crops and therefore help him increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bugashane Group

texts.fr: A partir de l'expérience de ses parents, Mukangira a observé que la culture du riz était la plus rentable des autres. Grâce à elle, ils ont pu scolariser leurs enfants et améliorer leur habitat. Pour lui, les maladies de plantes et l'insuffisance de moyens sont des obstacles majeurs à cette activité mais il souhaiterait à la longue élargir son étendue culturale afin d'augmenter la production, grâce à laquelle ses enfants pourront poursuivre normalement leurs études ainsi que l'amélioration de l'alimentation et de l'habitat. Il préside le groupe BUGASHANE; sur photo, il est au milieu de quatre autres membres du groupe.
texts.en:
Through his parents' experience, Mukangira observed that growing rice was more profitable than other [crops]. Thanks to [their rice crop, his parents] were able to send their children to school and improve their home.

For Mukangira, crop diseases and insufficient means are the major obstacles to this business, but he hopes to expand the land under cultivation in order to increase production in the long term. This will allow his children to keep up with their studies and will allow [him to] improve his home and feed [the household].

Mukangira leads Bugashane Group; in the photo, he is in the middle of the four other group members.

loans.use: To pay the costs of labor for upkeep and harvest.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика замужняя женщина. У нее один единственный сын в возрасте 27 лет. Больше у нее нет детей. Малика честная и жизнелюбивая женщина. Она хочет начать услуги портнихи у себя дома. 8 лет Малика только шила для себя. И теперь хочет начать свой маленький бизнес.  Швейное дело это только для женщин. Но есть мужчины, которые они тоже умеет шить. Любое дело зависит только от себя, то есть от человека. Малика хорошо знает свою работу. Она решила купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы скорее начать любимою делу. И она еще хочет купить холодильник для дома. Потому что Малика несколько раз отремонтировала старый холодильник, и он сломался больше его не починить. Ее продукты питания без холодильника быстро портиться. Малика очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Malika is a married woman. She has one son who is 27 years old. She does not have any other children. Malika is an honest and cheerful woman. She wants to start providing tailoring services from home. For eight years, Malika has been sewing for herself, and now she wants to start her own small business. Sewing is only for women, but there are men who also know how to sew. Any activity depends only on oneself, that is on the person doing it. Malika knows her work well.
