She has decided to buy a new sewing machine in order to start her favorite work as soon as possible. And Malika also wants to buy a refrigerator for her house because she has repaired her old one several times, and now it is broken beyond repair. Her food spoils quickly without a refrigerator. Malika is very hopeful of your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start a business, and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and all three children attend school.

Ma. Chona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Chona would like to save enough money, so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonora has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Paulina  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Sayhua de Chichubamba” communal bank in the Urubamba district and province of Cusco department, Peru.

Paulina continues to work at her business selling vegetables. She is hard-working and, through this business, wants to get ahead and help her family. Paulina is applying for this loan in order to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins.

Paulina is very happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elizabeth se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “Sayhua de Chichubamba” communal bank in the Urubamba district and province of Cusco department, Peru.

She makes a living producing handicrafts and sells knitted products, sweaters, blankets and woven products. She works from 8am until 7pm and has eight years’ experience with this business, which is going very well. Elizabeth’s dream is to expand her business. Elizabeth is applying for a loan in order to buy sweaters, and knitted and woven products.

Elizabeth is very happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, and knitted and woven products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 23 years old, married and has three children. For the past five years she has farmed seaweed in the Philippines.

Rowena is a client of Kiva's field partner NWTF and has borrowed and successfully repaid three previous loans. She has now applied for a 7000 PHP loan to buy plastic and other materials needed in her business. She is working to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Cipriana Justina

texts.es: Cipriana tiene 53 años y goza de la compañía de su familia, vive con 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos aun están en edad escolar, ademas Cipriana siempre ha contado con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales de granja y a la agricultura, actualmente tiene sembrado en su terreno agrícola forraje a cual le ha dado el cuidado necesario para que sea orgánico. Solicita el micro crédito para poder darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo, ella espera que con el préstamo pueda comprar fertilizantes orgánicos y abono orgánico. En el futuro Cipriana espera poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación y ver a todos ellos graduados de la universidad, pero sobre todo siempre darles el apoyo económico y moral que ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Cipriana is 53 years old and enjoys the company of her family. She lives with her five children, three of whom are still school age. In addition, Cipriana has always been able to count on her husband's unconditional support.

At present, Cipriana is planting forage crops on her agricultural land and she wants to give it the necessary inputs to qualify as organic. She also raises agricultural and barnyard livestock. 

Cipriana is soliciting a micro-credit in order to maintain her crops. She hopes that the loan will cover the cost of organic fertilizer and organic manure.

In the future, Cipriana hopes to be able to offer her children a good education and see them all graduate from the university. But, above all, she always wishes to give them the economic and moral assistance they need.

loans.use: to enable her to purchase the organic inputs required to support her organic forage crop.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Susana se dedica al negocio de venta de flores y tambien al socia es profesora, la socia vende rosas, claveles entre otras flores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas y claveles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the “Sayhua de Chichubamba” communal bank in the Urubamba district and province of Cusco department, Peru.

Susana makes a living selling flowers as well as a working as a teacher. Susana sells, among other flowers, roses and carnations. She works from 8am until 6pm. Through this work, Susana wants to progress in life. Susana’s dream is to expand her flower business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy roses and carnations.

Susana is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy roses and carnations.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Leonarda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the “Sayhua de Chichubamba” communal bank in the Urubamba district and province of Cusco department, Peru.

Leonarda continues to work at her business selling vegetables. She is hard-working and, through this business, wants to get ahead and help her family. Leonarda is applying for this loan in order to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins.

Leonarda is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 28, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past two years she has raised and sold pigs in the Philippines.

Alma is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. She is working to save money to expand her pig business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Jecel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Jecel has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Franklin Nibaldo

texts.es: Franklin tiene 51 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, el se dedica a la cria de pollos y solicita el credito para la compra de alimento para estos y comprar mas pollos para asi incrementar su negocio para producir mas y optener mejores ganancias para poder mantener a su familia, realiza las compras en Guayaquil cada semana, su sueño es tener una granja mas grande, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Franklin is 51 years old, married and has three children. He lives in Echeandia, in the Bolivar province of Ecuador. 

Franklin makes a living raising chickens, and is applying for this loan in order to buy chicken feed and to buy more chickens. He can thus expand his business and earn a higher income with which to support his family. Franklin buys his supplies in Guayaquil every week.

Franklin’s dream is to have a larger farm. In his spare time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en: Athman is a single man. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, cups, bowls and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, cups, bowls and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be very successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, cups, bowls and other items

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a divorced woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal for the last 4 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a big supplier of charcoal within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another charcoal store.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells cosmetics. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to open a cosmetics store.

loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia  is 30 years old married woman and the mother of 5 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk and owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is 51 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases varieties of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Razia  has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR.  She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Gemma has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has been engaged in tailoring services for more than 20 years. She provides services like dress making, dress adjustments, and many others. She is married, with nine grown children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is in need of capital to support her livelihood.

Carmelita has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine and cloth. These materials will be very useful in her day to day activities. She can now have a brand new sewing machine that can accommodate more orders and deliver them on time. Thus, it will attract more customers and it helps to augment her income. Carmelita could start to settle her obligations and properly handle her finances.

She is grateful for the funds she receives and she is doing her best for the success of her tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Aska

texts.en:
Aska is 54 years old, married to James and supports 5 children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years earning KES11,000 per month.
Aska has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy dairy feed for her animals for high production and sale for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to high levels. 
Her future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed for her animals for high production and sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old. With her two children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. 

Maricel has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Linda has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 45, is widowed and has seven children, four of whom are in school. For the past thirty years she has farmed root crops in the Philippines.

Vilma has borrowed and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF to assist in sustaining her farm. She is now applying for a 6000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Lilia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 38 years old and a married woman; she is involved in business selling stitching materials to support her family. She offers different laces, ribbons, threads, and buttons in different colors. She has become popular in her street for providing good material to her customers. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has applied a loan of PKR 50000  to purchase lace, buttons and spools of threads in different colors. It will improve her earnings and enable her to better support the needs the family members.

loans.use: to purchase lace, buttons and spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar  is 33 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Kousar  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Rahayu group has already passed 11th loan periods. They have made their payments; Ni Put is the head of the group.

The price of pork now is decreasing, from 30.000 IDR per kg to 22.000 IDR per kg. The price for superior piglets has also decreased from 600.000 IDR to 500.000 IDR. The price for superior feed is still high. But they still maintain their spirit to continue their business. 

Although they only earned a small profit, the group agreed to continue their loan. They will change the methods for keeping pigs from fattening to raising pigs for pig barbeque. This is easier for them to maintain, and they can be sold after keeping them for only 2 months. The pigs for barbeque don't always need superior quality feed, they can be fed with traditional feed such as banana leaf and any others green leafs, which they can find in their own gardens. 

Ni Putu will use her portion of loan to purchase four piglets. Ni Putu and the member of Tunas Rahayu group hopes for the best with their pig business and that finally they can save enough.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 58 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of eight children, two of them are still attending school. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened in her house a room to prepare homemade foods since 2011 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 

Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments… in order to increase her sales and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments…

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a Kiva borrower with 6 children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a retail business where she sells vitenge( type of african fabric). She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of vitenge. Her business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of vitenge (African fabrics)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tailoring materials such as fabric materials, sewing threads and dress laces for use in her business and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Muteti

texts.en: Muteti is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be social. He operates a retail business where he sells soap, sugar, flour, bread, salt, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. His business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Pamela has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elizabeth has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Arlyn is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 60 years old and he lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Arayik lives with his beloved wife, who is a teacher, with his son and daughter-in-law. Areayik works at the private company as a warden. 

Arayik has great ask and hopes to be supported since his lovely wife has some health problems and he is worried so he greatly wants to solve that problem as soon as it is possible. This Kiva loan amount of 200.000 Armenian drams, Arayik wants to spend for the repayment of the medical exam for his wife. Both he and his wife thank for Kiva support beforehand.

loans.use: for the repayment of the medical exam for his wife

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
This young farmer’s name is Stepan and he is 22 years old. In the village Zovaber of Gegharkunik region Stepan lives with his father and sister. Stepan does different hired constructional works and simultaneously is engaged in farming. With his father Stepan takes care of his cows, calves, heifers, lambs, sheep and chickens. This occupation as Stepan says he enjoys and likes very much. He is also good in land cultivation and gathers from it harvest of potatoes, greens, cucumber and tomato. 

The half of his farm products Stepan takes for sale at the city’s wholesale market. Stepan asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as he has no finances for vegetable sowing activities and he will also buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle and for vegetable sowing activities

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Eva has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of rice, coffee, sugar, wheat flour and Malagasy rice flour

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge . 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft in her place of operation.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a  married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation and theft as her major challenge. 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 50 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who runs a general store business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like spices, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other groceries to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like spices, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Janeth has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lovasoa Simone

texts.fr:
Lovasoa Simone est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse. Elle est mariée et son mari est un Militaire retraité dont la pension ne suffit pas à couvrir les dépenses familiales. Ils ont trois enfants: une fille déjà mariée, et deux garçons vivant encore avec eux et aident la mère dans l'exercice de son activité.
Lovasoa Simone est couturière, elle confectionne des vêtements (robes, chemises, pantalons, shorts, jupes, etc.). En plus, elle vend des chaussures à l'occasion et des tissus en mètre. Ce sont ses deux garçons qui effectuent l'approvisionnement. 
Son objectif est  d'abord de pouvoir accéder ses deux garçons dans une institution de formation professionnelle et qu'ils trouvent ensuite du travail et ensuite construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: Lovasoa Simone is a resourceful and hardworking woman. She is married and her husband is a retired soldier whose pension is insufficient to cover the household's expenses. They have three children: a girl who is already married, and two boys who still live with them and help their mother in carrying out her trade. Lovasoa Simone is a seamstress, she makes clothes (dresses, shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, etc.). In addition, she sells second-hand shoes and fabric by the yard. Her two boys are responsible for getting supplies. Her goal is first to be able to enrol her two boys in a vocational school so that they can then find a job, and then to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy used shoes and fabric

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 38 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ailyn has been in this business for 18 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Celerina. She is a 52-year-old married woman with a 13-year-old daughter. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

Celerina owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, shampoo, powdered milk, coffee, noodles and toiletries. She has been operating a store for more than 10 years. She lacks capital to maintain an adequate stock for her store. 

Celerina has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase rice, feeds, soft drinks, flour, and many other items to add to her stock. Having these items available, she could now cater to the needs of more customers and be able to serve them better as well.

Thus, Celerina would be enabled to improve her income and pay her obligations. She could also continue sending her children to school.

In the future, she aspires to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice, feeds, soft drinks, flour, and many other items to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luciana dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth has a mortar and pestle manufacturing business to support her nine children. She used her loan to purchase wood, varnish, brushes and other inputs for her business. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To purchase wood, varnish and brushes

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julio Miguel

texts.es: Julio Miguel de 49 años, emprendió su idea de negocio a través de una sobrina que administra un almacén de ropa deportiva quien le propuso comenzar a vender este tipo de mercancía.  Hace cuatro años se dedica a esta actividad con mucha dedicación y perseverancia en la que cada ocho días realiza sus ventas visitando a sus amigos y referidos en el horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 7 a.m. sus compras las realiza de contado o a crédito según se encuentre su flujo de caja.  En la actualidad desea incrementar su surtido para ello está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar camisetas deportivas y tenis.  Es padre de tres hijos a quienes ha ofrecido bienestar y desea continuar apoyándoles.  En su negocio desea prosperar y tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Julio Miguel is 49 years old.  He embarked on his business idea through a niece who runs a sportswear store who encouraged him to begin to sell this type of merchandise.  He has worked at this for four years with great dedication and perseverance.  Every week he makes his sales to friends and referrals from 9AM until 7PM.  He makes his purchases in cash or on credit, depending upon his cash flow.

He now wishes to increase his supplies, and so he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to buy T-shirts, sportswear and tennis shirts.  He is the father of three children whose welfare he provides for and he wishes to continue supporting them.  In his business he wishes to prosper and to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, sportswear and tennis shirts

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Marta de 55 años, encontró la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio y ganarse la vida ofreciendo una gran gama de productos de uso personal y para el hogar.  Su hermano es diseñador y labora en el vecino país de Venezuela, inicialmente le enviaba camisas de dormir y blusas que proponía a sus compañeras de trabajo, amigas y vecinas del barrio en el que reside en Barranquilla, sin embargo con su espíritu emprendedor logro ampliar la línea de productos e impulsar tendidos de camas, cubrelechos, calzado y ropa, con gran acogida por sus clientes a quien ofrece semanalmente nuevo surtido a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m.  Hoy en día está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar sabanas, cubrelechos, pijamas, jeans, blusas, suéteres y calzado.  Con este nuevo surtido podrá vender más y afianzar su meta de continuar con los arreglos locativos en su vivienda y colaborarle a su hija económicamente para ofréceles estudio a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Marta, 55 years old, found the opportunity to start her own business and earn a living by offering a wide range of products for home and personal use. Her brother is a designer and works in Venezuela, the neighboring country. At first he would send her nightshirts and blouses, which she would recommend to her coworkers, friends, and neighbors in Barranquilla. However, with her enterprising spirit she was able to broaden her line of products and provide bed sheets, bedspreads, clothing and footwear to her customers with great success. 

Every week she sells new items from 8 AM to 7 PM. Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy sheets, bedspreads, pajamas, jeans, blouses, sweaters, and footwear. With these new supplies she will be able to make more sales and meet her goal of continuing with the repairs in her home and helping her daughter financially so that she can send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, pajamas, jeans, blouses, sweaters, and footwear

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Это Умедчон. Ему 28 лет. Он из города Душанбе. Умедчон женат, и не имеет детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Умедчон работает ювелиром. У нее имеется точка, где продвигает свою работу. Он хороший ювелир. Умедчон ремонтирует серьга, кольцо и другие ювелирные изделия. Он планирует расширить свою деятельность. Он решил купить новые инструменты для работы, и хочет отремонтировать свое место работы, чтобы было приятно, красиво и уютно. Чтобы достичь своих целей, ему нужны денежные средства. Но их у него нет, по этой причине Умедчон опросит кредит. Поддержите его!
texts.en: This is Umedjon. He is 28 years old. He is from the city of Dushanbe. Umedjon is married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Umedjon himself works as a jeweler. He has a place where he carries out his work. He is a good jeweler. Umedjon repairs earrings, rings and other items of jewelry. He plans to expand his business. He has decided to buy new tools for his work, and wants to renovate his place of work to make it more pleasant, attractive and comfortable. In order to achieve his goals, he needs funds. But he does not have any, and so Umedjon is asking for a loan. Please support him!

loans.use: to buy jeweler's tools and to renovate his place of work.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is a married 49-year-old from Dipolog. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in order to access the programs and service it offers. 

Recently, she accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 for additional working capital to restock store inventory items for her business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products in the local community.

loans.use: to restock store inventory items for her business

loans.name: Mariter

texts.en:
Mariter is a woman with three children. Mariter is 30 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mariter has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mariter requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Mariter has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Mariter would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Melren

texts.en:
Melren is a woman with two children. Melren is 23 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Melren has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies.

Melren has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melren would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 38 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Rosalie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Pagadian, she tried her luck and took a loan to jump start her farm production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Jocelyn feels that she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Jocelyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply farm products to the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel tiene 26 años de edad ,estado civil soltero, reside en el caserio Buenos Aires, distrito de Morropón, Región Piura. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, que se dedican al comercio de platano y crianza de ganado mayormente.

Él se dedica al servicio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet dentro del mismo caserío, de lunes a domingo siendo los feriados los día que se presenta un incremento de clientes. Luis Miguel presenta experiencia en el rubro según las referencias crediticias y personales .

El crédito solicitado sera invertido en la compra de equipo de computo para ampliar negocio existente ya que presenta demanda de cabinas, esto le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 26 years old.  He is single and lives in the small village of Buenos Aires in the Morropón district, Piura region.  Life in this community is tranquil.  The people there mainly work raising cattle and selling bananas.

Luis Miguel works renting out internet booths in that same village.  He works from Monday through Sunday, the weekends being the days with an increase in customers.  He has experience in this line of work, according to his personal and credit references.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of computer equipment to expand his existing business, because there is a demand for these booths.  This will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment in order to expand his existing business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with four children. Susan is 46 years old and all of her four children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Susan has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Susan has been in this business for three years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nelvie

texts.en:
Nelvie is 33 years old and has three children. Nelvie is married and two of her children are in school.

Nelvie is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Nelvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic and other materials needed for her business.

Nelvie has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelvie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is a prospective student at The Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), where he will major in Port Processing. 

Eka comes from a coastal marine area in Java, precisely from the town of Cilacap, Central Java. Eka's biggest inspiration to continue in AMN is because the city is located in the coastal area and there is a large port in the region. 

Eka's father was a newspaper vendor, delivering newspapers, which had minimal income. To meet the day-to-day needs depended on the papers he sold. With all his efforts and hardships, his father had to fend for them to support his three children since his wife did not have any special skills to help the family's economy. 

Eka expects that this loan from Kiva will help him to continue his studies so as to ease the burden of his parents and siblings. He hopes to become a professional in charge as a clerk in the office of the port and make his parents happy. 

Eka thanks the lenders because these loans are meant for his life in the future.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Tutut

texts.en:
Mrs. Tutut has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Tutut heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling and without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Tutut, who is also a health worker in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative for Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Tutut will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Hayarpi

texts.en:
Hayarpi is from Amasisa village and lives there with her parents-in-law, husband and two children (10 and 7 years old). Hayarpi's husband works with the local emergency services. The income which he earns is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs, so Hayarpi decided to run her own business. She got involved in agribusiness some years ago. On her farm she currently keeps seven cows, three calves, fifty sheep, three pigs and hens. Hayarpi's mother-in-law also helps her to cultivate potato seeds. 
Hayarpi has now applied for this loan to purchase  potato seeds, fertilizer and to pay for the renovation of the agro machine (loanmower). This loan will greatly support Hayarpi with her farming works and will help her to earn more income for the family.
 Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hayarpi's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Hayarpi hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge her agribusiness, so her family will have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and renovation of the agro machine (lownmower)

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 41 years old and married with four children. Three of Lorelyn's children attend in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lorelyn has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from beauty products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Reza

texts.en:
Reza is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Reza is 42 years old and two of her children are in school.

Reza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, and other fishing supplies.

Reza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Reza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago está casado y tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo, El se dedica a la producción de café bajo diferentes certificados como ser: Comercio justo, Rain Forest, y otros certificados de calidad, en estos momentos Santiago quiere convertir sus cafetales a producción orgánica, estos sellos de certificación le permiten al productor tener mejores opciones de mercado para su café, personalmente Santiago sueña con poder darle a su familia oportunidades para una mejor calidad de vida  y trabajar cuidando la pureza del ambiente. 
La producción de café orgánico es una nueva técnica en la región que ayuda a proteger la biodiversidad y asegurar mejores mercados para los productos, Santiago tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la producción de café, “Con nuestra experiencia y el apoyo de COCAFCAL en la implementación de nuevas técnicas vamos saliendo adelante”  nos dice Santiago.
Actualmente Santiago tiene la meta de convertir 1 hectárea a producción 100% orgánica para lo que necesita comprar  diferentes materiales como ser: platas de café, abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos, pago de trabajadores, otros gastos propios de la replantación de un cafetal bajo la norma orgánica.
Un préstamo ayudaría a Santiago a convertir su parcela a producción de café orgánico, con las ganancias de su parcela Santiago espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is married and is responsible for three children. He produces coffee for different organizations such as Comercio Justo (Fair Trade), Rain Forest and other well-recognized organizations. Now Santiago wants to make his coffee plantation organic. These quality certifications will open more markets for selling his coffee, and, on a personal level, Santiago dreams of giving his family a better quality of life and of working to preserve the environment.

The production of organic coffee is a new technique in the region, which will help to protect the area's biodiversity and ensure better markets for the product. Santiago has more than 10 years' experience in coffee production: "With our experience, and the support of COCAFCAL in the implementation of the new techniques, we will succeed."

Currently, Santiago has set himself the challenge of converting one hectare to 100% organic production, and needs to pay for several things, including coffee plants, organic plant food and fertilizers, labor costs, and other costs associated with the replanting of a coffee plantation under the regulations for organic farming. 

A loan will help Santiago convert his land for organic coffee-production, and he hopes to improve his family's quality of life with the earnings.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for converting to organic crops, such as coffee plants, organic plant food and fertilizer.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Viviana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Viviana requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Viviana has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Viviana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of coconut wine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of coconut wine to sell to her customers.

Manuela has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from her general store.

Manuela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to improve her quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna sells clothes and shoes. Due to previous loans on Kiva, she was able to increase her sales and get additional income. Ivanna spent most of it to to pay for her children's higher education. She does not have any problems in business. At the same time Ivanna worries about the sons who can be drafted into the military to fight in the war zone in Ukraine.

Ivanna is asking for a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase women's shoes for the summer season. She wants to increase the assortment and attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Saret is a 47-year-old widowed rice farmer with five children in her care. She has cultivated rice since 2000. Two of her five children work in a garment factory and three of her children are students. All of them reside in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. The family can make approximately $22 per day. Now Saret would like to request a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy more farmland and gain more rice crops. In the future, she want to buy more farmland, build a new house and support her children to go on to a higher education.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. Roselyn joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. Recently, she has accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities, as she sells food and not food commodities in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities, as she sells food and not food commodities in the local community.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza is a hardworking mother from Pagadian. She is 36 years old and a businesswoman who loves farming activity. Annaliza has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to to purchase fertilizer. Annaliza hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nida is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Weena

texts.en:
Weena is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Weena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Weena has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Weena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en:
Shohista is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She is living in a small town where there are good conditions to keep livestock and plant agricultural products. She is married and has one child. Her husband is in construction. She is a teacher at secondary school. She keeps livestock at home and does business. It is her fourth time appealing to IMON. Each time she asks advice on how to do her business better.

This year she decided to plant agricultural products on summer holidays. She is planning to plant watermelon and melon and then get a harvest at the end of the summer holiday. She is asking for help from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals to plant a new harvest. She awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals to plant a new harvest

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation service.  He earns a living by transporting passengers from one place to remote areas.  He is 36 years old and married with a one-year-old dependent. He has been engaged in motorcycle transport services for more than 10 years. 

He is asking for a loan to buy tires and pay for maintenance like oil changes. This will contribute to the safety of his passengers as he operates his livelihood daily. He will avoid the hassle and delayed rides that arise during travel.  With these, Eduardo's income will increase and he will be able to pay his obligations. He will also be able to provide the needs of his young child and set aside some savings for emergency use.

Eduardo is determined to expand his current source of income to be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for maintenance like oil changes

loans.name: Liler Diovin

texts.es:
Liler Diovin tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca y arroz, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería y albañilería contando con herramientas propias, lleva más de 10 años realizando este tipo de trabajo por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos que brindan buenas referencias de el. Solicita préstamo para compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto el espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liler Diovin is 33 years old. He lives with his wife in a rural area, in Oyotún. Locals grow corn, cassava and rice. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

He works as a day laborer and as a mason. He has his own tools. He has been working in these activities for more than ten years, so he has a vast experience and loyal clients that can give good references.

He is requesting a loan to buy equipment and tools and for the maintenance of the ones he has. This investment will help him to keep his tools in better shape, and will be beneficial for his business. He hopes that this investment will help him to improve the quality of the services he offers and to be able to fulfill all his clients’ demands. This will in turn result in more income and the improvement of his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and to perform maintenance on the ones he has.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a vegetable retailing business in Pagadian and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now she availed a loan to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell. Esterlita hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Her name is Geraldine, 29, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a vendor, and has one child who is not of school age yet. The couple work hard to support their everyday needs.

Geraldine has run a fruit stand for five years. She buys different kinds and kilos of bananas from a wholesaler and sells them at retail price. Bananas are almost always a staple in Filipino households, being the cheapest and one of the most nutritious native fruit of the Philippines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy several kilos of bananas to sell at her fruit stand. She is thanking God and you for you good heart and the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings from her store will surely help cover their daily sustenance.

Geraldine prays that God will bless the works of her hands. She desires to have a happy and successful marriage. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several kilos of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marily

texts.en:
Marily is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending. 

Marily dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Nojima

texts.en:
Nojima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet café business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Nojima has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from selling purified drinking water.

Nojima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Flor De Naranjo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE NARANJO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de plantillas, venta de salchipapa, venta de colchones, venta de pescado, venta de frazadas, venta de faldas, venta de papa.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plantillas para zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, hace varios años, es por esta razón que trabaja con este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de plantillas para zapatos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las reuniones de su asociación comunal.
En la foto no aparece la señora Viviana Castaya porque después del desembolso tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE NARANJO” (Orange Flower) Community Association is in its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana (Panamerican regional center). The group has eight members, and is managed by a governing board led by Dionicia, the President. The members of the group work in a number of areas, including selling shoe insoles, salchipapa (a local sausage and potato dish), mattresses, fish, blankets, skirts, and potatoes.

The loan provided will help micro-entrepreneurs such as Dionicia. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago, after being invited by a neighbor who is a client at the institution. Currently, she sells shoe insoles, and says that she learned this business from her husband many years ago.
 
The loan that she has requested will be used to increase her capital for buying wholesale shoe insoles, which she will purchase in La Paz and then sell in her store. She is married and has three children, and this work provides her with an income for supporting her family.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the Community Association meetings.

One member of the group, Viviana Castaya, is not present in the photo, as she had to go to her store after the disbursement of funds.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoe insoles.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 49 years old, married, and she has two children who work as construction workers. She has cultivated rice since 2000. She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Her husband is also a rice farmer. Together, they can make approximately $20 per day. Touch requested a loan for her son, which he will use to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, and steel for his construction work. In the future, she wants to buy more farmland, and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, and steel for her son's construction work.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She lives in a village with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She has been challenged with hard and difficult times in her life. She lives with her parents. In order to not burden her parents she worked at seasonal jobs. Then gradually she learned how to sew traditional woman dresses from her neighbors.

She heard about IMON from her friends and decided to apply to do business. She actively participated at trainings provided by IMON to startup clients. She decided to do business and support her child. She sews national womens dresses and gets orders at home. She has regular customers and is well known around her area. Besides sewing, they have livestock that gives them dairy products. Feruza and her parents settled to buy livestock and do business. She requested a loan from KIVA lenders to buy livestock and widen her working capital of keeping livestock. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and do business

loans.name: Lizzel Ann

texts.en:
Lizzel Ann is 22 years old and is single. They call her Lizzel for short. Lizzel finished her vocational course in college but while waiting for employment, she has engaged herself in the retail business. Lizzel is selling a variety of grocery items in their village. Her dream is to get employed someday and have a stable job and stable income as well.

At present, Lizzel is managing her retail business well to generate income that she uses in getting her requirements for employment. Lizzel wants to expand her business and earn higher income in able to help her parents with their needs. With this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy drinks, toothpaste, soaps, diapers, and powdered milk to sell. She hopes that someday she will get employment with the help of her earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, toothpaste, soaps, diapers, and powdered milk to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and clothing sales businesses.

Remedios dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Merlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn is 46 years old and a married mother of eight children; only four of them are in school They live in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income and two of her children are now working as a factory workers to earn additional income to support her family’s living. Her daily income is about 48,500KHR. This is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund, while the other two in her group are taking their first and second loan respectively. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 45 years old, married with three children.

Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Vivian has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Vivian aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

Loida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Loida industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as fattening pigs.

Loida dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

Nenita earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nenita supplements this income with earnings from her general store and livestock-raising businesses.

Nenita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is the married mother of seven children. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and tea

loans.name: Radhakrushna Group

texts.en:
Radhakrushna Group started in the year 2015 at Maskaguda village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. In the group there are 15 active self-dependent women, with an intention for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses. 

Swarnalata is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing with raised hand in the photo, in the first row, first person from the left hand side. She is about 40 years old and living with her small family, her husband and three children. 

She has been engaged in a paddy and rice business in her own home of Maskaguda for the last 10 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 7,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to plow back into the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to purchase a large quantity of paddy and rice during the season. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for purchasing another house and to provide better education to her children.

The other 14 members of the group are also smart about their businesses and also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, A bullock business, milk business, popped rice business, paddy, a general store and a transport business and with this loan, they hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of paddy (unhulled rice) and rice

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae is 28 years old and married with two children, who are both atttend in school. Anna Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Anna Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell .

Anna Mae has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Anna Mae would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell .

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 34 year old married woman and the mother of six children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling welding materials 8 years ago. 

Irshad is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Irshad hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's welding materials shop, like iron rods and sheets, soldering materials etc

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie is 52 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Perlie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Perlie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Culasita

texts.en:
Culasita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Culasita is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Culasita has a general store business in the Philippines. Culasita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries like snack food, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Culasita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Culasita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Desidaria

texts.en:
Desidaria is 45 years old and has two children.  Desidaria is married and both of her children are in school.

Desidaria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Desidaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Desidaria has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Desidaria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old and married with eight children. Four of Marissa's children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from selling coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Mercidita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 76 years old and widow, with seven children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Norma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Norma would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
