A 59-year-old mother of three children, Khan is living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice and  working in a factory have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. She could earn about 42,500 KHR per day and she could save about 25,000 KHR daily. 

This is the first loan cycle for her group of two with VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for plowing fees. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 48-years old married woman, living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a butcher shop and he earns a sufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it at his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. 

Therefore Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a bull calf for getting beef. Nargis wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. 
She is very thankful to Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase supplies in her husband's butcher shop

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is aged 41, and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and looks after her family at home. 

Rukhsana's husband has owned a vegetable business for many years. He purchases fresh and seasonal vegetables daily from the main market at wholesale prices and sells from his vegetable shop at retail prices. He gets a reasonable profit as he is honest enough. He manages his household necessities from his earnings through this vegetable business. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He wants to increase his vegetable stock on a daily basis. Therefore, his wife Rukhsana made contact with Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. In this way, she can support to her husband's business. 

Rukhsana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea.

loans.name: Mwansada

texts.en:
Mwansada is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water or electricity. 

Mwansada  has operated a coconut business for the past three years, selling at the market to her local customers. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen lives in Pasay City, Philippines. Today, she focuses on managing her small buy and sell business. She mainly offers ready-to-wear clothes for men and women. At times, it's hard for her to sustain her income, since customers barely come. But she's really hopeful that she'll be successful with this. 

Today, she asks for your helping hands for the continuation of her inventory. She would like to avail a loan worth PHP 10,000 that she will use in buying greater quantities of clothes to sell. If she gains such, it would be an advantage, since people get more attracted when there are more items displayed than the usual. 

She really hopes that you can help her with this. She is doing this for her grandchildren's education and her remaining hope relies in you. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: in buying greater quantities of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support to Corazon. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to accomplish buying more supplies of merchandise for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she had started, she would like to borrow another 20,000 that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Corazon's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life to  her family. 

In the future, she dreams of widening her business range and adding more stores as well. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is aged 37, mother of three children and living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by trade and he has been selling fresh vegetables at his shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetables shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these demands. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis, so that he can maximize the sale of vegetables. Therefore, Rukhsana asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 38 year old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and two sons. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building construction. In this regard her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing accessories to improve his shuttering work. Then he can generate more income for the financial support of his family. 

Saima is applying for loan from the Kiva field partner so that her husband will be able to buy the raw materials for his shuttering work.
She is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material like iron rods and soldering for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Ana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ana has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has been raising hogs for more than 10 years. Gemma is married with six children and lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a security guard.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements to improve her method of raising hogs. Gemma will be able to sell quality hogs in a few months and would begin to settle her finances and augment her income. She is able to provide her children with nutritious meals and good shelter.

She dreams to be successful in her chosen field and also improve her status of living..

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Gaudy Lizet

texts.es:
ELLA TIENE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU PAREJA E HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE ZAÑA, DE LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE.

GAUDY LIZET SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES EN SU DOMICILIO COMO PATOS, PAVOS,CERDOS,ENTRE OTROS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS Y GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS.

SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE ALIMENTO PARA SUS ANIMALES, DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Gaudy Lizet is 34 years old.  She lives with her partner and their children in her own home.  They live in a large community in the urban area of Zana, in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region.

Guady Lizet has a business on her property where she raises and sells small animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, and other animals.  She's been doing this work for more than 10 years, and she has good personal and work references from her neighbors.

Guady Lizet is requesting a loan to buy feed for her animals.  This way, she can make her business grow and generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is grateful that she was granted a 25000 PHP loan which she used to renovate the space she is renting out to a repair shop. Through her earnings she is able to support herself and meet all her needs.

She would now like to apply for another 25000 PHP loan which she will use for the materials and cost of labor for the continuous maintenance of her place.  She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her. Her rental income is a big help to cover her daily sustenance and medical needs. 

Helen dreams of building a bigger place to improve her income. She prays for good health and long life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials and maintenance of the place she is renting out.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
JOSE MANUEL TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU PAREJA E HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE ZAÑA, DE LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE,EN LA QUE LOS POBLADORES SE DEDICAN MAYORMENTE A LA VENTA DE DULCES TÍPICOS DE LA CUIDAD Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES, GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS.

ÉL SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES COMO PATOS, PAVOS, GALLINAS Y POLLOS,ENTRE OTROS HACE MAS DE 4 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU DOMICILIO, POR LO QUE CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS DENTRO DE LA LOCALIDAD.

SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA MOTOTAXI, DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER UN INGRESO ADICIONAL A LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y DE ESTA MANERA PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel is 29 years old and lives with his partner and children in his own home.  They live in a large community in the urban area of Zana in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region.  In this place, the residents work mainly selling sweets that are traditional to the city as well as raising and selling small animals.  Jose Manuel has good personal and work references from his neighbors.

Jose Manuel has a business raising and selling small animals such as: ducks, turkeys, hens, chickens, and other animals.  He has more than 4 years of experience with this business, which is on his property.  This is why he has good references from the area.

Jose Manuel is requesting a loan to buy a moto-taxi. This way he could have more income in addition to what he earns from his livestock and could improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Amparo has a general store business in the Philippines. Amparo requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

Amparo has been in this business for three years. In the future, Amparo would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Ofelia dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 34 years old. She is married and has two children who both go to school. In order to help support her family, Melinda runs her own business. She runs a stationary shop that also provides photocopying and Mobile money transfer services. She enjoys running her own business because it gives her an opportunity to support her family members and meet people from all walks of life.

This is Melinda's first Kiva loan. She says the loan will change her life as it will enable her to grow her business by serving customers who need to send and receive money from her shop. This will help her earn more profits. The anticipated increase in the profits will make it much easier for Melinda to support her family, she explains that her profit margins are currently very low, so she does not have enough money to run the business.

loans.use: to grow her business by serving customers who need to send and receive money from her shop

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma.fe manages her current business (sari-sari store) with a lot of passion and diligence. Recently, she availed a loan that was faithfully paid back. With the given amount of Php 12,000, she was able to supply her store with a sufficient-enough supply of grocery items that she sold as a source of income. 

To continue the improvement in her current inventory, she would like to request again a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 that she will be using in buying more stocks and supplies of merchandise. This will be a wide-open opportunity to her to gain a better income and profit. If this happens, it will be a great help for her family's expenditures. 

For now, she likes to send you her sincerest thanks. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery products and personal items for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of fresh fruits and assorted vegetables for resale a profit

loans.name: Ma. Ninfa

texts.en:
Ma. Ninfa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Ninfa is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Ninfa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ma. Ninfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abarinzi Cb B Need Edit Group

texts.en: Abrinzi is a group led by Francine who is 29 years old. The group name means “guardians” in English. She is married with four children ages 4 to 10 years. She owns a retail shop and has been in business for the past three years. The group members sell different items and they share the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Francine would like to buy more soap, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanakombo operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and other fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in  her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and fruits for resale

loans.name: Cephas

texts.en:
Cephas runs a small business in the mining town of Kitwe, Zambia. He is 35 years old and lives with his wife Lilian and their three children. Cephas is the sole breadwinner of the family as his wife Lilian stays home to take care of their children. He is requesting a loan in order to increase the capital he needs to run his business, so that he can be able to serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits will help Cephas provide the basic needs for his family and help out his extended family as well. He explains that he was born in a family of four. His father is deceased and he has to help support his mother.

Asked what he likes about his business, Cephas says his business helps people in Zambia to move their monies safely. He gets satisfaction from the interaction with his customers and knowing that he is making a different by providing financial services to people in his community. Cephas would like to thank the Kiva lender for their support. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to increase the capital he needs to run his business so that he is able to serve more customers with their money transfers

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra, age 41, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop including threads, needles, and cloth. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Bushra, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase the needed tailoring machine, needles, thread and fabric with the help of the loan. Bushra is happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of materials for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Suglo Mali Nyori, Nyong-Nayili Group

texts.en:
Mayama is a 35-year-old hard-working woman from Nyong-Nayili, in the northern region of Ghana. She is married with six children. Mayama is the person pictured sitting with her hand raised and roasting equipment in front of her, among her group mates. 

Mayama is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the past five years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo mali nyori, Nyong-Nayili’. She earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium shea butter for the local and export markets. Mayama and ‘Suglo mali nyori, Nyong-Nayili’ have requested a loan of GHS 18,200. Mayama’s share of the loan is GHS 700 which she would use to buy shea nuts for processing. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and help her support her children in school. 

Mayama is very grateful to Kiva lenders and hopes to see her group sustain their relationship with Grameen Ghana and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 24 years old and is the second born in a family of four. He lives in Kitwe, which is the largest city in Zambia,and operates his mobile money transfer business. The business not only provides for himself, but also his siblings. James likes to describe his business as the service of sending and receiving money from one location to another in Zambia. He started operating the business as a way to provide for his family. James enjoys the business because it is an opportunity for him to provide much needed financial services within the community. He enjoys interacting with all the customers from different walks of life that do business at his outlet. James requests a Kiva loan to purchase some branding materials such as paint and signage so that he can attract more customers who need to send or receive money at his shop. James is grateful for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders. He explains that access to financing as a small business owner in Zambia is very difficult. With his loan, James plans to grow his business by serving more customers. This is the first step toward reaching his goal of growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase some branding materials such as paint, and signage so that he can attract more customers who need to send or receive money at his shop.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 57 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Araceli is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Araceli has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 45 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Lilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Alma has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell.

Alma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eufemia is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Eufemia has a general store business in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eufemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Cerela is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cerela requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cerela has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cerela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Gemalyn is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gemalyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemalyn has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 40-year-old, mother of five children and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is taking loan for her husband who is a salesman by profession. He purchases a large quantity of goods from a wholesaler and sells it to the retailers. In this way he earns the money for his family. He provides all the inventories as per the demand of the retailers. He uses his motor bike to carry the goods and moves the goods from one place to another. With the passage of time the needs of his family have increased a lot, but his earning through this salesman work is insufficient to cope with their needs.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new inventories to increase his work.
Nasreen is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's salesman and goods distribution work

loans.name: Sugey Concepción

texts.es: Sugey desde niña sintió inclinación por la belleza y la estética,  realizó estudios tecnológicos en éste arte y posteriormente arrendó un local e inauguró su salón de belleza en el cual lleva 10 años de funcionamiento.  En sus salón de belleza, ofrece servicios de corte de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado, iluminaciones y demás, sus principales clientes son sus amigos, familiares, vecinos y referidos a quienes ofrece sus servicios todos los días en el horario de 9 a.m. a 8 p.m. en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra productos capilares necesarios para la prestación de sus servicios; Masajes, shampoo y tintes. Esta inversión es muy significativa para mejorar el servicio puesto que el cliente tendrá la oportunidad de escoger tratamientos de acuerdo a sus necesidades y así ella obtendra una ganancia adicional.  Sugey desea a largo plazo ampliar su negocio para tener más capacidad, oportunidad y agilidad en el servicio, así mismo continuar trabajando para ayudar en la educación de sus hijos de 18 y 9 años de edad.  Su meta familiar es comprar su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Since she was a child Sugey has felt attracted by beauty and style. She took technical courses in this art and after that leased a shop and opened a beauty salon which has been functioning 10 years now. She offers hair cuts, styling, dyes, straightening, high-lights and others in her shop. Her main clients are friends, acquaintances, neighbors and people referred to her. She offers her services everyday from 9 am to 8 pm.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in buying hair products needed to offer her services: massage oil, shampoo and dye. This investment is very significant to improve her service as the client will have the opportunity to choice treatments according to their needs and she will gain an additional profit.

Sugey wants to expand her business in the long term to have more capacity, opportunity and flexibility in it's service. Thus she can continue to work to support the education of her children who are 18 and 9 years old. Her goal for her family is to buy a house and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair products needed to offer her services: massage oil, shampoo and dye.

loans.name: Joelito

texts.en:
Joelito is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol and the father of seven children. Four of his children are still attending school and his youngest child is 10. He sells fish to earn a living. He is 48 year old and has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, straw and weights. With the presence of these tools, it could boost his fishing yield and help him to sell more fish. Thus he will be able to provide good food and continued finances for the schooling of his children.  

With these, Joelito hopes that he could properly handle his fishing livelihood, to be more  sustainable in the year's to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, straw and weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale

loans.name: Jean Patrick

texts.fr:
Jean Patrick est un artisan talentueux et méticuleux. Il fabrique et vend des arts malagasy spécialement en raphia comme nous pouvons les voir sur sa photo (paniers, sacs, trousses, boîtes à bijoux, sous plats, pantoufles, bonbonnières, etc...). Il est dans ce métier depuis 2008. Auparavant, il travaillait en tant qu'agent de sécurité dans une société et puisqu'il n'avait jamais eu l'occasion de s'épanouir et de montrer ses talents, il décidait de démissionner, en plus le salaire était lamentable et la chance de promotion est très mince.
Il a déjà des clients fixes qui lui commande régulièrement des articles préalablement bien définis. Son objectif est d'ouvrir un atelier pour pouvoir travailler aisément et confortablement.
Jean Patrick a 33 ans, il est marié et père de trois enfants de 3, 8 et 10 ans dont les deux premiers vont actuellement à l'école. Son rêve est de leurs offrir une meilleur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Jean Patrick is a talented and meticulous artisan. He fabricates and sells Malagasy crafts, especially those made out of raffia as can be seen in the photo (baskets, bags, purses, jewelry boxes, place mats, house shoes, candy dishes, etc.) He has been in this field since 2008. Before that, he was working as a security guard in a company and because he never had the opportunity to demonstrate and develop his talents, he decided to resign. In any case, the salary was horrible and there was little chance of promotion. 

He already has some repeat clients who place regular orders for articles that are clearly defined in advance. His objective is to open a workshop so that he can be at ease for his work, in a comfortable place.

Jean Patrick is 33, married, and the father of three children aged 3, 8, and 10. The two older ones are presently enrolled in school. His dream is to offer his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raffia, dyes, glue, and cloth woven of raffia

loans.name: Jeanne Alice

texts.fr:
Âgée de 32 ans, Jeanne Alice est une femme très simple (campagnarde) et travailleuse. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants de 11 et 13 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés.
Elle tient un stand d'alimentation spécialiste en "Kafe sy mofo" depuis 2012. Avant cette année, la famille habitait à la campagne et elle s'occupait seulement du ménage et du petit élevage et culture vivrière et maraîchère. Son mari effectue de la livraison du lait entier dans le capital et c'est lui qui a trouvé le local pour le "kafe sy mofo".
L'objectif de Jeanne Alice est de construire sa propre maison, elle a déjà acquis un petit bout de terrain pas loin de son commerce, car elle ne supporte pas de vivre avec ses beaux parents.
texts.en:
Aged 32, Jeanne Alice is a simple, hardworking country woman. She is married and the mother of two children, 11 and 13, who are both enrolled in school.  She has had a specialty food stall  "Kafe sy mofo" (Coffee and Bread) since 2012. Before that time, the family lived in the country and she just took care of the household, raised some poultry, and grew vegetables for home consumption or sale. Her husband delivers whole milk in the capital and he is the one who found the venue for the "kafe sy mofo".

Jeanne Alice's goal is to build her own house. She has already managed to acquire a little piece of land not far from her business, since she can't stand to live with her parents-in-law.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, edible oil, concentrated milk, whole milk, and some utensils (cooking pot, display case, molds, cups)

loans.name: Kenny

texts.en:
Kenny is 42 years old. He is married and has two children. His eldest is aged 15 and is in 10th grade and his youngest is five years old and has not started school yet.  

Kenny runs his mobile money transfer and has a full time job working with farmers in Lundazi, a town in eastern Zambia, near the border with Malawi. 
He started running his mobile money transfer business when he noticed that a lot of the farmers he works with did not have any way to access proper financial services.  Being a Zoona mobile money transfer agent means that Kenny offers the service of sending and receiving money to his community. He makes a profit every time a customer uses the service at his trading booth. He says being a Zoona mobile money transfers agent has helped him to serve his community by bringing the financial service closer for the farmers, so that they do not have to travel long distance to receive money for their crops.

When asked what his biggest challenge is, he sites the lack of working capital. He says the saddest part is that, when he runs out of cash at his store, he has to make his customers wait, while he goes out to look for money.  He is grateful for the opportunity to get a Kiva loan, as it will help boost his working capital and he will earn more profit and serve his community better. The profits will go towards providing a better education for his children. 

He thanks the Kiva lenders

loans.use: To increase his cash on hand so that he can serve more farmers in his community, who need to access Zoona financial services

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles works hard to support his family. He runs a small grocery shop in Chingola, a mining town in the Copper belt province of Zambia. He is 31 years old and married to Elizabeth. 

Charles has been running his business since he dropped out of high school eleven years ago. In his shop, he also offers mobile money transfers through Zoona. He became a Zoona agent six months ago. Being a mobile money agent means that Charles provides the service of mobile money transfers to his community and gets a commission for every transaction he does. 

Charles says offering mobile money transfers at his grocery shop sets him apart from other grocery shops in the area. He believes that part of the reason he has stayed in business and been able to compete with big supermarkets is the relationship he has with people. He needs the Kiva loan so that he can increase his Zoona Mobile money transfers working capital, so that he can serve more customers and earn more commissions. This in turn will help Charles order more grocery stocks for his shop, as this is his only source of income. 

Charles aspires to one day own a big supermarket, where customers can walk in and do their transactions and shopping freely.

loans.use: To increase his Zoona Mobile money transfers working capital, so that he can serve more customers and earn more commissions to improve his standard of living

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old, married to Richard and supports a family 5 children. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 14 years earning KES8,000 per month. 

Jane has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old, married with five children. Two of Teresita's children are in school.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Teresita aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhoda is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rhoda has a business, selling sea foods in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is a single mother who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a food cooking business for the past five years selling to the neighbors.She mentioned seasonality in her place of operation.
  
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sugar, cooking oil, beans, salt and wheat flour .She decided to join Yehu to access loan and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, beans, salt and wheat flour

loans.name: Tertuliana

texts.en: Tertuliana is from Pagadian. She and her husband have rice land and earns a living doing farming activities. Recently, Tertuliana availed a loan to buy bags of fertilizers to yield more harvest. Tertuliana deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizers for the rice crop

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish vending

Eva dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 5 hijos vive en Echeandia en la comunidad la Dolorosa provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de naranjilla y cria animales solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para aumentar el ganado para producir leche y vender, realizara la compra en Echeandia, su sueño es tener mucho ganado para poder producir mas y mejorar la economia de la familia, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasearse con su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana is 49 years old. She is married and has five children. They live in Echeandia in the Dolorosa community, located in the Bolivar province. Mariana makes a living in the agricultural sector, growing oranges and raising livestock. She is requesting this loan in order to buy animals to increase her livestock and produce milk to sell. She will buy the animals in Echeandia. 

Mariana's dream is to have many livestock and be able to produce more and improve her family's economic circumstances. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Imbula

texts.en:
Imbula is 42 years old. He is humble and generous. He lives with his wife and their child in a rural town called Sioma, located in the western province of Zambia. 

He runs a general store and offers financial services to people in his home town of Sioma. People come to his shop to send and receive money via Zoona to and from their loved ones all over Zambia. 

Imbula's biggest challenge is that he is located in a rural area and is far from the bank, this makes it difficult for him to convert his cash on hand into electronic and vice versa. It is for this reason that he is requesting for his first Kiva loan. This loan will help him have more money in his business to make it much easier for him to serve his customers. He explains that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will only go to the bank once a day, this will help him keep his shop open. In a day, Imbula serves at least 10 customers. 

He is hopeful that once he gets the loan, he will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits. With the profits, he will be able to pay for school fees for his child and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To have the funds needed for him to serve customers' financial transactions via Zoona in rural Sioma, Zambia

loans.name: Shoirajon

texts.en:
Shoirajon is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan, in to a family of workers and she is now living in a rural area with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She has worked for almost nine years as a teacher for the initial class at secondary school. She is a good teacher and cares about each student. Her standard of living is good. 

She is planning to buy furniture for her house. Her salary is not enough to purchase furniture. She appealed to IMON to ask for a loan to enable her to buy furniture. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house, as her teacher's salary is low

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six kids, whom  two attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasha operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business She is married and she has two children and she is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family. Her husband is also a farmer. She will use the loan to buy a buffalo. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00. 

Helena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María tiene 29 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Echeandia, ella se dedica a la agricultura , a la cria de ganado y a la venta de visuteria, solicita el crédito para la compra de toretes para criarlos y luego venderlos, gracial a este crédito podra tener un capital de trabajo para hacerle rotar y tener mas, las compras realiza en la plaza de animales de Echeandia, los desafios a los que se enfrenta esque se le muera su ganado y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: María is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. They live in Echeandia, located in the Bolivar province. María works in the agricultural sector, raising and selling cattle and also selling costume jewelry. María is requesting this loan in order to buy young bulls to raise and later sell. Thanks to this loan, she will have the working capital to help her business. She will buy the animals in Echeandia, in the animal plaza. Challenges María has faced include animals dying. In her free time, María likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: St. Francisco School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rose. She is the head teacher of St. Francisco Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kijjungu in Hoima with 600 students. 

St. Francisco School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Francisco School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. 

Rose ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells mostly school supplies like paper, pens, notebook, intermediate pads and various goods like biscuits, noodles, toiletries and beverages.   She is a 29 year old married woman with two children ages  2 and 7 year old respectively.She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store for 5 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy school supplies, soft drinks and assorted goods.  These will keep her store full of stock and she will be able to cater to the needs of her respective customers. In this way, her income will augment and be able to settle her obligations. She could now expand her business and be able to provide healthy meals to the whole family.

She hopes that she will be able to manage her business properly for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, soft drinks and assorted goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sabougnou V Group

texts.fr:
Djeneba  est une  éleveuse  de mouton et de chèvre  en plus de cela elle fait le commerce des tissus, âgé de 49 ans, elle habite au Mali  et mère de 06 enfants âgée de 13  à 30 ans dont(6) six fréquente l’école.
Son marie est cultivateur et éleveur de mouton de chèvre.
Elle exerce ce métier il y a 8 ans de cela, elle vend ses tissus et mouton  au marché non loin de sa localité.
Elle a sollicité un prêt  pour  accroitre ses activités d’élevage, le bénéfice du  prêt servira à  l’auto suffisante alimentaire.
Dans l’avenir elle veut  être une  grande  éleveuse  de bélières et chèvre. Elle  est au centre de la photo du groupe  tenant le bélier.
texts.en:
Djeneba raises sheep and goats. In addition, she does commerce in fabrics. She is 49 years old, a resident of Mali, and the mother of six children, aged 13 to 30, of whom six are in school. Her husband is a farmer and raises sheep and goats. She has been working in her trade for eight years selling fabrics and sheep at the market not far from her town. 

Djeneba is requesting a loan to grow her livestock business. The profits from the loan will go toward food self-sufficiency. For the future, she wants to be a major supplier of sheep and goats. She is the one in the center of the photo holding a sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to sell later

loans.name: Nakan 02 Group

texts.fr: Kadidia est une femme travailleuse, marié et mère de 5 enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Elle est la responsable du groupe et elle sensibilise les autres membres à bien travailler afin que les remboursements se fassent à la bonne date. Kadidia, depuis 25 ans vend des plats(assiettes, des cueilleurs, des bassines). Elle a besoin du prêt pour s’approvisionner. L'activité de Kadidia marche bien car elle a un bon emplacement dans le marché ou elle vend. Après se ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de faire les dépenses de sa famille et aussi de commencer à préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kadidia is a hard-working woman who is a married mother of five children, of whom some are in school. She is the official of the group and is making the other members aware of how to work well, so as to make the loan payments on time. For 25 years, Kadidia has been selling dishes (plates, spoons, basins). She has need of a loan to stock up. Her business is doing well, since she has a good location at the market where she makes her sales. Her profits will enable her to cover family expenses and also to get ready for the start of her  children’s academic year.

loans.use: to purchase dishes to sell

loans.name: Oulan Kafona Group

texts.fr:
Issouf est celui qui tient la corde du bœuf à droite avec un t-shirt rouge sur la photo, âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants, âgés de 8mois à 10 ans. Parmi ses enfants un seul fréquente l’école.
Il exerce l’embouche bovine depuis plus de 4 ans. Issouf achète ses bœufs au marché de sa localité, il les engraisse et revend au même marché.
Les autres membres sur la photo sont également des emboucheurs bovines. Il fait  recourt au RMCR pour bien pratiquer  mener son embouche.
Il prend de l’argent pour acheter plus de bœufs destinés à l’embouche.  Avec ce prêt, son rêve est d’être un grand vendeur de bœuf de sa localité. Il  contribue  maintenant  plus à l’autosuffisance alimentaire et à la santé de ses enfants et  de toute  sa  famille.
texts.en:
Issouf is the one in the photo holding the cattle’s rope and wearing a red T-shirt. He is 39 years old and a married father of five children, aged 8 months to 10 years old. Among his children, just one is in school. Issouf has been a livestock farmer of cattle for over four years. He purchases steers at the market in his town, fattens them, and resells them at the same market. The other members in the photo are also livestock farmers of cattle. 

Issouf turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to carry out his work well in fattening cattle. He is using the money to purchase more cattle for fattening. With the profits, his dream is to be a major cattle vendor in his town. He now contributes more to the food self-sufficiency and to the healthcare of his children and the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell later

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A Sra Maria tem 60 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 03 filhos maiores de idade e independentes. Tem também na sua responsabilidade dois netos que frequentam o ensino primário.
É funcionária de estação agrária, exercendo a função de auxiliar de machamba. Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00mts, pretende comprar cimento, area, pedra para fazer acabamentos da sua casa.
Esta senhora sonha em concluir a sua casa e o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old, married, and the mother of three adult and independent children. She also takes care of two grandchildren that attend primary school.

She works at an agricultural station, growing food. With the loan of 15,000 Mts, she plans to buy cement, sand, and gravel to finish building her house.

This woman dreams of finishing building her house and her challenge is to pay back the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to finish building her house.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 4 filhos menores de idade, apenas 2 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus irmãos que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha numa empresa de água como engarrafadora a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois enfrentando dificuldades para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência solícita o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku para adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões e mais. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e mobilar a mesma.
texts.en:
She was born in the Namaacha province of Maputo. She is 38 years old and married. She has four underage children; only two of them go to school. She also takes care of her siblings, who live with her.

She has been working for a water bottling company for more than eight years, bottling water. With her salary, she covers the home expenses.

Now that she is having difficulties to continue building her house, she is requesting her fourth loan from Hluvuku to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and bars.

Her plans for the future are to finish building her house and furnish it.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bars and other construction materials.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old and married with three children, all in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for her family.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Vilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, snack foods, beverages, pancit (noodles), vinegar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 44 years old and married with two children, a 23-year-old son and a 14-year-old daughter. The family lives in the capital Tbilisi because Davit's primary job is at an office in the city.

However, every weekend Davit goes west to the rural Kareli region, where he has has eleven beehives on his relatives' estate. Davit is passionate about caring for his bees. On the one hand, it means work. On the other hand, he enjoys being outside, working with the animals and keeping an eye on their development. As there is enough free space and there are plenty of flowering plants around, he decided to extend the beekeeping.

The loan allows him to buy eight more bee colonies and hives. His vision for the future is to have a total of 30 hives one day. Selling the honey generates additional family income. As a side effect, the local fruit growers benefit from the reliable pollination of their trees.

loans.use: to buy eight bee colonies and hives in order to increase family income with the honey.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, 34, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of one child. She is a seller and earns, on average, an income of USD 2.50 a day

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nilda is 61 years old and all of her children are still in school.

Nilda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like thread, cloth, needles, zippers and spare parts for her tailoring machine.

Nilda has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, cloth, needles, zippers and spare parts for her tailoring machine

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 39-year-old lady and mother of three daughters. All her daughters are students in different grades. She lives at Birpara in Alipurduar district of West Bengal with her husband and daughters in their small hut. Her husband is a farmer by profession, engaged in farming activities. 

Kalpana runs a milk-selling business to supplement her family income. As there is growing demand for cow's milk in the locality, she has planned to purchase one cow to add some extra income for her family.  Hence, she came up with the idea to avail a loan to expand her business. 

So Kalpana seeks a loan from Kiva through BJS. The loan will help her to earn and give a good education to her children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness for a woman who desires the betterment of her family.

Kalpana's full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 33 years old, married and residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters and her husband is an auto repair mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto repair workshop for the last few years. He also has spare parts in the workshop for exchange in the auto during repairs. He needs to purchase some tools for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed items. Therefore, his wife, Shazia, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's auto repair business

loans.name: Bukhori

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Bukhori, one of Ruma’s agents. Bukhori lives in North Bogor, a suburban area in West Java located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He is happily married. He and his wife have one cute daughter.

Bukhori owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for his community. He already joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology. Bukhori is a hardworking guy, as well as a family minded person. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Bukhori is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Bukhori improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Bukhori is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of his local community.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 21 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Karen has a general store business in the Philippines. Karen requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Karen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Karen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income in support to his husband's income for their family she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma has always been enthusiastic of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Liloan, Bonifacio and has made good earning doing this type of work. Recently, Alma applied for a loan to pay for post harvest operations of her palay for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. In the future, Alma hopes to buy another rice land to till for added income in the family.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations of her palay for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her rice harvest to make way for another cropping season

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011, and he appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. To earn a living, he has managed his farming business to sustain his family's needs. Jose is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. He has a small piece of farmland near his home. He is preparing for the future, especially for his grandchildren. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000PHP. This loan is intended to buy farm supplies and finance his mango and other fruit bearing tree planting project. Jose dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and finance his mango and other fruit bearing tree planting project

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and lives in Oroquieta. Her husband earns a living through farming activities. At the age of 57,  Lolita has never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

From her desire to earn additional income, she engaged in a sari-sari (small grocery) store business; PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She wishes to increase her inventory and purchase bags of fertilizer for their farm.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and also to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Eleuteria is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricar is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricar has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maricar requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Maricar has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 40 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Ma. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 58 years old now.

Marilyn has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials needed for her business like bamboo leaves, etc..

Marilyn has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed for her business like bamboo leaves, etc.for her weaving business

loans.name: Sergio Duverni

texts.es: Sergio tiene 62 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos con los que vive en Echeandia, el se dedica a la agricultura y tambien a pintar casas, solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y semillas para sembrar maiz y arroz, realiza las compras en Echeandia su sueño es comprarse mas terrenos para sembar mas y tener un incremento para los gastos de la familia, el desafio al que se enfrenta es el peligro de la serpientes que existen en los sembrios, en su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y descansar.
texts.en:
Sergio is 62, married, and lives with his two children in Echeandia. He farms, and also paints houses. He is requesting the loan in order to buy fertilizer and seed for growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases in Echeandia.

His dream is to buy more land so that he can grow more and have more income for the family expenses. The challenge he faces is the danger from the  snakes in the fields. In his free time he likes watching television and resting.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a widow, she lives in San Pedro, Dapitan City. Estela has a fish vending business and owns a fish pond, she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of activity for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials, additional fingerlings, and equipment for her fish pond. Estelahas recently became an active member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, additional fingerlings and equipment for her fish pond

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: La Parada De Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Parada de los Lobos está conformado por cuatro personas muy alegres y unidas; son familiares pero entre ellos también hay una gran amistad. Pertenecen a una comunidad mexiquense que aún conserva los orígenes de la cultura mazahua así como su lengua. La principal actividad económica es la producción de maíz y la cría de animales de corral. 
   A Doña Cristina la caracteriza la entrega que brinda a su familia con base en el trabajo que realiza. Vive casada desde hace quince años con Don Tomás y han tenido siete hijas de las cuales cinco aún continúan con sus estudios. 
   Abrió hace ocho una tienda de abarrotes con muy buenos resultados, siempre la mantenía bien surtida y con un excelente servicio. No obstante, debido a un cambio de domicilio tuvo que dejar pendiente la actividad pues en su anterior localidad ya tenía una base sólida de clientes. 
   Ahora desea iniciar con el pie derecho en su nuevo hogar y ya adecuó un espacio amplio para ofrecer la mercancía: “Creo que estoy en un muy buen lugar, a pie de la carretera donde transita mucha gente, creo que será un muy buen negocio" comenta entusiasmada. Por tal motivo solicita el préstamo para comprar lo necesario e iniciar de nuevo el camino del éxito.
    Las metas de Doña Cristina son claras  "Hacer crecer poco a poco mi negocio para poder implementar un molino de nixtamal, ya que en la comunidad donde ahora vivo no hay y es muy necesario". 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Maurilio y Damián quienes invertirán en comprar ganado ovino y Adrián, en pavos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio donde viven los integrantes. Cerca se encuentran un quiosco, el palacio de gobierno, una plazoleta y una iglesia católica.
texts.en:
The group La Parada de los Lobos is made up of four very happy and united people; They are family but among them there is also a great friendship. They belong to  belong to a Mexiquense community that still maintains the origins of Mazahua culture and their language. The main economic activity is the production of corn and raising poultry.

Maria Cristina is characterized by the service that she provides to her family based on the work she does. She has been married for fifteen years with Don Tomás and have had seven daughters of which five are still studying.

Eight years ago she opened a grocery store with very good results. She has always kept it well stocked and with excellent service. However, due to a change of home address, she had to stop this activity in the previous location where she had a solid customer base.

Now she wants to start on the right foot in their new home and has already found an appropriate space to deliver goods: she says enthusiastically "I think I'm in a very good location, walking distance from the road where many people walk, I think it will be a very good deal". Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy supplies and restart the path to success.

The other group members are Maurilio and Damian who invest in buying sheep and Adrian, who will invest in turkeys.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

location.town: Los Lobos Segunda Seccion, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 50 years old, married to Aska and supports a family of 7 children. He has been practicing farming for the last 26 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Robert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to use for improving quality and quantity of his farm produce for better gains. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start another retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: For improving quality and quantity of produce for better gains.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a  major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fuel for resale

loans.name: Grecia Nathaly

texts.es: Grecia tiene 26 años de edad tiene 2 hijos vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar ella se dedica a la cria de animales por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y cerdos para aumentar sus animales, las compras realiza en la plaza de animale sde Echeandia, su sueño es incrementar su negocio de pollos, y salir adelante con sus hijos sola, en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar y dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en: Grecia is 26 years old. She has two children. They live in Echeandia, in the province of Bolivar. She makes a living raising animals, which is why she is requesting this loan. She will buy chickens and pigs to increase her supply of animals. Grecia will buy her animals in the plaza in Echeandia. Her dream is to expand her chicken business, and move forward with her children on her own. In her free time, Grecia likes to play with her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 57 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Rufina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rufina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rufina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 53 years old and married with five children.

Reyma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Reyma requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Reyma has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farm supplies.

loans.name: Cathy Chrissy

texts.en:
Here is Cathy, 57 years old and a nurse by profession. On this day we found her transporting baked bricks close to the spot where she is constructing a pigsty. She is married with 3 children. She also takes cares of 3 more kids belonging to her relatives. Her husband is a retired civil servant. The couple has a huge responsibility in terms of providing school fees, food, medical care and other necessities for the household. Because her monthly salary is low, about 198 USD, Cathy finds it really hard to rely on her job to support her household. 

As a bread winner, to cope up with a better living of standard, Cathy wants to venture into a pig enterprise aimed at generating enough household income to help address household needs. Hence she hopes the loan will enable her access capital to start a pig enterprise, affording her to buy feeds for her pigs, and also build her capacity on how best she can run her farm.  She hopes that returns which when combined with her salary will boost household income and enable Cathy and her husband sustain their family. Her goal is to be able to properly and successfully take care of herself and her family after she retires and she sees all that through pig enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, cement and receive training in pig production

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa hoped for good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Nelfa has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell. Nelfa wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell

loans.name: Ustina

texts.en:
Ustine is 35 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Ustine has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Ustine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Ustine to generate greater profits and increase working capital. Ustine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for selling in her stall

loans.name: Bellavista Group

texts.es:
“Bellavista” un grupo conformado por siete personas responsables de distintas actividades. Una de ellas es la Sra Rosaria de 47  años conviviente y con un hijo que aún está en la escuela. Ella se dedica hace quince años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño local de su propia vivienda con el propósito de salir adelante y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor deseo de Rosaria es seguir mejorando su negocio y apoyar a su menor hijo en sus estudios superiores es por eso que Rosaria trabaja mucho. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (Arroz, leche, golosinas, ETC)y así poder tener más ingresos.
