El grupo “Bellavista” agradece a los inversionistas de kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Rosaria es la segunda persona de lado izquierdo de la foto viste un polo celeste.
texts.en:
“Bellavista” is a group made up of seven people responsible for various businesses.

One of them is Rosaria, 47, who lives with her partner and one child who is still going to school. She has been selling groceries for 15 years from small shop in her own home with the aim of moving forward in life and helping her husband with the household expenses.

Rosaria's greatest desire is to continue improving her business and helping her young son with his higher education. This is why she works hard. 

She will use the loan granted to buy more merchandise, such as rice, milk, candy, etc., and have more income this way.

The “Bellavista” group is grateful to the Kiva investors for making this loan possible.  Rosaria is the second person from the left in the photo, wearing a blue T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.en: Mr. Aniceto has been working in the fields of Tabasco for over 20 years. His biggest dream is to build a proper home where he and his wife can grow old and enjoy their three children. In order to fulfill this dream, Aniceto has been working hard and saving as much as possible from his USD 500 a month income for several years. His eldest son began helping out, making it a little easier to save. Thanks to that, his dream is about to become a reality. But since Aniceto has a low income, he does not have access to a bank loan for his new home. He just needs a loan to finish paying for all the materials necessary for the construction. Both he and his son will work at the construction of their home, with supervision from a team of specialists to make sure their new home meets all the quality and safety standards.

loans.use: to finish paying for materials needed to build his home

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo lives in Tabasco where the humidity and heat are almost unbearable. He lives with his wife and his two kids. He wants to build them a proper home with good construction materials, so they can be inside the house during the summer months. Eduardo works at a factory, and he and his wife have been making an extra effort to save up enough money from their USD 700 a month salaries. They have almost enough to begin construction work, but since they have a low income, no financial institution will lend them what they need to finish buying good-quality construction materials. With this loan, Eduardo can begin working on his new home with supervision from professional technicians. Eduardo's family will soon have a quality and safe home.

loans.use: to finish paying for the materials he needs to finish his home.

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es: Javier es nacido en Colombia, en la actualidad Javier vive en Ecuador y comenta que esta muy contento que nuestra institución le permita solicitar un crédito. Javier tiene un hijo de 10 años y esta estudiando. Javier se dedica a trabajar de panadero a medio tiempo, también trabaja en un asadero de pollos y los días sábados y domingos se dedica a la comercialización de terneros, Javier solicita el dinero del credito para  comprar terneros. Javier solicita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros. Javier tiene la aspiración de quedarse en Ecuador ya que comenta que es un país donde si hay donde trabajar y mucho mejor que pueda acceder a un crédito, Javier vive arrendado y trabaja duro para poder cumplir su sueño de comprarse una pequeña casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Javier is from Colombia but lives in Ecuador now.  He is very happy, he says, to have access to the loans that our organization provides.  
Javier has a 10-year old son who is in school.  During the week, he splits his work-hours between a shop that sells bread products and another shop that sells roasted chicken.  On Saturdays and Sundays, he works for himself buying and selling calves.  He is asking for this loan to buy calves.

Javier wants to stay in Ecuador because he has work there and, more importantly, he has access to credit.  He rents a place now and hopes to buy a house one day so that he can provide his son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves for his livestock business.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio works selling and buying goods in his community in Tabasco. He lives at his mother’s house with his wife and baby girl. They soon want to build a home of their own where his child can grow up.Emilio’s wife has started mending clothes so they can save what they need for their home a little faster. Since in their line of work, it is difficult to prove a month-to-month income, no financial institution wants to lend them money, making it very hard for them to buy the necessary materials they need to start building their home. Emilio and his family need a loan to buy quality and safe materials to start building their new home.

loans.use: to finish paying for the materials needed to build his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a young father who works hard to give his wife and children a better life. He works selling crops in a town in Tabasco. Eduardo has been saving for the last couple of years to build his house. He started with the foundations and the plans but soon realized he was short on money. 

Eduardo needs a loan to pay for the materials so he can start with the construction. With your help he can start working on their new home right away. Given the fact that he has no way of proving income, no other financial institution will give them credit. With this loan, he will also receive technical supervision to make sure that the construction meets all safety and quality standards. This will give Eduardo and his family a new start!

loans.use: to buy materials to build his house.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a young father who works hard to give his wife and children a better life. He works as a construction worker in a town in Tabasco and goes to different communities to offer his services. Their current home is made up of perishable materials, and during the hot months in Tabasco it is almost unbearable to be inside.

Abraham works every day at construction sites, earning close to USD 600. His wife helps as much as possible with occasional jobs. This has allowed them to save up some money for their new home, but they still need a loan so they can get all the materials they need.

With your help, they can start working on their new home right away. Given the fact that they have no way of proving income, no other financial institution will give them credit. With this loan, they will also receive technical supervision to make sure that the construction meets all the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to finish his house.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson está casado, y tiene dos hijas, Nelson se dedica a diferentes actividades para mantener las necesidades de su familia, la producción de café orgánico y productos de hortaliza 100% orgánicos son las principales fuentes de ingresos, Nelson sueña con poder darles a sus hijas las mejores oportunidades en la vida, sobre todo que tengan una buena educación.
Actualmente en la región se está popularizando la producción de maracuyá orgánica la cual se comercializa por medio de Colmena de la cual Nelson es socio, el maracuyá es un cultivo novedoso ya que la región tiene las condiciones apropiadas para producirla sin mayor complicación.
Nelson solicita un crédito para plantar 0.6 hectáreas de maracuyá orgánico bajo la supresión técnica de Colmena con las ganancias de la producción él quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando para formar un patrimonio familiar. 	
Un crédito ayuda a Nelson a comprar plantas de maracuyá, postes, un sistema de riego y pago de mano de obra para su plantación de maracuyá orgánico.
texts.en:
Nelson is married and has two daughters. He works different jobs to support the needs of his family. The production of 100% organic coffee and vegetables is his main source of income. 

Nelson dreams of being able to give his daughters the best opportunities in life, especially for them to have a good education. Currently, organic passion fruit production is becoming more popular in the region; the fruit is sold through Colmena, of which Nelson is a member.  Passion fruit is a novel crop since this area has the appropriate conditions to farm it without any problems. 

Nelson is requesting a loan to plant 0.6 hectares (roughly 1.5 acres) of organic passion fruit under the technical supervision of Colmena. With the profit from the production, he wants to improve his family's quality of life and continuing working to accumulate assets for his children's inheritance.

A loan helps Nelson purchase passion fruit plants, posts, an irrigation system, and pay for labor on his organic passion fruit farm.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruit plants, posts, an irrigation system, and pay for labor on his organic passion fruit farm.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a working mom who lives in Tabasco with her family. Every morning Candelaria wakes up at dawn to go to work so she can save enough to put a roof over her children’s heads. Together with her husband she make around USD 12,000 a year and finally after years of hard work and saving as much as they can they can begin working on their home so their children can grow up in a homey and safe environment. 

However, they need this loan to start building right away, and she can complete paying for all the materials necessary to start the building process. Candelaria and her husband will work on the construction of their home along with certified technicians who will provide all the assistance and support needed to make sure their new home meets with all the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Judith Suffrin

texts.fr: Judith a 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. A l’entrée de sa maison, elle installe un stand de produits alimentaires. Elle a beaucoup de clients dans le voisinage et son activité est très prospère. Elle cherche un appui financier pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Judith is 39. She is married with three children. At the entrance to her home, she has set up a stall of food products. She has many customers in the neighbourhood and her business is doing very well. She requests a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy cans of butter and spaghetti.

loans.name: Marin Fresbindo

texts.es:
Marin Fresbindo Tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con Rosa Juventina con quien han procreado 3 hijos que aun están bajo su cargo, el sueña con poder darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y formar un pequeño patrimonio familiar.  Marin Fresbindo se dedica a la producción de café orgánico y de comercio justo y miel bajo la certificación orgánica, la certificación orgánica y de comercio justo son algo novedoso en la región ya que permiten proteger el medio ambiente además de brindar mejores oportunidades de comercialización de los productos.
Marin Fresbindo quiere certificar sus cafetales bajo la producción orgánica y ya que sus cafetales se han visto afectados por la edad y las plagas este es el momento propicio para replantarlos e iniciar la certificación con las plantaciones nuevas, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café Marin Fresbindo piensa mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Actualmente Marin Fresbindo solicita un crédito para replantar 0.5 hectáreas bajo la norma orgánica para los que necesita   comprar materiales como ser: Plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos y pago de mano de obra.
Un préstamo ayudaría a Marin Fresbindo a replantar su cafetal y convertirlo a producción orgánica.
texts.en:
Marin Fresbindo is 42 years old. He is married to Rosa Juventina and they have three children who are still in their care. He dreams of being able to give his children a good-quality education and forming a small family inheritance.

Marin Fresbindo makes a living by producing organic and fair trade coffee as well as honey under organic certification. Organic and fair trade certifications are something new in the region; they allow for protecting the environment and providing better opportunities for selling the products. Marin Fresbindo wants to certify his coffee farm under organic production standards. Since his coffee plants have been affected by age and by plagues, this is the ideal time to replant them and to start certifying the new plants. With the earnings obtained from his coffee, Marin Fresbindo intends to improve his quality of life. 

Marin Fresbindo is currently asking for a loan to replant half a hectare under organic standards. For this he needs to buy materials like coffee plants, organic fertilizer and organic supplies, and to pay for labor. A loan would help Marin Fresbindo to replant his coffee farm and turn it into organic production.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants, organic fertilizer and organic supplies, and to pay for labor to replant his coffee plantation under organic standards

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita finds pleasure in doing her photo shoot activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 54 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her activities. Carmelita wants to open her own photo booth and improve her existing business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase equipment needed to open her new photo booth.

In the future, Carmelita wishes to have a studio someday.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to open her new photo booth.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 21-year-old single lady living in Zarqaa. She is studying to take her bachelor’s degree.

Farah is trying her best to finish her degree and find good work to help her family in the household expenses. Recently she has been falling short in paying her fees. She decided to apply for an education loan to help her cover her semester fees.

Farah is a very ambitious girl; she wants to work in the same field and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tiéssiri Group

texts.fr:
Cheickné est celui qui tient la charrue en main sur la photo.
Agé de 24 ans Cheickné est agriculteur vivant dans une commune rurale au mali avec son épouse ménagère et ses 2 enfants, non encore scolarisés ; ils sont âgés de 1 à 3 ans. 
L’activité d’agriculture de Cheickné c’est acheté les animaux maigres, les engraissés et les revendre, en plus la culture d’arachide. Pour la pratique de son activité, il s’approvisionne au marché local en semence et animaux  et fait sa vente au comptant au grand marché. Il exerce cette activité pendant  4 ans, il souhaitera assurer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille surtout en habillement,  santé et nourriture suffisante pour les enfants et toute sa famille. Il quitta l’école à la huitième année et se sert les revenus de son activité pour faire face à ses propres besoins et de ses enfants. Le souhait de développer son embouche et culture  lui pousse à contracter le prêt auprès du RMCR.  La sécheresse est le vrai problème dans la culture d’arachide.
texts.en:
Cheickné is the one holding the plow in the photo. He is a farmer, 24 years old, and living in a rural commune in Mali with his homemaker wife and his two children not yet in school; they are 1 and 3 years old. In his agricultural business, Cheickné purchases underweight animals, fattens them, and resells them, in addition to growing peanuts. To operate his business, he gets his supplies of seeds and animals from the local market, and he makes his sales at the same market. He has been in this business for four years. His wish is to ensure his family’s living conditions improve, especially with regard to clothing, healthcare, and food sufficient for the children and his entire family. 

Cheickné left school in the 8th grade. He uses the revenues from his business to meet squarely his own needs and those of his children. The wish to develop his livestock farming and crops has pushed him to take out the loan from RMCR. Drought is the real problem with peanut farming.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for his field and animals to fatten

loans.name: Ma. Rosalinda

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalinda, 39, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite. She is married to Henry, a water-delivery man, and they have three children. The couple works hard and have a number of businesses to provide for their personal and household needs and to send their offspring to school.

She would now like to apply for a 51,000 PHP loan, which she will use for the materials and cost of labor for the improvement of her rooms for rent. Part of the loan she will use to pay for some grocery items to sell at her small store, which she is now putting up. Aside from her rental business, she also sells mineral water and has a backyard piggery to provide enough for her family's needs.

She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her. Her rental income is a big help to cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's schooling.

Ma. Rosalinda dreams to see all her children become professionals. She prays for good health and long life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her rooms for rent and pay for some grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is the age of 31; she is mother of one son and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his general store. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. 

Due to good relation his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Asifa requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Asifa thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for her husband's general store

loans.name: Tiéssiri Group

texts.fr:
Cheick Oumar Warikè est celui qui donne a mange au bélier.
Il est âgé de 57 ans, Cheick Oumar Warikè est agriculteur (embouche et culture d’arachide) vivant dans une commune rurale au mali avec sa femme commerçante et ses 6 enfants tous scolarisés, ils sont âgés de 11 à 19 ans, lui aussi est alphabétisé recalé de Baccalauréat Malien.
L’activité de Cheick Oumar Warikè consiste à acheter les béliers  maigres, les engraissés puis les revendre au comptant et à crédit au marché public, il achète aussi les intrants agricoles pour la culture d’arachide. Pendant plus de  6 ans il fait ce travail. il s’approvisionne au marché local, en souhaitant épanouir sa famille et le bien-être des enfants en santé, éducation et nourriture suffisante, son activité lui permet à se procurer des animaux en propriété.
Cheick Oumar aime travailler raison pour laquelle il fait recourt au RMCR pour développer son activité, souvent l’épidémie des animaux et le non abondance de pluie pendant l’hivernage fait rougir ses yeux.
texts.en:
Cheick Oumar Warikè is the one feeding the sheep in the photo. He is 57 years old and a farmer (livestock and peanuts) living in a rurale commune in Mali with his wife, a merchant, and his six children, all provided with education; they are from 11 to 19 years old. Cheick Oumar Warikè himself is literate but did not pass his Malian high school exit exam. 

His work involves purchasing underweight sheep, fattening them, and then reselling them, cash or credit, at the public market. He also buys farm inputs for growing peanuts. He has been in this business for over six years. He gets his supplies at the local market. Wishing for a thriving family and the well-being of his children (health, education, and food), he procures animals to own, thanks to his business. 

Cheick Oumar likes to work. This is why he has turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to develop his business. Often, animal epidemics and the dearth of rain during the rainy season will make his eyes red.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten and sell later

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in furniture, shelves, glass display cabinets, and widening her shop.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Abdoulaye  est le client qui tient en mains la corne du mouton.
Agé de trente un ans (31 ans) Abdoulaye est un  emboucheur malien des ovins. Marié, père de deux (02) enfants. Il rêve dans l’avenir d’acheter un terrain et le construire dans une ville pour ses enfants. Abdoulaye n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais il se défend bien dans son embouche. Abdoulaye a fait recourt au RMCR pour  soutenir et renforcer ses activités. Avec son prêt, il achète des moutons  et les aliments bétails dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il les engraisse et les revend dans la grande ville. Abdoulaye fait des bénéfices variant entre 75 000 à 125 000 FCFA par semestre. Abdoulaye fait l’embouche depuis plus de 15 ans. Grâce au soutien  du RMCR, ses activités marchent  bien. Ce qui lui plaisent beaucoup dans ses activités (embouche) en est qu’elles génèrent assez de profits ainsi que de la fumée organique pour ses champs. Abdoulaye ne se plaint pas trop seulement souvent les moutons crèvent d’une maladie de rhume  malgré les traitements.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is the client holding the sheep’s horn in the photo. He is a 31-years-old Malian who raises sheep. A married father of two, he dreams of purchasing a plot of land in the city for the future and building on it for his children. Abdoulaye did not have the chance to go to school, but he does well on his own fattening livestock. 

He has turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to support his business and bolster it. With this loan, he is buying sheep and some feed at the weekly markets in his area. He fattens them and resells them in the city. His profits vary from 75,000 to 125,000 francs CFA per semester. He has been fattening livestock for over fifteen years. 

Thanks to RMCR support, his business is going well. What he is very happy about in this work (livestock farming) is the fair amount of profits it generates, as well as the organic manure for his fields. Abdoulaye does not complain too much, except that his sheep often die of a flu-like disease despite treatment.

loans.use: to purchase animals and some feed

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 40s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running a catering business for 20 years now.  She works from 8pm to after midnight and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to replace the catering items and managed to attract many customers. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to save in her bank account, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses.  

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She will use this loan to buy new catering items to make her catering attractive for customers. She dreams of owning a canteen.

Mariam will share this loan with her group ARI MPYA which has four people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new catering items to make her catering attractive

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 46 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Peace has been working hard to manage her bar and a restaurant selling soda, beer, spirits, wine and cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, sodas, water, and food, and will help Peace to generate greater profits and stock the shop. Peace hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, water, and food

loans.name: Ayewa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de denrées alimentaires madame Ayewa, mère de 03 enfants demande un second prêt pour l'achat des produits alimentaires destinés à la vente. Elle souhaite avoir un grand étalage avec le profit qu'elle réalisera et mieux prendre soin de la famille. Son mari est maçon.
texts.en: A retailer of grocery items, Ms. Ayewa is a mother of three. She is asking for a second loan to purchase supplies to sell. With the profits she will make, she would like to have a large display of goods and to take better care of the family. Her husband is a mason.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is an 18-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. Her husband is the main income source and she is a housewife, and at the same time she is pursuing her education. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her university fees. 

In the future, she is planning to work at a proper company to gain good experience in her field and earn enough income to be able to help her husband with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 16 novembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et s'activent dans le commerce.
NDEYE à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles et 2 garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter de l'arachide décortiqué, le transformer en huile et en patte d'arachide. Elle se rend à kaolack et de fois au marche de diourbel pour acheter l'arachide. Elle achète le kilo à 400 FCFA. Après transformation de l'arachide, elle revend le litre d'huile à 900 FCFA et le kilo de la patte d'arachide à 700 FCFA.
Une partie des bénéfices récoltés lui permettra d’épargner et l'autre de s’occuper d'elle même et aussi de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of six members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 16, 2009. It is composed of women from the same district who keep up good relationships with one another and who are active in commerce. NDEYE, who is at the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is 42 years old and a married mother of five children (3 girls and 2 boys). 

With this loan, she is going to purchase some shelled peanuts and process them to make oil and peanut butter. She goes to Kaolack and sometimes to the Diourbel market to purchase peanuts. She purchases each kilo for 400 francs CFA. After processing the peanuts, she resells the oil at 900 francs per liter, and the peanut butter, at 700 francs per kilo. Part of the profits gathered will enable her to save some money. The rest is for taking care of herself and also her family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 38-year-old married man who has two children. He’s really attached to his family. He works hard to be able to cover their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He owns a shop in his town where he sells hardware. He had to work really hard to prove that he can provide the necessary support for his family, and clearly, he has gained a large number of customers who seek his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay fees for his children's studies. One of his greatest dreams is to see his children achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay fees for his children's studies

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en: Qusai is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Irbid. Qusai is studying for his bachelor's degree in his second year. Qusai's future plan is to take his degree and work in the same field. Qusai is applying for a loan to help him to cover his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To cover his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for building his place of business

loans.name: Drolence

texts.en:
Drolence is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Drolence has been working hard to manage her produce business, selling dry beans, rice and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Drolence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize to supply to schools, and will help Drolence to generate greater profits and enable her to meet other household needs. Drolence hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another branch in Kansanga.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to supply to schools

loans.name: Lidis Mercedes

texts.es: Lidis de 37 años, desesperada ante la situación económica en la que se encontraba decidió emprender su propio negocio;  con unos ahorros compró una canasta de cerveza y con la utilidad aunque escasa, logró continuar comprando e incrementando su inventario con muy buenos resultados tanto que logro diversificar la línea de productos.  Fue así como en el año 2011,  Lidis dio un cambio muy importante en su vida “inicio un negocio prospero”, hoy por hoy es una comerciante que brinda una amplia gama de productos que sus mismos clientes le manifestaron que les vendiera entre ellos las gaseosas y jugos.   Su horario laborar está comprendido entre las 4 p.m. y 3 a.m., los fines de semana. Sus proveedores son empresas distribuidoras de bebidas a quienes les realiza las compras de contado, es por ello que realizo un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual será invertido en la compra de canastas de cervezas.  Ella presta servicios desde su casa ubicada en el municipio de Barranquilla y es madre de 3 hijos,  un niño de 11 años y dos niñas de 9 y 7 años.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio, continuar aumentando su patrimonio y ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Lidis is 37 years old. When she found herself in a desperate economic situation, she decided to open her own business. With her savings, she bought a basket of beer and with her scarce earnings, she went on increasing her inventory and had very good results--so good that she was able to diversify her product lines. It was like this in the year 2011. Lidis experienced a very important change in her life, "I began a prosperous business." Today, she is a businesswoman who offers a wide variety of products to her customers including sodas and juices. Lidis' work schedule goes from 4 p.m. to 3 a.m. on the weekends. Her suppliers are distribution companies, from whom she makes purchases in cash. It is for this reason that she requested a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest to buy baskets of beer. Lidis also works in housekeeping in the city of Barranquilla. She is the mother of three children: one 11-year-old boy and two girls ages 9 and 7. Lidis' goal is to expand her business, keep building her assets, and providing for her family's well being.

loans.use: to buy baskets of beer.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits vivriers pour son activité(revendeuse de nourriture), madame Akou sollicite son quatrième crédit à WAGES. Les trois derniers ont été payés sans aucune difficulté. Elle espère agrandir son activité tout en contribuant aux besoins de la famille. Elle est âgée de 44ans.
texts.en: To purchase staple foods for her business (food seller), Ms. Akou is requesting her fourth loan from WAGES. The last three loans were paid back without any problems at all. She hopes to expand her business while helping to meet the needs of the family. She is 44 years old.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and oil

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She is 36 years old, married and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Lina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Lina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pousga Group

texts.fr:
Mr LASSANE est responsable du groupe  POUSGA. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait le commerce de sachets et de pâtes alimentaires depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 100 sachets et 500 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et aider sa famille. Il ambitionne être un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Mr. LASSANE is the official of the group POUSGA. He is a married father of three children. The oldest is 10, and the youngest is 3. Two of them go to school. He has four persons to support. 

Mr. LASSANE has been doing commerce in plastic bags and pasta for fifteen years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase 100 plastic bags and 500 boxes of pasta. He wants to use his profits from the loan to reinvest in his business and help out his family. His ambition is to be a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase 100 plastic bags and 500 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her bar business, selling beer, sodas and other soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add to her stock of beers, sodas, other drinks, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay tuition fees. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to regain business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of beers, sodas, and other drinks

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 41 years old and lives in Kandal province, Cambodia. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. They are all attending primary school.

Currently, she sells mosquito nets, blankets, pillows and mats to factory workers. Phan and her husband have been running this business for 11 years. Phan has applied for a loan to purchase inventory to sell. She says that she needs working capital to support her business so that she can provide income to support her children who are studying.

loans.use: To buy mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and hammocks to sell

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Mme HELENE est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 23 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 07 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des légumes depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 1 sac d’oignons, un ½ sac de choux, ½ sac d’aubergines sauvages et 04 paquets de magies.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité et aussi payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. HELENE is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 23, and the youngest is 6. Four of them go to school. She has seven persons to support. 

Ms. HELENE has been selling vegetables for five years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, she wants to purchase a sack of onions, ½ sack of cabbage, ½ sack of wild eggplant, and 4 packets of magies [perhaps Maggie, a brand of bouillon flavoring]. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her business and also to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions, cabbage, eggplant, and magies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is heading into the next cropping season. She especially wants to be prepared for the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer so she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Evelyn hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer to raise more produce

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en: Chanly, 52, is a mother of four children and three of them are in school. They are living in Kampong Cham province. Presently, Chanly has been farming rice for 34 years and she can make around 33,300 KHR per day. At the moment, she is leading a group of two to take her fifth Kiva loan via VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to have enough household supplies to use. Now she is applying for this new Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming. She hopes to be able to buy a new motorbike after she gets more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
Jenith is 47 years old and married with eight children. With two of her children in school, Jenith works very hard to provide for them.

Jenith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Jenith has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Jenith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Wendnsongde Group

texts.fr:
Mme NONGASIDA est responsable du groupe  WENDNSONGDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans et ½. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce d’habits depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 05 douzaines d’habits, 04 pièces de pagnes et 06 douzaines d’habits pour enfants.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de prêts à porter et aussi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. NONGASIDA is the official of the group WENDNSONGDA. She is a married mother of two children. The older is 9, and the younger is 4 and a half. One of them goes to school. Ms. NONGASIDA has two persons to support. She has been doing commerce in clothing for four years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. 

With the money granted, she intends to purchase 5 dozen pieces of clothing, 4 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and 6 dozen pieces of children’s clothing. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to open a big store for ready-to-wear clothing and also to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, fabrics, and children's clothing

loans.name: Maral

texts.ru: Марал, 29 лет, замужем, образование- среднее, воспитывает 2 дочерей дошкольного возраста. Марал с 2008 года начала ее сельскохозяйственный бизнес. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу и помидоры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства Марал составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян для выращивания экологически чистых овощей. Доходы от кредита Марал планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Maral is 29 years old and married. She has a secondary education, and is raising 2 school-aged daughters. Maral began her agricultural business in 2008, and her farm now has 3 cows. She raises corn and tomatoes for on-farm consumption and resale on a plot of land measuring 2.0 hectares. Maral's monthly profit from her farm is around 19,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, Maral has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds to grow organic vegetables. Maral plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing organic vegetables.

loans.name: Aiganysh

texts.ru: Айганыш, 20 лет, не замужем, детей нет, образование средне-специальное, работает телефонным оператором. Айганыш в качестве основного дохода с 2012 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айганыш в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 30 овец, ежемесячный доход составляет 23,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айганыш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Айганыш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и купит ноутбук для работы.
texts.en:
Aiganysh is 20 years old, not married, and has no children. She has a specialist secondary education, and she works as a telephone operator. Aiganysh has practiced animal husbandry as her main source of income since 2012. Thanks to Aiganysh's very hard work, her farm now has 3 cows and 30 sheep, and her monthly income is 23,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, Aiganysh has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd. Aiganysh plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further increase the number of livestock she has, and to buy a laptop to use for her work.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Johnifer

texts.en:
Johnifer, a hardworking and responsible father, is managing his own retail store to support his family. He lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. 

He applied for a loan to restock his store with inventory items: slippers, sandals, sneakers and shoes. Johnifer is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits and supporting his children.

loans.use: to restock his store with inventory items: slippers, sandals, sneakers and shoes

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 35 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Christina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Crestina

texts.en:
Crestina is 43 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other personal care products to sell.

Crestina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is 59 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorenza has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 40 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic and other materials needed for her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Ismael De Jesus

texts.es:
Ismael es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en su pequeña finca de 1.17 hectáreas, de las cuales 0.78 son de café los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. 

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 20 quintales de café pergamino, y para este ciclo se ha propuesto incrementar este rendimiento productivo, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, que requiere su cafetal.

La meta de Ismael es alcanzar el máximo potencial de su cafetal, a fin de incrementar los ingresos para su familia y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Ismael is a coffee producer in the northern part of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and their three children on his small farm of 1.17 hectares of which 0.78 is coffee that he produces under the criteria for Fairtrade certification.

In the last few years, this producer has achieved a harvest of approximately 20 quintals [one quintal is approximately 100 pounds] of pergamino coffee.  For this cycle he has planned to increase this output, for which he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase supplies and fertilizers that his coffee farm needs.

Ismael's goal is to reach the maximum potential for his coffee plantation in order to increase the earnings for his family and to improve their economic condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers that he will use for his coffee farm to increase its productivity

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en: Sokheang is 33 years old and the mother of two children, who are all in school. They live in the province of Kampong Cham. Sokheang farms rice and has worked on other farms for a fee for fifteen years. She can earn about 54,500 KHR per day from her businesses. Now she is leading a group of three to take their first Kiva loan from VisionFund Cambodia. She will manage her loan portion to renovate her old house. She hopes her family’s standard of living improves.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Sitan est la femme qui tient la corne du bélier en main. C’est une ménagère Malienne, non scolarisée. Elle est âgée de cinquante-trois (53 Ans). Mère de (03) enfants tous scolarisés et âgés de vingt-sept (27) à douze(12) Ans. Son mari est cultivateur.
Depuis 2012 elle a fait recours au RMCR pour progresser son embouche ovine. Elle fait ses achats dans les différents marchés de sa zone et revend dans les zones voisines. Grâce à son bénéfice mensuel  estimé à trente mille francs (30 000f CFA) elle parvient à  aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille (frais de scolarité, médicaux, nourritures de ses enfants). Son rêve est de faire le commerce  entre le Mali et le Burkina Fasso.
En générale la perte d’animal et l’insuffisance d’aliment bétail sont les problèmes rencontrés souvent.
texts.en:
Sitan is the woman who is holding the ram's horn. She is an uneducated Malian housewife. She is a 53-year-old married mother of three children all in school, whose ages range from 12 to 27 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Since 2012 she has made use of RMCR to develop her sheep fattening business. She buys in different area markets and resells in neighboring areas.

With monthly profits estimated at thirty thousand francs (30,000 CFA francs) she manages to help her husband provide for the family (tuition fees, medical expenses, children's nutrition). Her dream is become a trader between Mali and Burkina Faso.

Generally speaking, loss of livestock and the lack of animal feed are the problems most encountered.

loans.use: buy lean rams to fatten and resell

loans.name: Justine Afiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants, Mme Justine Afiwa est mariée et est âgée de 45ans. Elle est couturière de profession et revend aussi des bois de chauffage. Elle achète les bois dans les marchés de l'intérieur et revend à Lomé. Elle est à son sixième prêt et veut cet argent pour acheter des bois de chauffage pour revendre à ses clients afin d’avoir du profit pour préparer son avenir, assurer une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justine Afiwa is the 45-year-old married mother of two children. She is a seamstress by profession and also resells firewood.

She buys the wood at in-country markets and resells in Lome. This is her sixth loan and she is requesting this money to buy firewood to resell to her customers.

This will enable her to generate profits, prepare for the future, and ensure her children's good living conditions.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy general food products

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Depuis 2011, Kodjo a ouvert son cybercafé pour rendre service à ceux qui n'ont pas d'internet à domicile. Dans son cybercafé, il répare aussi des portables et a commencé l'activité de l'élevage. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter des ordinateurs et accessoires informatiques. Il souhaite à l'avenir, avoir un grand cyber et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale. Il est âgé de 29ans.
texts.en:
Since 2011, Kodjo opened his cyber-cafe to accommodate those who do not have Internet at home, and where he repairs laptops. He also started a livestock-breeding business.

To develop his business, he is requesting a third loan to buy computers and computer accessories. He hopes in the future to run a great cyber-cafe and embark later into married life. He is 29 years old.

loans.use: buy electronic devices

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos, es un joven de 25 años que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua, con su esposa y sus dos hijos, y se dedica a la caficultura como principal actividad económica desde hace 8 años. Su finca es manejada bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Este pequeño productor señala que en los 3 años anteriores su producción de café ha presentado un aumento de un 60 por ciento, y para seguir mejorando la productividad de su finca, está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos y abonos que requiere su cafetal.

Su sueño es seguir incrementando su producción a través de un aumento en rendimiento y áreas establecidas, para ello menciona que el principal desafío es la falta de recursos que le permitan hacer una inversión a mediano plazo, sin embargo confía en que a través de organizaciones como PAC pueda acceder a este tipo de recursos más adelante, para continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and lives in the north of Nicaragua with his wife and two children. Carlos makes his main living growing coffee. He has been doing this work for eight years at his farm, which is Fair Trade certified.

This small-time producer says that he has increased coffee production by 60% in the past three years. In order to continue improving productivity, Carlos is applying for a loan in order to buy the supplies and manure that his crops need.

Carlos’ dream is to continue increasing production, increasing capacity and land used for his work. Carlos says that the biggest challenge he faces is dealing with a lack of resources, with which he would be able to make medium-term investments. Nevertheless, Carlos is confident that, through organisations such as PAC, he can access loans in the future and continue to improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure to use on his coffee crops and increase production.

loans.name: Nancy Rocio

texts.es: Nancy tiene 39 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cria ganado y chanchos, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia para ofrecerles variedad a sus clientes, realiza las compras en Ambato y en Guayaquil cada 15 días, su sueño es mejorar economícamente para poder mantener a sus hijos, en su tiempo libre le gusta cuidar de sus animales.
texts.en: Nancy is 39 years old, married and has two children. Nancy lives in Echeandia, in Bolivar province, Ecaudor. She makes a living selling clothes, and raising cattle and pigs. She is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise and have a variety of products to offer to her customers. Nancy buys her merchandise in Ambato and in Guayaquil every fortnight. Her dream is to improve her financial situation in order to support her children. In her spare time, Nancy likes to look after her animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Adriano is 40 years old and a widower. He has five children and all go to school. He deals in coffee planting and trade. He is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to assist him to buy more coffee for trade. He has a small retail shop that supplements this income. His challenge is drought and price fluctuation of coffee in the villages. His hope is to see his children attain high education levels. He appreciates the finacial support accorded him by both UGAFODE and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who are still attending school. She started her business by opening in her home a small room for vending makeup products, cosmetic tools and Tupperware using her special selling skills and providing high quality products. She also visits her clients based on their needs. She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality.

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. She is very proud as she was able to develop her business in a short time and hopes to open her shop the soonest.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 38 años de edad y cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en la caficultura. Actualmente, maneja una pequeña área de café en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua.

Es un hombre visionario y con emprendedurismo, ya que ha sabido aprovechar cada espacio en su finca. Además del café, también se dedica a la producción de frijol y maíz; para el auto consumo. Debido a la gran distancia entre el pueblo y su finca, Carlos debe producir gran parte de los productos esenciales para la nutrición de su familia.

Para este ciclo, Carlos ha decidido implementar un plan para mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetos, por lo que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le ayudarán a mejorar la producción agrícola. Su meta es continuar incrementando la productividad de su finca, y con ello asegurar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38, has eight years' experience in coffee-growing.  Currently he has a small coffee plantation in a rural community in northern Nicaragua.  

He is an entrepreneurial man with a vision who has known how to take advantage of his cropland.  Apart from coffee he also grows beans and corn for home consumption.  Because of the great distance between the village and his farm, Carlos must produce many of the essential products he needs to feed the family.

This season Carlos has decided to implement a plan to improve coffee crop nutrition, for which he is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help improve production.  His goal is to continue increasing production on his farm to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his coffee crop to improve production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, fresh meat and vegetables to sell at her store.

loans.name: Siyorn

texts.en: Siyorn, 26, a mother of two children, lives in Kandal province. The sources of her family’s income have been rice farming, construction work and tailoring for eight years. Her daily income is about 12.5 USD per day to support her family’s living. She is taking her first Kiva loan via VisionFund and she will manage her loan to purchase a motorbike and farmland to expand her current business. She expects that her loan portion to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and farmland

loans.name: Johny Roberto

texts.es: Johny tiene 35 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos viven en Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar, el se dedica a la cria de pollos y tambien tiene un disco movil el cual alquila, solicita el crédito para la compra de un equipo para mejorar el sonido del disco movil, realizara la compra el Guayaquil ya que al contado le dan un descuento, le gustaria a futuro tener mas equipos para mejorar su economia y poder sustentar a su familia, el desafio al que se enfrenta es la falta de trabajo, en su tiempo libre le gusta estar mesclando con sus equipos de musica.
texts.en:
Johny, 35, is married and has two children.  They live in Echeandia in the province of Bolivar.  He raises chickens and also has a business renting mobile sound equipment for events.  He is requesting a loan to buy better sound equipment which he will purchase in Guayaquil at a greater discount.  

In the future he would like to have more equipment to improve his economy to support his family.  The challenge he faces is the lack of work.  In his free time he enjoys mixing music on his equipment.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an industrial stove, kitchen utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Frista

texts.en:
Frista is 33 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Frista has been working hard to manage her produce business selling rice, beans, and cassava . 

To help expand her business, Frista has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, beans, and cassava, and will help Frista to generate greater profits and earn a higher income. Frista hopes that in the future, she will be able to sell at the national level.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans, and cassava

loans.name: Dinnah

texts.en:
Dinnah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Dinnah has been working hard to manage her restaurant business selling cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Dinnah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items like beans, meat, fish, and flour, and will help Dinnah to generate greater profits and have a variety of food for her customers. Dinnah hopes that in the future, she will be able to build rentals and open a new branch.

loans.use: to buy food items like beans, meat, fish, and flour

loans.name: Henrry Nicolas

texts.es: Henrry tiene 32 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos vive en Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar, tiene una mecanica y vende repuestos, solicita el crédito para arreglar el negocio y comprar mas repuestos, gracias a este crédito podra mejorar el taller, su sueño es salir adelante con su familia y en el negocio, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Henrry, 32, is married and has two sons.  He lives in Echeandia in the province of Bolivar where he runs an auto repair shop and sells spare parts.  He is requesting a loan to fix up his business and buy more spare parts.  Thanks to the loan he will have a better workshop.

His dream is to get ahead with his family and business.  In his free time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: to obtain working capital.

loans.name: Mariela Fernanda

texts.es: Mariela tiene 27 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar se dedica a verder ropa, edredones, y sabanas, solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia en quito ya que al comprar al contado le dan mas conveniente y puede ganar mas al momento de vender, su sueño es ponerse una tienda con ropa y zapatos, los desafios a los que se enfrenta son cuando sale de viaje a comprar la mercaderia ya que le pueden robar, en su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y dormir.
texts.en:
Mariela, 27, is single and lives with her parents in Echeandia in the province of Bolivar.  She sells clothing, comforters and sheets, and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in Quito.  By making her purchase in cash she can get a better price and earn more profit with sales.

Her dream is to open a clothing and shoes shop.  The challenge she faces is the risk of having her merchandise stolen when she goes shopping.  In her free time she enjoys watching television and resting.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 27 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Juma has been working hard to manage his garments business, selling trousers, dresses, and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy trousers, dresses, and shoes, and will help Juma to generate greater profits and increase his daily income. Juma hopes that in the future, he will be able to build houses.

loans.use: to buy trousers, dresses, and shoes

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 41 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Steven has been working hard to manage his bar, selling beer, soda, water, and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer and soda, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and increase his income. Steven hopes that in the future. he will be able to build rentals .

loans.use: to buy beer and soda

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: Thavy is 52 years old and has five children living in Mondulkiri province. She has been growing cassava and working on other farms for a fee for about four years and she can make around 36,200 KHR per day from her business. Thavy has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid back the loan. The previous loan helped her family to have better living conditions. Now, she is applying for this new Kiva loan to pay for the labor fee in order to grow cassava. She hopes to expand her business so it is bigger than last year.

loans.use: to pay the labor fee in order to grow cassava

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора 55 летняя швея. Она любительница этой деле. Гулнора любить кроить и сшить, и до сегодняшнего дня продвигает любимую делу, и хочет еще много лет заниматься этой деятельностью. Дай Бог ей здоровье, чтобы достичь своей целей. Гулнора счастливая мама и бабушка. У нее двое дочери, и один сын. Дочери замужем и имеют детей.  Сын тоже женат и отец детей. Гулнора из города Душанбе. Она 25 лет своей жизни занята швеей. Гулнора шьет женское национальное платье. У нее есть только один источник дохода. Сидя дома она трудится и зарабатывает. Гулнора хочет купить новую швейную машинку для продвижения бизнеса, потому что ее старая машинка уже не в рабочем состоянии. Она решила обратиться за кредитом. Гулнора верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a 55-year-old seamstress. She loves this business. Gulnora loves to cut and sew, and to this day carries out her favorite work, and wants to be doing it for many more years to come. May God give her the health to achieve her aims. Gulnora is a happy mother and grandmother. She has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and have children. Her son is also married and the father of children.

Gulnora is from the city of Dushanbe. She has been engaged in sewing for 25 years of her life. Gulnora sews women's national dresses. She has just one source of income. Sitting at home, she labors and earns. Gulnora wants to buy a new sewing machine to advance her business because her old sewing machine is not in working condition. She has decided to apply for a loan. Gulnora believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 45 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Fred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho flour, rice and beans. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more posho flour, rice and beans, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: buy more posho flour, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is a generous woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1966 and now is living in village with her family. She is married and has children. She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. At the same time she is a teacher at secondary school. 

Last year she participated at “Best Business plan of the year” competition among women entrepreneurs and also participated at business training “Women entrepreneur – achieve success” provided by NABWT. After training she appealed to IMON to get a loan to enlarge her working capital to buy natural chemicals, fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy natural chemicals, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mahram

texts.en:
Mahram is a kind woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is living in remote district with her family. She is widow and has three children. After her husband's death it was hard for her to feed and ensure her children. For almost nine years she has been doing business selling shoes. Her son helps her to do business. 

A new season has come and she needs to buy a new assortment of shoes. She is asking financial support from IMON and Kiva to buy a new assortment of shoes. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes to help support her family

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Thanks for being a part of Rosalita's journey. With your previous financial support, she did establish her direct selling business, resulting into a more profitable source of income. Also with that, she was able to start up another trade where she sells frozen products like meat. You are such a blessing! 

For now, she's been so dedicated and passionate into cultivating her business. Though there's a fact that her everyday journey with this is not as smooth-sailing as she dreams, her perspective and will to change her family's state makes her attitude towards the goal flip. 

She's been looking forward for more opportunities to grow her inventories. Since her direct selling business is already stable, she now wants to improve her another business. Once more, she would like to ask your help. She's borrowing a 45,000 peso loan that would hand her enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef to sell. She prays that you'll allow her with this. 

She has proven once that she's faithful in repaying. And she hopes that you trust her once again. With hope and faith, she believes that through this, she'll be able to earn well for her children's education. She wants to finish schools for future securities. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 29-year-old single man who lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. For the past two years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his clothing store. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy dresses, blouses and shoes, and will help him to stock more products and generate greater profits. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a garments wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his store

loans.name: Sayby

texts.ru: Saibi is a generous woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is living in rural area with her family. She is educated and bright person. She is a teacher rat secondary school.  She teaches history and law almost 33 years. Her standard of living is normal. She appealed to IMON asking financial help to buy every day necessary items as food and clothing. Recently, her wage is not enough to cover all expenditures. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.
texts.en:
Saibi is a generous woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is living in rural area with her family. She is educated and bright person. She is a teacher at secondary school.  She has been teaching history and law almost 33 years. Her standard of living is normal. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial help to buy every day necessary items as food and clothing. Recently, her wage is not enough to cover all expenditures. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy every day necessary items, as food and clothing, as her teacher's salary is low

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en: Ibodat is a hardworking woman. She was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in 1968 and is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician and she is a business woman. She trades agricultural products as wheat and sliced carrots at the domestic market. She has regular customers every day. She likes her activity, it brings her satisfied income. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to buy agricultural products as wheat, carrots, etc. to retail. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products as wheat, carrots, etc. to retail

loans.name: Tasila

texts.en:
Tasila is 47 years old. She is married and has three children who all go to school. She has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of growing her her business come true by adding Zoona mobile money transfer business and having access to capital finance. Tasila needs a loan to make her dream a reality. 

When Tasila finished secondary school, she started running a grocery shop. She describes herself as a hard worker who has passed through a lot of ups and downs in her life. She says this makes her very strong and focused in whatever she applies herself to. 

Tasila will use this loan to start running the business of mobile money by purchasing a trading booth, which she can use to serve her customers. She will also use the money to facilitate transactions. Tasila explains how running her mobile money transfer business will give her the opportunity to improve her families basic needs. This prospect excites her and she cannot wait to begin operating her own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth which she will use to start running her own Zoona Mobile Money transfer business and provide financial services to people in her community

loans.name: Kimeang's Group

texts.en:
Kim Eang is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is ages 36 years old and a mother of three children and two among them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Nowadays, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income and working as a construction worker is the additional source of income for her family. She has been involved in this business about seventeen years and her daily income is around 48,100KHR per day. 

Due to lack of fund, she is now leading a group of four to take a new loan via VisionFund and she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to earn more income and have the ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her agricultural supplies business, which sells items like seeds and herbicides. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy agriculture chemicals and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to establish a farm.

loans.use: to buy agriculture chemicals

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em gaza tem 62 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 11 filhos dos quais 8 são menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe e seus netos que vivem em sua casa.
É reformado onde aufere uma pensão que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois enfrentando dificuldades para aumentar o volume da sua criação solícita um empréstimo para adquirir pintos, ração e vitaminas. Este é seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku, sendo que os últimos 2 foram aplicados para a mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura e expandir mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
He was born in Gaza. He is 62 years old, married, and the father of eleven children. Eight of them are adults and they all go to school. He maintains his mother and his grandchildren, who live with him.

He is retired and receives a pension, which he uses to cover the home expenses. He is facing difficulties to increase his chicken production, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy chickens, animal feed and vitamins. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and he gave the previous ones the same use.

In the future, he plans to buy a vehicle and expand his business even more.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah believes that a university degree is the only weapon in this world.  He is 23 years old and a university student majoring in medicine.
He is an example of a man who will not stop trying to get to what he wants. Hamzah wants to become successful and to be an important person in the future but that does not mean anything, but only means a guy who is ambitious and has perseverance.

Hamzah wants to complete his study in medicine but his family is facing financial problems, therefore he applied for an educational loan to cover his university fees and be able to graduate and be a good doctor and be able to help sick people in his country.

loans.use: To cover his university fees in medicine and graduate to be a good doctor.

loans.name: Kelys Patricia

texts.es: Kelys es una mujer de 26 años de edad que encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de la venta de mercancías en poblaciones aledañas al municipio de Soledad, sin embargo esta actividad le demandaba mucho tiempo fuera de su hogar y un esfuerzo físico agotador.  Su cónyuge recibió un dinero en la empresa donde laboraba y le dio el capital inicial para que iniciara un almacén misceláneo el cual es muy concurrido por los habitantes del sector del barrio donde habita  en el municipio de Soledad; sus clientes  encuentran a la mano  todo tipo de artículos de papelería, detalles, productos de cuidado de la piel, el cabello y productos de aseo como detergentes y suavizantes. Alterno a su almacén también alquila lavadoras y ha logrado consolidar un gran número de clientes en estos tres años de funcionamiento que en su gran mayoría son amigos, vecinos, familiares y referidos, su cadena de comercialización es precisamente a través de la oferta en su vitrina exhibidora, telefónicamente para el alquiler de las lavadoras y venta detergentes que es un producto gancho. Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. sus clientes pueden comprar sus productos o acceder a sus servicios, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, una lavadora y surtirá con nuevos artículos misceláneos.  Kelys es madre de dos hijos a quienes desea brindarle una buena educación y son su principal motivación y para continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Kelys is a 26 year old woman who found a way to grow commercially through the sale of goods in the communities surrounding the town of Soledad. However, this work demanded that she spent a lot of time away from her home and exhausting physical effort.
