Her partner received some money from the company where he works and he gave her the initial capital to open a general store that is very conveniently located for the people in the part of the neighborhood where she lives in the town of Soledad. Her customers can find at hand all types of stationary, skin care and hair care products, and laundry products  such as detergents and softeners. She also has washing machines that people can use. She has been able to build-up a good number of customers in the 3 years that she has been in business and the majority of them are friends, neighbors, family, and referrals. Her marketing chain happens through advertising specials in her display case, over the telephone for her washing machines, and detergents are a "hook" product for her. Every day, from 7am to 8pm, her customers can buy products or use her services. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she will have had from Fundacíon Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a display case and a washing machine, and stock-up on new products. Kelys is the mother of 2 children to whom she wants to offer a good upbringing and they are her greatest motivation to keep working.

loans.use: to buy a display case, a washing machine, and to stock-up with various new items.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Lusaka. He works as an accountant and operates his own mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to many unbanked individuals. People in his community go to his outlet to send and receive money as well as pay bills. He is married and has no children. 

Noah started running his own business so that he could increase his revenue stream and offer employment to the youths in his community. He currently employs one person who works at his shop. Noah has requested for a loan so that he can grow his business by adding more money in his business and purchasing some paint so that he can attract more people and serve them. This will ensure that customers are not turned away when they need to transact large amounts of money. 

Noah explains that the business of mobile money is highly dependent on how much money is in the business to service customers. Noah would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for financing business ventures like his. He looks forward to more engagement with the lenders through his updates.

loans.use: To have the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services in his community and also buy paint to improve the appearance of his office.

loans.name: Leygie

texts.en: Leygie has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their farm land in Ozamiz and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase fertilizer. This will ensure that the farm land is ready for harvest. Leygie knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Leygie hopes to buy a truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhey

texts.en:
Sokhey is a 23-year-old student who is studying Rural Development major in her third year at a university in the province. She resides in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhey is an only daughter whose father works as a worker in a nearby country and mother earns some income from the business of selling groceries. 

She is lacking the money to cover her university fees from now through her fourth year, so she would like to take out a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. This loan will help her have enough money for earning a bachelor’s degree with skills for her future job. In the future, Sokhey dreams of having a good job with a decent salary, so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to cover her university fees in studying for a degree in Rural Development from now through her fourth year

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladis, de 33 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta octavo grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos en que vivían sus padres; decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudar económicamente en los gastos de la casa.- Está acompañada y junto con su pareja tiene 2 hijos, de 14 y 10 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad, su pareja trabaja de jornalero en una platanera.

Gladys, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también trabaja cuidando un anciano desde hace 14 años, para llegar a su trabajo viaja en bus algunos kilómetros, trabaja todos los días solo tiene un día libre a la semana.

El crédito que está solicitando para comprar hierro y lámina para ampliar su vivienda y así darle mejor comodidad a su familia.

El sueño de Gladis, es que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales y puedan tener mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
33 year old Gladis is a housewife. She studied until the 8th grade but didn't continue her studies due to her parents' lack of economic resources. She decided to learn to work so that she could help with the household expenses. She has a partner and, together, they have 2 children who are 14 and 10 years old. Her children go to the education center in the community. Her partner works as a laborer in a plantation. 
Gladys takes care of the household and has also worked for 14 years looking after an elderly person. She takes the bus a number of kilometers to work. She only has one day of a week. 
She is requesting a loan to buy iron and galvanized sheets to extend her home and give her family greater comfort.
Gladis' dream is that her children will study to be professionals and that they will have better opportunities for good work.

loans.use: to buy iron and galvanized sheets to extend her home.

loans.name: Mangala

texts.en:
Mangala is 23 years old. She lives in a rented house with her six-year-old son. Mangala runs her own Zoona money transfer shops in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. Her business enables people to send and receive monies to and from their families and friends throughout the country. She says providing this service to people helps her pay for her rentals and son’s school fees. Her son is currently doing his grade one. 

Mangala started running her Zoona money transfer business last year. Business is good and she says the one thing holding her back is that she does not have enough working capital to serve her customers at the desired time. She says this makes her worry sometimes because she constantly has to run up and down trying to find some money. As a micro-entrepreneur, Mangala has found it very difficult to source working capital. She explains that the banks and most lending institutions need collateral. 

Mangala is taking out this loan so that she can increase her working capital float and grow her business by serving more customers, she will also use the loan to pay for a trading booth. “This Kiva loan is the only chance I have to grow my business and am grateful for this lifetime opportunity’’ Mangala says. Mangala has high hopes for her future. Her face brightens when she explains that her biggest dream is to see her business grow so that she can put her son through college and build her own house from the profits.

loans.use: To grow her business by adding funds needed to serve more people and pay for a Zoona branded trading kiosk

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is 23 years old and is studying English language in her second year.  She is an example of a high achiever university student. Her hopes are without borders, although she faced financial difficulties which prevented her from paying tuition, this did not stop her to try to achieve her dream.

Rawan has requested an educational loan to help her cover her university fees  She wants to graduate and find good work as a teacher to help her increase her income and help her family in their expense.

loans.use: To help her cover her university fees, where she is studying English Language.

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en:
Ermina is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business.She is married and has tree children, her husband is a farmer.  She is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy traditional clothes.She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future And she is happy whit this loan because to improving her living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothes for sale

loans.name: Flor De Manzana Colonia Mejia Group

texts.es:
Manuela (la segunda del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una joven de 29 años, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Manuela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica  a la elaboración de pelotas típicas.
Manuela gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo es una de las mejoras tejedoras de su comunidad por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, es por ello que ahora junto a un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para poder comprar hilos de tipo seda, alemán lustrina y mish para seguir coloreando los hermosos trajes de su comunidad.
Manuela tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder adquirir sus materiales y así mejorar sus ingresos para luego instalar un local donde pueda ella exhibir mejor su propio producto y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Manuela (the second on the right in the photo) is a 29 year old young woman who lives with her parents in the community of Chichicastenango. Because she was eager to earn an income and help her parents with the household expenses, she works making traditional clothing. She has been doing this for 5 years. To increase her income, she also makes fabric juggling balls.
Thanks to the effort that she puts into her work, Manuela is one of the best costumers in her community and she has many customers. This is why she is now requesting a loan, along with a group of other people, to buy silk thread, German embroidery thread, and 2-ply Mish thread so that she can keep coloring the beautiful costumes of the community. 
Manuela hopes to raise a loan so that she can buy more materials and, in this way, improve her income so that she can later set-up a store where she could better display her own work and so she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy silk thread, German embroidery thread, and 2-ply Mish thread.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael desire to go to school was already long, but because his family situation was not good, he applied to follow the Student Loan program of Kiva. Rafael lives in the township in the city center, in the area Pemalang. Both his parents have to work to pay for his school fees and also his brother, as well as for their daily needs. They have just enough income for daily living expenses. His father works as a construction worker on the island of Borneo, while his mother is a nurse at a private hospital in the region. 

Currently Rafael will be a student at The Academy Maritime Nusantara. He chose the Port Management program, because according to his ability and ideals he can work in the office of the National Transportation Agency.  Because he does not want to burden his parents, Rafael applying for loans from Kiva for the cost of his studies. Rafael is very grateful to the lenders who would help him in his studies, although they do not know him.

loans.use: to pay his education fees at The Academy Maritime Nusantara Port Management Program, for three years

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Bosco has been working hard to manage his Retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand his business, Bosco has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho flour, rice, beans, and will help Bosco to generate greater profits and earn high profits. Bosco hopes that in the future he will be able to earn extra profits.

loans.use: buy posho flour, rice, beans

loans.name: Obdolia

texts.en:
Obdolia is 50 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Obdolia has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF. The most recent loan was through both NWTF and Kiva so that Obdolia could sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothing that is in great demand such as blouses, skirts, t-shirts, and jeans.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 24 years old. He earns his living by providing mobile money transfers in the city of Livingstone, Zambia. He lives in a rented house alone. Christopher relocated from his hometown of Lusaka upon completing his education in search of employment opportunities. He comes from a family of three. 

Christopher's days are spent serving customers and running up and down to the bank so that he can satisfy his customers. When he makes his bank runs, he has to close his trading booth as he currently works alone. This saddens him as he misses out on profits if sometimes he is not able to serve his customers at their time of need. This situation becomes worse when the bank closes as he cannot send any working capital that he has to the bank to convert it to cash. 

Christopher is taking out this loan so that he can increase his working capital and serve more customers conveniently. This loan will also be used to pay for the trading booth that he is currently using. Serving more customers will mean he will be able to earn more profits. He is very excited about the future prospects of growing his business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital for financial services and purchase a trading booth to ensure he never has to turn away customers

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his agriculture business, which deals in farming crops. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy weed spray and fertilizers which will help Francis to generate greater profits and expand the business. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy weed control spray and fertilizers

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 30 years, Mark has been working hard to manage his agriculture business, which deals in farming bananas. 

To help expand his business, Mark has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seedlings of bananas, and will help Mark to generate greater profits and expand the business. Mark hopes that in the future he will be able to earn profits.

loans.use: buy more banana seedlings to increase productivity and profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new farming tools, maize seeds and fertilizers for planting so as to get a better harvest and meet family needs.

loans.name: Medias

texts.en:
Medius is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Medius has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells grocery items like beans, carrots, green peppers. 

To help expand her business, Medius has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, carrots, green pepper, passion fruits, and will help Medius to generate greater profits and improve family wellbeing. Medius hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business

loans.use: buy more beans, carrots, green peppers, passion fruits etc

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Christina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.  Ma. Christina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Christina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Sokran

texts.en:
Sokran lives in Kratie province, she is 36 years old, and has two children who are all in school. The sources of her family’s income are from selling grocery items and fishing for ten years. Due to lack of fund to sell grocery items, she takes this first Kiva loan via VisionFund. 

Through the loan, she will use her loan portion to buy more vegetables for sale and taking the rest of money to buy a motorbike to support her current business. She expects this loan portion will help her to earn more income and ability to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale and to buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria, de 25 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, es empleada, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y junto con su esposo tienen 2 hijos de 2 años de edad y el segundo de 2 meses de nacido y su esposo trabaja en una platanera de la comunidad. 

Victoria, tiene un pequeño cafetín en la plaza de la comunidad, en donde prepara y vende tortas mejicanas, decidió trabajar en este negocio porque, observo que le generaba buenas ganancias; de esa manera logra apoyar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar, este negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años y lo aprendió gracias a una amiga.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar hierro y lámina para colocar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.

Victoria, sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos sanamente y poder darles la oportunidad que se prepararen academicamente.
texts.en:
25 year old Victoria is a very hardworking young woman. She has a job. She studied to high school, is married, and has 2 children with her husband - the first is 2 years old and the second was born 2 months ago. Her husband works on the plantation in the community. 
Victoria has a small cafeteria in the community square where she makes and sells Mexican tortas. She decided to open this business because she saw that it would generate good income. This enables her to help with the household expenses. She has been running this business for some years and she learned the work thanks to a friend.
She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy iron and galvanized sheets so she can put a roof on the corridor of her house.
Victoria dreams of seeing her children grow-up healthy and of being able to give them the opportunity to prepare academically.

loans.use: to buy iron and laminated sheets to put-up a roof on the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Tete tem 32 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe e uma filha adoptada que vive em sua casa.
Trabalhanuma instância turistica a mais de 2 anos onde aufere o salario que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo ração, pintos e vitaminas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende construir uma residência para o seu filho. O seu maior desafio é o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Hortencia was born in Tete, is 32 years old and is the single mother of 2 small children. She is responsible for her mother and an adopted daughter who both live in her house.

She has been working at a tourist resort for more than 2 years and she puts her salary towards her household expenses. She requests a loan to increase the volume of her business raising chickens for slaughter, by buying rations, chicks and vitamins. This is her 1st loan with Hluvuku.

In future she plans to build a home for her son. Her biggest challenge is her children's education, all the way through to college.

loans.use: buy rations, chicks and vitamins

loans.name: Edmon

texts.en:
Edmon is 29 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Edmon has been working hard to manage his agriculture business, which deals in farming beans, bananas and coffee. 

To help expand his business, Edmon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas coffee, beans and will help Edmon to generate greater profits and increase level of farming. Edmon hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits.

loans.use: buy bananas coffee, beans

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 28 years old, married and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past six years, Willy has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Willy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods for the shop, and will help Willy to generate greater profits. Willy hopes that in the future he will be able to grow the business even further.

loans.use: buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Agness has been working hard to manage her retail business selling fire wood. 

To help expand her business, Agness has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood, and will help her to generate greater profits and meet her family's basic needs. Agness hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental accommodation.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em manjacaze província de gaza, tem 54 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 1 filho maior de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 enteados que vivem em sua casa.
É negociante de roupa usada no mercado informal vulgo a mais de 15 anos de onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois para satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo fardo de roupa usada. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio de venda de roupa.
texts.en:
Lucinda was born in Manjacaze in the province of Gaza, is 54 years old and lives with her partner. She is the mother of 1 child who is already of age and is also responsible for 2 step-children who live in her home.

She has been a second hand clothes trader at the informal market for more than 15 years and puts the money she makes towards her household expenses. To satisfy her customers' demands, she requests a loan to increase the volume of her business by buying a bale of used clothes. This is her 7th loan with Hluvuku.

In future she plans to expand her clothes selling business.

loans.use: buying a bale of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Geofrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Geofrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods, and will help Geofrey to generate greater profits and increase sales. Geofrey hopes that in the future he will be able to get more profits.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods for his general store

loans.name: Achwak

texts.en:
Achwak is a 24-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and five siblings.  

She has worked from her house as hairdresser since 2012. In addition, she works in a beauty salon in her town. 

Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase hairdressing equipment. She is very eager to receive those purchases as she wants only to satisfy her customers' demands. 

In the future, she hopes to open her own beauty salon where she will receive her customers appropriately.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing equipment.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Bernadette works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Bernadette has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Bernadette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 31 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her bar and restaurant business. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks, and it will help Gorret to generate greater profits and expand the business. 

Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase another plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more drinks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with none of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which sells motor spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy engine oil and spanners, and it will help Betty to generate greater profits and repair her car. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big spare parts shop.

loans.use: to buy engine oil and spanners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stable stall and add more stock for resale.

loans.name: Punyamala

texts.en:
Punyamala, 22, is a married woman from Falakata, West Bengal. She lives there with her husband, Kamal, who is a farmer. This young couple has no children at present. Punyamala is lucky enough that in her young age she had the opportunity to receive secondary education. 

Being a housewife, Punyamala helps her husband in farming, such as weeding and caring for the crops before harvesting the crops. They cultivate different vegetables in different seasons. The difficulties that have arisen along the way are the rising cost of farm inputs and the instability of prices for buying and selling vegetables. 

Now, as the family expenses are increasing day by day, Punyamala feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities. They have decided to cultivate chili in order to diversify their business. As chili is the universal spice of India and now grown around the world because it is widely used as spice or vegetable and as medicine also, they have chosen this crop.

So Punyamala is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies, such as chili seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm resources to start cultivation. She hopes her family income will increase because her household expenses depend on this work. She wishes to upgrade her small hut into a concrete house with the profit generated by her business.

Punyamala conveys her thanks to her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary agricultural supplies for chili cultivation.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children with five of them currently in school. 

For the past 5 years, Gloria has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and it will help Gloria to generate greater profits and get school fees. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to build rentals.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with one of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells reams of paper, books, staplers, sauce pans, detergent, etc. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy reams of paper, books, staplers, sauce pans, detergent, etc., and it will help Oliver to generate greater profits and stock the shop. 

Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to become Kigumba's wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper, books, staplers, sauce pans and detergent.

loans.name: Victor Eugenio

texts.es: Victor de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) tiene 32 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Victor is 62 years old, and he lives in his own home with his wife and son. He makes a living farming staple grains (corn and beans). He has 32 years of experience working in this occupation. Victor sells his products in neighboring villages. With his earnings, he has managed to cover some of the expenses of his household. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, etc. Through this, he will be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ofelia, de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta 9º grado, debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios, está casada y su  esposo se dedica a la albañilería y estructuras metálicas desde hace varios años, juntos tienen 4 hijos de 33, 27, 24 y 19 años de edad, de los cuales 2 de ellos ya tienen sus propios hogares, actualmente vive con dos hijos, su nuera y dos nietos.

Ofelia, trabaja como modista, este trabajo lo aprendió en la academia de corte y confección desde hace 10 años y trabaja en su casa.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar madera, clavos y hierro para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que cuando llueve traspasa el agua y cae dentro de la casa.

El sueño de Ofelia, es poder mejorar aún más su vivienda, para que su familia viva más segura y poder tener un negocio con el cual pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 53 years old, and she is a housewife. She completed school through the 9th grade, but due to a lack of financial resources, she wasn't able to continue with her studies. She is married, and her husband has made a living in masonry and metal construction for several years. Together they have 4 children, ages 33, 27, 24, and 19. Of their children, 2 of them now have their own homes. Currently, Ofelia lives with two of her children, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren.

Ofelia works as a dressmaker in her home. She learned how to do this work in the academy of dressmaking 10 years ago.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of wood, nails, and iron to improve the roof of her home, since when it rains the water runs through and leaks into her home.

Ofelia's dream is to be able to improve her home even more, so that her family can live more securely. Also, she dreams of being able to have a business through which she is able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy woods, nails, and iron to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 10 años, inicio con capital propio y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas etc. y así poder continuar con sus siembras para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosalina is 36 years old, and she is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children. She has made a living farming corn and sorghum for 10 years. She began this work with her own capital, and with the profits she has earned, she has managed to take care of some of the expenses of her household. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, etc. Through this, she will be able to continue farming to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro Rafael

texts.es: Álvaro es un microempresario de 40 años al que no le fue fácil incorporarse a la vida laboral, sin embargo, la falta de oportunidades no fue un obstáculo en su vida, al contrario, permitió un crecimiento interior que lo llevó a continuar, fue así como convirtió su carro en su herramienta de trabajo que le sirvió para ofrecer el servicio de transporte y de encomiendas a conocidos, familiares y vecinos, que por sus actividades viajan diariamente a diferentes municipios; posteriormente en uno de sus viajes  identificó otra oportunidad de negocio,  la comercialización de queso el cual vende a amigos, familiares y vecinos. Actualmente Álvaro está aplicando a su primer Credikiva  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de llantas nuevas para su vehículo y reforzar su capital de trabajo para adquirir mayor cantidad de queso que le permitan atender la demanda de sus clientes. Uno de los deseos de Álvaro  es que su negocio sirva para atender las necesidades de su familia y, sobre todo que le permita reunir los ahorros suficientes para adquirir un vehículo nuevo.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a 40-year-old micro-entrepreneur. It hasn't been easy for him to assimilate himself into a life of work. However, lack of opportunity has not an obstacle in his life. On the contrary, this has enabled him to grow internally and carry on. As a result, Álvaro turned his car into a tool for work, offering transport and parcel delivery services to acquaintances, relatives and neighbors who travel daily to different towns because of their occupations. During one of his trips, he identified another business opportunity - the commercialization of cheese which he sells to friends, relatives and neighbors.

Currently, Álvaro is applying for his first Credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He is thinking of using this loan to buy new tires for his vehicle, and to strengthen his working capital to buy obtain larger quantities of cheese that will enable him to meet the demand of his customers. One of Álvaro's desires is that his business is able to provide for his family's necessities. Above all else, he wishes to save enough money to get a new vehicle.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle, and strengthen his working capital to obtain larger quantities of cheese.

loans.name: Mujeres Sector 1 Cruz B, Santa Lucia Utatlan Group

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 4 y 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Lucía Utatlán.
Olga (es la señora de en medio de blusa verde menta) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la crianza de ganando y elaboración de pan, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 10 años.
A Olga  le gusta mucho convivir con los animales es por eso que ahora solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de señoras  para poder comprar un ganado de tipo bovino  y dedicarse a criarlo para luego venderlo a un buen precio, pues ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder adquirirlo.
El gran sueño de Olga es que su negocio de panadería crezca y seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old, and she is married. She has a nice family with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 16. This humble family lives in a community in Santa Lucía Utatlán.

Olga (the woman in the middle with the mint green blouse), with the desire to earn more income and move her family forward, makes a living raising cattle and making bread. She has been doing this work for 10 years.

Olga really likes to live alongside animals, and she is now requesting a loan with a group of other women to buy a cow. She will raise it and sell it later at a good price. She doesn't have sufficient money to be able to purchase it herself. Olga's great dream is that her bakery grows and she is able to continue supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 37 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essential commodities for the shop, and it will help Edward to generate greater profits and expand the business. 

Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities for the shop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his furniture business, which sells furniture. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy timber and wood varnish, and it will help Isaac to generate greater profits and boost business. 

Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to become a renowned supplier.

loans.use: to buy timber and wood varnish.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is divorced and has five children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past three years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, soap, rice, and posho, and it will help Catherine to generate greater profits and boost business. 

Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to become a charcoal supplier.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, rice, and posho.

loans.name: Razanamalala

texts.fr:
Femme de 63 ans,Razanamalala est mère de neuf enfants dont six déjà mariés et les trois encore à sa charge fréquentent encore l'école. Son mari est collecteur et marchand des produits agricoles dans les campagnes. 
Quant à Razanamalala, elle exerce une activité de fabrication et vente de produit alimentaire: le fameux "koban-dravina", une sorte de gâteaux ou cake de spécialité typiquement Malagasy qu'on trouve nul part ailleurs et très apprécié même par les étrangers. les ingrédients nécessaires sont: farine de riz malagasy, sucre, poudres de pistaches, et feuilles de bananier pour  la couverture. 
Razanamalala est une femme travailleuse infatigable, même avec son âge avancé, elle s'efforce toujours d'épargner pour prévoir sa retraite et surtout pour pouvoir financer l'éducation de ses enfants. De plus, elle désire pouvoir construire un hangar pour servir de lieu de vente  des produits de collecte de son mari.
texts.en:
A woman of 63, Razanamalala is the mother of nine children of whom six are already married; the three who are still her dependents are still attending school. Her husband buys and resells agricultural produce from the countryside. 

As for Razanamalala, she excels at making and selling a sweet treat, the well-known "koban-dravina", a sort of cake that is a typical Malagasy specialty found nowhere else and much appreciated, even by foreigners. The necessary ingredients are Malagasy rice flour, sugar, ground peanuts, and banana leaves for the wrapping.  

Razanamalala works tirelessly. Even at her advanced age, she always tries hard to put aside savings for retirement and especially to be able to pay for the education of her children. Moreover, she would like to build a shed to serve as a sales point for the produce collected by her husband.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice flour from Madagascar, and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Andrianjaka Liliane

texts.fr:
32 ans, mariée, Andrianjaka Liliane est une mère de famille débrouillarde et dynamique. Elle a 2 enfants âgés de 3 et 8 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. Son époux travaille en tant que gardien chez un particulier.
Comme activité génératrice de revenu, Andrianjaka Liliane exploite une vente des chaussures à l'occasion, il y a maintenant 5 ans. C'est une femme très simple qui s'efforce de constituer beaucoup d'épargne pour prévoir le futur. 
Son objectif professionnel est de développer et étendre son commerce: y investir davantage pour pouvoir ouvrir d'autres points de vente afin d'augmenter le revenu. Son rêve est de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une meilleure qualité de vie et surtout une meilleure éducation
texts.en:
Thirty-two years old and married, Andrianjaka Liliane is a resourceful and hard-working mother of a family. She has two children ages 3 and 8 who are both enrolled in a private school. Her husband works as a guard for an individual. 

In order to earn income, Andrianjaka Liliane  has had a shop selling used or reduced-price shoes for five years now. She is a very simple woman who tries hard to put aside lots of savings for future needs. Her professional goal is to develop and extend her business: invest more into it so as to have other sales points and thus grow her earnings. Her dream is to be able to offer her children better living conditions and especially a better education.

loans.use: to buy bales of used shoes

loans.name: Fedora

texts.es: Con el ánimo de generar ingresos y apoyar económicamente a su familia, Fedora de 38 años de edad es una microempresaria madre de seis hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró levantar su propio negocio siendo este un pilar fundamental para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Inició hace un año ofreciendo a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside en una urbanización en el municipio de Barranquilla, productos cosméticos, capilares, perfumes y cremas corporales, con gran acogida que decidió vincularse con una empresa especialista en  ventas por catálogo, su negocio ha crecido con la llegada de nuevos clientes; esta emprendedora se proyecta hacia  el futuro con mucha más cobertura, brindándole  a su clientela lo mejor en cuanto a precios, calidad, cantidad y otros aspectos  que el cliente prefiere siempre, “un buen servicio que es lo más gratificante”.  Ella está aplicando para su primer CrediKiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual planea invertir en perfumes, cosméticos y productos capilares para atender la demanda de nuevos clientes. Entre sus planes a futuro está el deseo de seguir creciendo y con la generación de un mejor ingreso poder mejorar la infraestructura del apartamento donde reside.
texts.en:
With the desire to generate income and support her family financially, Fedora, 38 years old, is a small business woman and mother of six children. With great effort and dedication she has been able to build her own business, and it is a fundamental pillar in the support of her household. 

A year ago, she began to sell cosmetic and hair products, perfumes and body creams to her family members, friends and neighbors in the development in the municipality of Baranquilla, with great response. Therefore, she decided to involve herself with a company that specializes in catalog sales. Her business has grown with the arrival of new customers. 

This entrepreneur envisions having much more selection in the future, offering her customers the best in terms of prices, quality, quantity and other aspects that the customer always prefers. “Good service is the most rewarding”. 

She is applying for her first CrediKiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest it in perfumes, cosmetics and hair products to satisfy new customer demand. Among her plans for the future is the desire to continue to grow, and by generating a better income, to be able to improve the infrastructure of the apartment she lives in.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, cosmetics and heir products to meet the demands of new customers.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline est une femme dynamique de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants âgés entre 6 à 16 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés dans des écoles privées.
Pauline et son mari exercent ensemble une activité de fabrication et vente de sambos il y a déjà maintenant 16 ans. Elle possède donc tant d'années d'expérience en la matière. Ainsi, elle a déjà beaucoup de client actuellement mais ceci ne l'empêche pas d'en chercher encore, elle trouve chaque mois au moins un nouveau client. La famille a pu construire une petite maison qu'elle loue avec les bénéfices et les épargnés tirées de l'activité. c'est une des motivations qui la pousse à continuer à développer et à étendre son exploitation.
Son désire est d'instaurer une petite entreprise individuelle de fabrication de sambos suivant le norme.
texts.en:
Pauline is a hard-working woman of 42. She is married and the mother of four children aged between 6 and 16 who are all enrolled in private schools. 

Pauline and her husband have been working together at making and selling sambosas (meat-filled, fried pastries) for 16 years now. This means she has a lot of years of experience in this field. She already has plenty of customers, but that does not stop her from looking for more. Every month she finds at least one new customer. 

Using the profit and savings from their business, the family has been able to build a little house that she rents out. This is one thing that motivates her  to continue to develop and expand her business. Her desire is to open up a little individual firm making sambosas according to proper standards.

loans.use: to buy onions, ground beef, cooking oil, charcoal, flour, and a pasta machine

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine is 45-years-old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Faustine has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Faustine has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Faustine to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Faustine hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her business.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 43-years-old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, William has been working hard to manage his rentals business, which operates rental houses and a retail shop. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build more rentals, and will help William to generate greater profits and maintain status. William hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to build more rentals and a retail shop

loans.name: Rumalda

texts.es: Doña Rumalda de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y también a la venta de tamales, tiene 10 años de experiencia en la actividad, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando puertas y ventanas pero como no cuenta con suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra y así tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Rumalda is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She sells fruits and vegetables, as well as tamales. She has ten years of experience in this work. 

She would like to improve her house by changing the doors and windows but doesn't have sufficient capital. She is requesting a loan to buy doors and windows and pay the workers, and thus have a better home.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and pay the workers.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry has five children and only one of them is in school. Her age is 47-years-old.  She lives in Kampong Cham province and she has grown cassava and cashew nut trees for twenty-nine years. Her daily income is about 64,600KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

Now, she is applying to take her first Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will manage her loan to buy seeds and pay labor fees for her farming. She hopes to buy more farmland to extend her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay labor fees for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 35-years-old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her bar & restaurant, which sells soft drinks, beers and food. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food and drinks, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hijo, ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 7 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo las paredes ya que están hechas de lamina pero como no tiene de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y así poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and her son. 

She has sold cosmetics for 7 years, and with what she earns from her sales she is able to cover some household expenses. She wants to improve her home by building walls, since they are made of tin, however, she does not have enough money. 

She is seeking a loan to buy building materials in order to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, who is in his early sixties, is a divorcee with two children who are grown-up.  He has been selling spare parts for ten years now.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Francis' 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the spare parts stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for its support.  He used the profit to pay college fees, to repay loans and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast moving spare parts and meet his customer's requirements. He dreams of having his spare parts business reach an international level.

He will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy fast moving spare parts and meet his customer's requirements.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 20 años comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas etc. Y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Abelardo is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has worked growing basic grains for 20 years. He sells his product in the area surrounding his home. He is requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc. so that he can have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of snack food to sell to customers.

Lucia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Lucia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack food to sell to customers.
